loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling used clothing in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising chickens.  Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF, to purchase more sacks of used clothes to sell for her business selling used clothing.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her hardware business

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.es: Jonathan es un pescador de la zona, el tiene un pequeño bote que le ayuda todos los días a salir a pezcar.  EL es el único sustento para su familia y sus 3 hijas, y la pesca significa el único ingreso familiar. El tuvo problemas con su bote y necesita de un préstamo de novecientos veinte mil colones (920.000) para poder arreglar el bote, ya que hasta el momento no ha podido salir a pescar. Con este préstamo el va a poder arreglar el medio de transporte para su sustento y así seguir ayudando a su familia ofreciéndoles el sustento diario.
texts.en: Jonathan is a fisherman in the area. He has a small boat that helps him go fishing every day. He is the only source of support for his family and his three daughters. Fishing is his only source of income. He had problems with his boat, and he needs a loan of nine hundred and twenty thousand colones (920.000) to fix the boat, because until this moment he has not been able to go fishing. With this loan, he will be able to fix the means of transport for his sustenance, and keep helping his family, offering them daily support.

loans.use: to fix his fishing boat.

loans.name: Jerilyn

texts.en:
Jerilyn is 26 years old and married, with one child in school.

Jerilyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jerilyn has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years, and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Jerilyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 49 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell, like soap, milk, sugar, etc.

Josephine has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, like soap, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is married, and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and vegetable vending businesses. Mary Grace is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Mary Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lesolde

texts.en:
Lesolde is a hardworking entrepreneur who has owned a restaurant in the Philippines for the past 21 years. She makes additional money raising pigs.

Through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF Lesolde has been sustaining her restaurant. She is applying for a 8500 PHP to buy ingredients such as vegetables, meat and spices for her menus.

Lesolde dreams of repairing and renovating her family’s home in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as vegetables, meat and spices for her menus.

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en: A local resident living in Kandal province, Sitha is 48 years old and a mother of two children. For her family condition, she sells grocery items as her main source of income. Moreover, her husband is a house builder. This is her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. She will spend her entire loan portion to pay the tuition fee for her son, who wants to pursue a Bachelor's degree, majoring in Finance and Banking. She hopes that her son can get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: To pay the tuition fee for her son, who wants to pursue a Bachelor's degree, majoring in Finance and Banking.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en: Zamira is a business woman. She was born in 1966 -- rural area. She is divorced and has one child. She feeds her family alone. She works a long time. Her business is working with fruits. She dries fruits and sells them in rural markets. She made beneficial the standard of family living. She is planning to widen her business. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 Somoni to buy dried fruits to increase working capital. She awaits your mercy and thanks you in advance for your generosity.

loans.use: To buy dried fruits to increase working capital

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
Mavluda was born in 1964 and is divorced. She lives in a rural part of northern Tajikistan.

For the past fifteen years Mavluda has been a seamstress, sewing both traditional and European dresses. She works hard to deliver good quality, up-to-date designs for her clients. Even though there is a lot of competition is this field, she has many satisfied customers.

Mavluda would like to borrow 800 TJS through IMON International to buy an energy-efficient heater for her house.

loans.use: to buy an energy-efficient heater for her house.

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.en: Zarrina is a business woman. She was born in 1970 – northern part of Tajikistan. She lives in a rural area. She is married and has two children. Zarrina has been doing business for eight years. She dries fruits and sells them in a rural market. She feeds and growth alone her children. She needs financial support for educating her children. She wants to increase working capital, maximize profit, and in this way educate her children. Her dream is to see how her children are successfully educated and profession.  She is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni to buy dried fruits to increase working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy dried fruits to increase working capital

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa is 29 years old, married and has three children who are in school. She is a rice farmer in the Philippines.

Marisa has been farming rice for fifteen years now and has taken out three prior loans through NWTF to support her efforts. She has applied for a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

In the future Marisa would like to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies for her rice fields

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 58 years old and a widow with eight children, one of whom is in school. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Nida is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

Nida has been farming rice for 24 years and also earns additional income from tricycle passengers. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Gabriela Adriana

texts.es:
Gabriela es una joven mujer de 25 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos y estudia la carrera de economía.
Ella es Inteligente, generosa, comprensiva, paciente, buena oyente, solidaria y responsable. Su carrera la estudia en la universidad pública que se caracteriza por ser la más antigua de la ciudad y cuenta con la certificación a nivel internacional para la validez de su título profesional.
Gabriela es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo amarrado, su lengua materna es el Aymará que no utiliza porque habla español en su carrera y estudia el idioma inglés para la comprensión de algunos textos de su carrera. Vive en casa de sus padres, que es propia y está construida de ladrillo, cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y gas. Sus estudios son a nivel licenciatura en economía y se encuentra finalizando su 5 y ultimo año; ella está en condiciones de insertarse competitivamente en el mercado laboral y profesional tanto del área privada, como en la administración pública, capacitada para formular e implementar  instrumentales, técnicas, políticas y estrategias para el desarrollo de la región. “La economía es la ciencia que estudia los recursos, la creación de riqueza y la producción, distribución y consumo de bienes y servicios, para satisfacer las necesidades humanas…” comenta. Su sueño es ejercer su profesión y continuar con los proyectos en los que trabaja. Ella desea pagar los tramites de titulación, compra de formularios, certificados, memoriales, etc., para obtener su titulo académico. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años de estudios universitarios.
Es por esos motivos que Gabriela solicita un préstamo para pagar los trámites universitarios que significa la obtención de un título académico de licenciatura.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a young woman who is 25 years old, single, without children, and she studies a degree in economics. She is smart, generous, understanding, patient, a good listener, caring, and responsible. She studies her degree at the public university, which is characterized by being the oldest in the city, and includes a international certification for the validity of her academic degree. 
Gabriela has a dark complexion, short height, and black tied hair. Her mother tongue is Aymará, which she does not use because she speaks Spanish for her studies, and she studies the English language to understand some texts for her degree. She lives at home with her parents, which they own, and is made of brick, has potable water, electricity, and gas. Her studies are at the bachelor’s level in economics, and she is finishing her fifth and last year. She is in the condition of introducing herself competitively in the labor and professional markets, in the private area as well as in public administration. She is trained to formulate and implement tools, techniques, policies and strategies for the development of the region. “Economy is the science which studies resources, the creation of wealth and the production, distribution and consumption of goods and services, to satisfy human needs…” she says. 
Her dream is to practice her profession and continue the projects in which she works. She wants to pay for the procedures of her qualification, buy the forms, certificates, memorials, etc. to obtain her academic degree. In five years of university studies, this is her first loan sequence with the institution.
It is for these reasons that Gabriela asks for a loan to pay for university procedures, in order to obtain her bachelor’s academic degree.

loans.use: to pay for university procedures, in order to obtain a bachelor’s academic degree.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Theresa works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and general store businesses. Theresa is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Theresa has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Rachel works hard to support her family.

She has a junk shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from frozen foods. Rachel is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more recycled materials to sell.

Rachel has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Thida

texts.en: Thida is a 22-year-old single student. She is studying in her second year at University in a province. Her major is Banking and Finance.  She is from Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Due to the fact that she is short of finances to pay her tuition fees for three years, Thida has decided to take a loan. This loan will help her graduate successfully with a chance for a good job to build her future. For her dream, she wants to work in a bank.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees

loans.name: Resurecion

texts.en:
Resurecion signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari (variety) store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Resurecion was able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales, these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. 

Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 52 years old and married with three children.  

Narcisa is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Narcisa requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Narcisa has been raising pigs for six  years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain this. 

Narcisa would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Dolores is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF, to buy new supplies for her sewing machine.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Rosemarie works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a coffee shop and food-vending business. Rosemarie is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of groceries to sell for her general store business.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives with her five children and husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family; he has been running his own scrap business, and one of her sons has been running a mobile shop for the past three years. 

Abida's son wants to purchase different types of mobile accessories for his business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, Abida has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she’ll enable her son to purchase relevant items for his business purposes so that he can earn more profitable income to manage his business and household.

Abida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her son's mobile phone business

loans.name: Viet

texts.en:
Viet, 53, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampot province. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is in university. She can earn income to support her family via rice cropping on a 2-hectare area. Moreover, she raises pigs and chickens to earn more income. She has been involved in this business for ages, and it earns her about $5 USD per day. 

For Viet, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan portion to pay the tuition fee for her son who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree majoring in Information Technology. She hopes that her son can get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for her son who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree majoring in Information Technology.

loans.name: Ouy's Group

texts.en: A farmer from Kampot province, Ouy is 41 years old and a mother of five dependent children. To support her living, she grows rice as her main source of income, and raises cows to supplement her income. She has been involved in this business for ages, and it earns her about 17,000 KHR per day. This is Ouy's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan to buy a water filter. She hopes that she can improve her family's living in healthy conditions.

loans.use: To buy a water filter.

loans.name: Jackielyn

texts.en:
Jackielyn is 32 years old, married and lives at Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. In order to earn a living she takes in and raises pigs from her neighborhood. With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own. 

Through Paglaum MPC, she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. Now, she requests a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy additional feed. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of feeds

loans.name: Juan

texts.en: Juan has a banana farm in Tangub. This is his primary source of income for his family. Juan makes it a point to have good land preparation to have maximum yield and a good income. Recently, he needed an amount to pay for irrigation costs, for which he borrowed from Paglaum MPC. Juan wishes to sustain his business and be able to supply bananas in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to pay for labor on irrigation to soften tillage pans

loans.name: Logen

texts.en:
Logen is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on, single businesswoman who never gets too tired to help her parents with their family needs. She has a strong determination to pursue her goals. 

Recently, Logen availed herself of a loan to purchase bags of animal feeds. Aside from her project of concreting the pigpens, she thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 23 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Janice has a fishing business in the Philippines. Janice requested an 11,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Janice has been in this business for four years. In the future, Janice would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Susie Fe

texts.en:
Susie Fe is a hardworking mother from Lopez Jaena. She is 50 years old and a businesswoman who makes copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production). She buys whole coconuts for this. 

Susie Fe has signed up for her membership with the cooperative to gain access to insurance and credit. She applied for a loan to buy whole coconuts for making copra. Susie Fe hopes to succeed in this business to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts to make copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production)

location.town: Tangub-Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Jelma

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jelma works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Jelma is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Jelma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is married and she works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Julie has been in this business for three years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

She aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maria Nancy

texts.es: A sus 45 años de edad Maria es madre soltera, ella tiene 2 hijas una de 10 y otra de 17 años de edad, la joven de 17 años tiene una hija de 2 años, Maria vive en una casa que le presta un familiar y ahí vive con sus 2 hijas y su nieta, Maria y la mayor de sus hijas trabajan al jornal y también se dedican a criar animales menores, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos, ya que Maria  comenta  que ella es la cabeza de su hogar y tiene que velar por el bienestar de sus hijas.
texts.en:
At her 45 years of age, Maria is a single mother. She has two daughters; one  is 10, and the other is 17 years old. The 17 year old has a 2 year old daughter. Maria lives in a house a family member rents to her, and she lives there with her 2 daughters and her granddaughter.

Maria and her eldest daughter do day labor and they also raise small animals. The loan will be used to buy pigs, now that Maria comments that she is the head of the household, and she has to look out for the wellbeing of her daughters.

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the inventory of his business, which will permit him to generate more income for his family

loans.name: Cherry Mae

texts.en:
Cherry Mae is 43 years old and single. She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. 

She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy piglets, feeds and vitamins for her business. She has been in pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cherry Mae would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feeds and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 46 years old and married with eight children, and she works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 45,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

Annie has borrowed and repaid 27 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for 7 years, and she also earns income from buying and selling fruits and vegetables.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell

loans.name: Eglozy

texts.en:
Eglozy is 45 years and single, and she works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. 

Eglozy is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets for her fishing business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 45 years old and married with three children.

She is in the agricultural (poultry) business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her poultry.

She has been in the poultry business for 4 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF, and more recently through Kiva, to sustain it.

Shirley is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her poultry.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 59 years old and has four children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, chips, etc. She has been running the general store for 5 years, and also earns income from pig raising.

Elisa has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, chips, etc

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Jean works hard to support her family.

She has a frozen food business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy more frozen food to sell to customers.

Jean hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more frozen food to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her clothes  business

loans.name: Santa Clara Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Clara  forma parte del comité de mujeres, es de la Ciudad de Villarrica. Estas señoras ponen lo mejor de si para poder ser alguien en la vida y poder ayudar a sus seres queridos. Las mismas son señoras responsables, trabajadoras y solidarias entre si, y se ayudan mutuamente para salir adelante.
Ercilia es modista, muy buena en lo que hace, ya se ha hecho de muy buena clientela, es por eso que le va muy bien, poco a poco ha ido creciendo, y quiere seguir haciéndolo, ya que por medio de este trabajo ayuda a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Ercilia pide este préstamo para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo, luchando por poder crecer día a día. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con su trabajo y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Santa Clara group is a member of the women's committee of the city of Villarrica. These women do their best to become someone in their lives and to help the people they love. They are responsible, hard-working and caring among them, and they help each other to get ahead. 

Ercilia is a very good dressmaker who has a strong clientele. Her business has been growing little by little and she wants to keep working to help her family and loved ones. Ercilia is requesting a loan to buy fabric, thread, bands and others, so that she can keep working and growing every day. She is grateful for the opportunity to continue with her job and to help her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, bands and other items.

loans.name: Janita

texts.en:
Janita is a 52-year-old, married woman with six children, and she is a resident of the town of Dulag, Leyte. Two of her children are still attending school. Her husband earns a living as a carpenter. 

Janita works in producing and selling tuba wine (from coconuts). Aswell as this, she also makes and sells native mats made from buri or palm.

She is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy additional containers for tuba and tungog (the tungog gives the tuba its maroon color and bitter taste, and helps the natural fermentation). These additional materials will help her to produce and sell more tuba and that will help her cater to the needs of her customers. She will then be able to afford to buy good food and to cover the family's daily expenses.

Janita dreams of expanding her current business to make it successful, and she hopes that she can continue support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy additional containers for tuba (coconut wine) and tungog (which gives the tuba its maroon color and bitter taste, and helps the natural fermentation)

loans.name: Los Amigos X Siempre Group

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 39 años de edad, soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 14, 16 y 19 años, y su negocio es un taller de costura.
Ella es buena madre, alegre, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, generosa, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de ‘Cotoca’ que  es una pequeña localidad ubicado al este de la ciudad, es conocido por sus comidas típicas y su artesanía, especialmente de cerámicas. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados y durante todo el año.
María es de tez morena, cabello color castaño largo, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (sentada a la derecha, usa camiseta celeste y lentes). Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, y viven en una casa propia que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. La necesidad por mejorar su actividad económica la llevo a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de materiales de construcción, tejido de ropa de bebe, venta de papas fritas, venta de ropa deportiva, tienda de barrio, carnicería,  venta de sándwiches y artesanía en yeso, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios. Su negocio es la sastrería, ella cuenta con un taller de costura en su propio domicilio y se encarga de realizar arreglos a prendas como; subida de bota pié, arreglo del ancho de cintura, correcciones a prendas y otros, también realiza confección de vestidos de niña y pantalones de dama. Labor que realiza todos los días de la semana en horario continuo. “Forrar una prenda ¿sí o no? y es que forrar una prenda puede depender de muchas cosas, además de los gustos y costumbres de cada uno…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un taller de costura industrial y completo para satisfacer de mejor manera a sus clientes. Ella desea comprar material de trabajo como; telas, hilos y otros, para realizar pedido y entregar trabajos de calidad. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que María solicita un préstamo para la compra de material de confección por mayor para entregar trabajos de buena calidad.
texts.en:
María, 39, is single and has three children, ages 14, 16 and 19.  She works as a seamstress and is also a kind, cheerful, optimistic, happy, good-natured, responsible, hard-working mother.  Her business is set up in "Cotoca", a small area of the city which is known for its typical food and crafts, especially ceramics.  The climate is warm, tropical and humid with a daily temperature ranging from 21-35 degrees Celsius all year round.

María has a dark complexion, long chestnut hair and her mother tongue is Guaraní.  She speaks Spanish because of her general culture and in her work (she is seated on the right in a blue top, wearing glasses).  She lives with her children who attend school.  They live in their own house with running water, electricity and a sewage system.  A need to improve her economic activity led her to join a communal bank with businesses such as construction materials sales, knitting of baby clothes, fried food sales, sporting clothes sales, a convenience store, butchery, sandwich sales and plaster crafs.  Her business is tailoring and she has her own sewing shop set up at home.  She makes alterations such as raising hems, altering waistlines, and other clothing alterations.  "To line something, or not?  It depends on many things, such as the likes and customs of each person..." she says.  Her dream is to have an industrial sewing shop to satisfy her customers more easily.  

She wants to buy work materials such as fabric, thread and other items so she can deliver a high quality product.  This is her first loan through the institution in the 15 years that she has been in business.  María is requesting a loan to buy wholesale sewing materials for the orders she has.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials wholesale to deliver high quality products.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es: A sus 37 años de edad Ana es madre soltera, ella tiene 2 hijos, una de 13 años y un niño de 9 años, los niños están estudiando, ella se dedica a la elaboración de toda clase de figuras y manualidades en fomix y comercio de cerámicas, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de  fomix y de cerámica   y demás implementos para realizar sus trabajos, la aspiración de Ana es seguir trabajando y para tener los ingresos que cubran los gastos de educación de sus hijos.
texts.en: Ana, 37, is single and has two children, ages 13 and 9, who attend school.  She works making all kinds of figurines and crafts out of foam and also sells ceramics.  She will use to the loan to buy "Fomix" (foam) and ceramic, as well as tools for her work.  Ana's goal is to continue working to have an income to cover her children's education expenses.

loans.use: To buy ceramic and foam.

loans.name: Pablo José

texts.es: Pablo, es un hombre emprendedor de 58 años de edad, se encuentra dedicado a su negocio de salón de belleza, el cual inició en el año 1994, desde joven se desempeñó en esta actividad, él cortaba cabello en la terraza de su casa con una pequeña maquina y con el pasar el tiempo adecuo un local y emprendió su negocio formalmente.  El ofrece sus servicios de corte de cabello a caballeros y damas de cabello corto, su horario de atención es de lunes a domingo de 5 a.m. a 9 p.m., sus clientes están ubicados en el municipio de Santo Tomás, donde él también reside, Pablo cuenta con una clientela fidelizada, los cuales cancelan por los servicios ofrecidos de contado. En esta temporada decembrina, pablo necesita incrementar la capacidad de su negocio, así mismo adecuar su negocio para brindar un servicio mas eficiente, por esta razón él está aplicando a su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará dos sillas de peluquería y un aire acondicionado minisplit.  Pablo tiene 58 años de edad y es padre de un hijo de 17 años y una hija 15 de años, su meta familiar gira en torno a sus hijos a los que desea financiarles su carrera profesional.  Su gran desafío en el negocio son las escasas fuentes de financiación y su meta a largo plazo es hacerle adecuaciones a su local.
texts.en:
Pablo, 58, is an entrepreneur who is dedicated to his beauty salon business which he started in 1994.  He has worked in the field since he was young and used to cut hair with a small trimmer on the patio of his house.  Over time he set up a shop and started a formal business.  He cuts men's hair and women's short hair.  His working hours are Monday through Sunday from 5:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m.  His customers are from the town of Santo Tomás where he lives.  

Pablo says he has loyal customers who pay for the services in cash.  In this month of December, Pablo must increase capacity and step up the pace to provide a more efficient service.  Therefore, he is applying for his first loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to buy two barber chairs and a split air conditioning unit.

Pablo is 58 years old and has a 17-year-old son and a 15-year-old daughter.  His family goal focuses on his children who he wants to become professionals.  His greatest challenge is that in his sector there are few financing sources.  His long-term goal is to renovate his shop.

loans.use: To buy two salon chairs and a split air conditioning unit.

loans.name: Pablo Rigoberto

texts.es: Pablo es un joven soltero, el vive con sus padres y se dedica al comercio de ropa y adicionalmente es despachador de los buses, este crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para ofrecerla a sus clientes y amigos, lo que Pablo aspira de este negocio es seguir trabajando honradamente  para reunir algo de dinero y seguir preparándose a futuro que forme su hogar.
texts.en: Pablo is a young, single man who lives with his parents.  He sells clothing and also works as a bus dispatcher.  He will use the loan to buy clothing to offer customers and friends.  Pablo wants to continue working honestly to save money and continue preparing himself to form a family.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Amigos Por siempre Calle Chimborazo que se reúne cada quince días en Montecristi,  conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen  dos hijos de 18 y 11 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante. 
Doña Rosa es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para que su marido lo utilice en su labor, él se dedica al comercio,  vende gafas otras ciudades como, Bahía, Manta y en playas de Esmeraldas, su marido se va por una semana o 15 días a estos lugares y luego regresa a surtirse de mas mercadería, descasa unos días y vuelve  a sus recorridos, de esta forma el se gana el sustento de su familia ya son más de 20 años trabajando de esta forma. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar gafas de varios modelos. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque así ella puede ayudar a su marido. Sus sueños son tener un carro para que su marido realice sus recorridos.
texts.en:
The "Amigos por Siempre Calle Chimorazo" loan group meets every fortnight in Montecristi, an area known for its rich pre-colonial history, and for its handicrafts that are recognised across the country and around the world. It is from here that the Panama hat originates.

And it is here that 37-year-old Rosa lives. She is married and has two children - ages 18 and 11 - with her husband. Both children are attending school while Rosa's husband is a businessman. 

Rosa is a very good wife who is taking out this loan in order for her husband to use it at his business. He sells glasses in cities such as Bahía and Mata, and at the beaches of Esmeraldas. Rosa's husband travels to these places for a week or two to sell his goods, and then returns home to stock up again, to rest and then to return to his work. By doing this, Rosa's husband is able to support his family. He has been doing this work for more than 20 years,

Rosa is going to use this loan to buy various models of glasses. Rosa has been with the loan group since its creation and she likes it because she is able to help her husband. Rosa's dream is to own a car so that her husband can use it to travel.

loans.use: Comprar gafas.

loans.name: Nancy Elena

texts.es: Elena es madre soltera, tiene 28 años de edad y su hija tiene 6 años y asiste a la escuela, Elena tiene su negocio donde vende confites  y también productos de papelería, son 8 años que tiene este negocio y comenta que es de aquí de donde tiene para darle lo necesario a su hija, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos de papelería y de confites, esperando variar mejor su mercadería para que su papelería sea mas llamativa y mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en: Elena, 28, is a single mother and her six-year-old daughter attends school.  Elena has a business selling sweets and stationery goods.  She has been in business for eight years and says this is how she earns an income for everything her daughter needs.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy stationery goods and sweets.  She wants to have more variety so her shop will stand out and sales will increase.

loans.use: To buy stationery goods.

loans.name: Jeannie Rose

texts.en:
Jeannie Rose is a 36-year-old married woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She has been engaged in retail sales of cosmetic products for more than three years now. Jeannie Rose is also engaged in corn farming.

Jeannie Rose is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like lipstick, cosmetics, perfume, detergents and toiletries and fertilizer for the farm. This loan will allow her to improve her stocks, giving her the opportunity to sell more to her customers. In addition, she can also improve the productivity of her farm.

In the future, Jeannie Rose hopes to make her business successful and productive.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like lipstick, cosmetics, perfume, detergents and toiletries and fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and earns additional income from a personal products retail business. Josephine is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Diodalyn

texts.en:
Diodalyn is a 38-year-old married woman. She hails from Carles, Iloilo. Her husband has been a fisherman for 15 years now. Diodalyn helps him by making sure all his equipment is ready before he goes fishing. 

At present, Diodalyn wants to have their fishing boat repaired. She is asking for a loan of 35,000 PHP to buy plywood, adhesive and nails. This will help so that her husband can fish without any problems on the boat, thus maximizing their profit.

Any income generated will be for her family's daily consumption and for the school fees of her children ages 3, 12, 16 and 18.

loans.use: to buy plywood, adhesive and nails

loans.name: Ma. Anna

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ma. Anna works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of vegetables business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising pigs and selling frozen products. Ma. Anna is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of vegetables to sell for her buy and sell of vegetables business.

Ma. Anna has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of vegetables to sell

loans.name: María Jakeline

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Amigos Por siempre Calle Chimborazo que se reúne cada quince días en Montecristi  conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen  cuatro hijos de 18, 16, 14 y 10 años, estudian en universidad, colegio y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante. 
Doña María al igual que su marido se dedican al comercio, vende gafas y sombreros de paja toquilla, ellos se desplazan a otras ciudades como, Atacames, Salinas, Canoa, lugares donde llegan muchos turistas a quienes les gusta mucho lo que ellos venden,  ella solo viaja los fines de semana a Canoa mientras que su marido se va por 15 días a las otras playas lugar en el cual se queda hasta vender sus productos, luego regresa y descansa por una semana y vuelve a realizar sus viajes, de esta forma ellos se ganan la vida desde hace muchos años atrás. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar gafas y sombreros. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios que la institución ofrece. Sus sueños son ver que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The credit group 'Amigos Por Siempre' (Friends Forever) from the Chimborazo street get together every fortnight in Montecristi, a place well-known for its rich pre-colonial era cultural heritage and also for its handicraft products, which are famous both on a national and international scale.  It is here where the famous 'toquilla' straw hats are made.

This is where Maria, 42, lives.  She is married and has four children aged 18, 16, 14 and 10.  They are either studying at university, college or school.  Her husband is a sales-rep.  

Maria works with her husband in sales, offering glasses and 'toquilla' straw hats.  They travel to other cities such as Atacames, Salinas, and Canoa; places visited by many tourists, who all like the products she offers.  She only travels to Canoa at the weekends, while her husband goes for 15 days at a time to the other beach resorts.  He stays there until he manages to sell all his goods and then returns home to rest a week before setting off again.  This is how they have been earning a living for many years now.

They will use this loan to buy more glasses and hats,  Maria has been with this credit group since it was founded and she likes it because it offers her many benefits.  She dreams of seeing her children grow up to become working professionals.

loans.use: to buy hats and glasses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: María Cleofas

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Amigos Por siempre Calle Chimborazo que se reúne cada quince días en Montecristi  conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 73 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa, con ellos también viven un nieto que ya tiene 19 años que es como su hijo ya que lo crio desde pequeño y el estudia en  universidad. Su esposo ya no trabaja por enfermedad.
Doña María es artesana, ella elabora todo tipo de adornos hechos en paja toquilla así como también bolsos y carteras, también vende anilina en varios colores (tinta que sirve para pintar la paja toquilla), esta tinta es muy utilizada por los artesanos de la zona que a diario llegan hasta su casa a comprar este productos con el cual le dan colores a sus obras, ella también utiliza este producto con el cual les da un bello acabado a sus bolsos y carteras, las misma que luego vende a comerciantes que llevan a  otras ciudades estos productos y donde se venden a  muy buen precio.
Este crédito es para comprar paja toquilla y anilina para la venta. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque la fundación les da atención médica gratuita. Sus sueños son tener buena salud y que su nieto sea un profesional.
texts.en:
The credit group 'Amigos para Siempre' (Friends Forever) from the Chimborazo street get together every fortnight in Montecristi.  This area is well-known for its rich pre-colonial cultural heritage and also for its craft products, which are famous on a national and international scale.  It is here that the famous 'toquilla' straw hats are made.

This is where Maria, 73, lives.  She is married and she has five grown-up children.  One of them still lives with her in her home.  They also have under their roof a grandson, who is now 19 and is like a son to her as she raised him from when he was small.  He is now studying at university.  

Her husband does not work anymore due to illness.  Maria works in crafts, making an assortment of decorative products made from toquilla straw, as well as bags and wallets.  She also sells aniline leather in different colors (the ink is used to paint the straw).  This ink is used a lot by the craftspeople in the area who come to her house on a daily basis to buy her products.  These products give color to their own work, in the same way that Maria uses these colors to give a flourish to her own bags and wallets.  She sells her products to traders from other cities who sell her products on at a very good price.  

This loan is to buy toquilla straw and aniline for selling on.  She has been with the credit group since it started and she particularly likes the free medical care that it offers.  Her dreams are to be healthy and for her grandson to grow up to become a working professional.

loans.use: to buy toquilla straw and aniline leather.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a Poly tank and renovate public toilet and bath house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy one poly tank and renovate the bath and toilet for commercial use.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a 7,500-liter poly tank and expand his toilet and bathhouse business by serving growing needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a poly tank and renovate his bathhouse and toilet for commercial purposes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two poly tanks to store water for commercial use and renovate the bathhouse.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand water business by buying a poly tank to save water and meet the needs of his clients when there is water shortage

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Mrs. Thuy is 31  years old. There are six people in her family. Husbandry is her main income. She can cover family’s daily cost and education from pig raising income. She has daily income from garden such as vegetable, chicken and pig. She is interested to improve the living standard for her family so she really needs the loan to build a toilet.In this picture, she stands in front of her temporary toilet with her small child.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Heidy Katherine

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Amigos Por siempre Calle Chimborazo que se reúne cada quince días en Montecristi  conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Heidy, tiene 21 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación aun no tiene hijos. Su esposo es taxista. Ella estudia enfermería en un institutito de la ciudad.
Doña Heidy es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto  ayudarse para sus estudios se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y carteras, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja tres días a la semana realizando sus recorridos y también vende en su centro de estudios y  en la  casa que vive, lugar hasta donde llegan sus clientes, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 6 mese que se dedica a esta actividad la cual empezó con el crédito que recibió.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa y carteras. Lleva dos ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado a aumentar su negocio. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia pues vive donde los suegros.
texts.en:
The credit group 'Amigos Por Siempre' (Forever Friends) from the Chimborazo Street get together every fortnight in Montecristi.  This place is well-known for its rich pre-colonial cultural heritage and also for its craft product which are renowned both nationally and internationally.  It is here that the famous straw hats are made.

This is where Heidy, 21, lives.  She is married but doesn't have any children yet.  Her husband is a taxi driver.  She is studying nursing in a local school, while at the a same time dedicating her time to the housework.  In order to generate her own income to pay for her studies she sells all kinds of clothes and wallets door to door.  She works three days a week, selling on her sales routes, at school and from her own home.  She sells on credit and collects payment every eight days.  

She has been doing this for six months.  She started off with the help of a loan, and she is now asking for a new loan to buy clothes and wallets.  She has been in the credit group for five cycles and she likes it because the loans help her to expand her business.

She dreams of having her own home because at the moment she is living with her parents-in-law.

loans.use: to buy clothes and wallets.

loans.name: Fabián Ignacio

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Amigos Por siempre Calle Chimborazo que se reúne cada quince días en Montecristi  conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive el señor Fabián, tiene 34 años de edad, está casado y fruto de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 14 y 10  años que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposa es comerciante. 
Don Fabián realiza el crédito para que su esposa lo realice en sus actividades, ella  se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y  productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, recorre la ciudad  tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 3  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo y que les sirve para salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brinda la institución. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The credit group 'Amigos Por Siempre' (Forever Friends) from the Chimborazo Street get together every fortnight in Montecristi.  This area is well-known for its rich pre-colonial cultural heritage and also for its nationally and internationally renowned craft products.  It is here where the famous straw hats are made.

This is where Fabian, 34, lives.  He is married and has two children aged 14 and 10, who are studying at school.  His wife is a trader.  

Fabian is asking for a loan so his wife can use it in her business.  She sells clothes by catalogue and also 'Yanbal' products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and accessories for ladies).  She sells door-to-door and goes round the city three days a week, which takes her between two to three hours.  She sells on credit and collects payment every eight days.  

She has been in this business for three years and she earns enough of an income to get along in life.  This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and clothes.  They have been in this credit group since it started and they like it because it offers them a lot of help.  

Their dreams are to give the family the best possible standard of living.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and clothes.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila works hard to support her family. Cirila is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Cirila requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Cirila has been in this business for 30 years now.

Cirila would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is a 41-year-old married man with two children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. Phuong earns money with the business of repairing motorcycles and selling parts. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. 

Now, Phuong would like to take a loan to invest in his business. He plans to use this loan to buy motorcycle parts to stock his store and to serve more customers. He hopes that through this loan, he will be able to increase the turnover of his business. This will enable him to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts to stock his store and to serve more customers

loans.name: Glecer

texts.en:
Glecer is 41 years old and married with three children.  

Glecer is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Glecer requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Glecer has been raising pigs for 12 years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Glecer would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 35 years old and married with two children. With two children currently in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, noodles, coffee, sugar, detergent, soap, shampoo, sanitary pads, etc., to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, shampoo, sanitary pads, etc. 

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, noodles, coffee, sugar, detergent, soap, shampoo, sanitary pads, etc., to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Maria works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Maria is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase sacks rice to sell for her rice business.

Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Cristina Soledad

texts.es:
Cristina es una mujer de 54 años de edad, viuda, tiene un hijo de 20 años, y su negocio es el tejido de polaina y gorritos.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘alto Chijini’, caracterizada por encontrarse en una ladera de la ciudad, donde las calles son empinadas, la mayoría de los habitantes son ex mineros de diferentes centros que en la mayoría de los casos fueron relocalizados, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 2-14 grados centígrados.
Cristina es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su hijo que trabaja y estudia, viven en una casa construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y están realizando la conexión de gas domiciliario. Su negocio es el tejido a mano de polainas (medias de lana hasta la rodilla) y gorros de lana, labor que realiza todos los días de la semana de forma independiente en su domicilio, la venta la efectúa en un puesto de venta improvisado en la calle y también en feria y mercados, de forma ambulante. Su producto es muy requerido por señoras de vestir tradicional, que debajo de sus polleras utilizan polainas para combatir el frío constante del lugar, los gorros que elabora son para todo público porque lo utilizan niños y adultos. “los productos de lana son muy necesarios en la ciudad porque todo el año hace frío…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un puesto fijo de venta para dejar de ambular. Ella desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de una máquina de tejer, para producir en mayor cantidad y de manera más rápida. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
 Es por esos motivos que Cristina solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de tejer para producir más rápido y aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Cristina, 54, is a widow who has a 20-year-old son.  To earn a living she makes gaiters and hats. She is a good mother who is also enterprising, independent, responsible and hard-working.  

She runs her business from the 'Alto Chijini' area, which is well-known because it is located on a hillside of the city, where the streets are steep and the majority of the inhabitants are ex miners who were relocated from different places.  The climate is cold and dry and the temperature during the day goes between 2 and 14 degrees.  

Cristina is dark-skinned with long dark hair in plaits.  She speaks Aymara, which is her native language, but she also speaks Spanish.  She uses Spanish in her business.  

She shares her life with her son who works and studies.  They live in a brick house with clean water, electricity and a gas supply which is currently being installed.  

She makes gaiters (woolen socks which come up to the knee) by hand and woolen hats.  She does this work every day independently in her own home.  She sells her products from a stall which she sets up in the street, as well as at the fair and markets.  Her products are popular by women who like to dress traditionally, because the gaiters offer warmth under their normal clothes.  She prepares hats for all people and they are used by both children and adults.  "Woolen clothes are essential in this city because of the cold" she tells us.  

She dreams of having a fixed stall so she doesn't have to sell her products on the street.  She wants to invest in her business by buying a sewing machine, which will help her to produce a greater quantity more quickly.  

This is the first loan she has asked for in the six years that she has been in this business.  She hopes that investing the money in this way will help her to work more efficiently and increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine so she can work more efficiently and increase her sales.

loans.name: Maria Michelle

texts.en:
Maria Michelle is 32 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Maria Michelle has a soft drinks retail business in the Philippines. Maria Michelle requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of soft drinks to sell.

Maria Michelle has been in this business for five years. In the future, Maria Michelle would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 56 years old and has seven children. Erlinda is married, and one child is still in school.

Erlinda is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Erlinda requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Erlinda has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Erlinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Gemma works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and ready-to-wear clothing businesses. Gemma is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell for her fish-vending business.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her businesses.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 58 years old and married, and she works very hard to provide for the family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, chips, etc.

Marina has been in this business for 14 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, chips, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more dried fish and rice

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy agricultural inputs for market gardening

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy agricultural inputs for market gardening

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de quatre femmes, les membres du groupe Djiguiya sont majoritairement  mariées et vie dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 45 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Lafiabougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe mènent  des activités génératrices de revenu  différent, notamment la vente d’habits, du lait, d’encens et des grains de maïs. Dans  le souci d’élargir et d’agrandir   leurs activités, elles ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso   et  sont  à leur  2ème  prêt  en solidaire.
Madame Téneguè  (femme arrêtée en 2ème position de la droite vers gauche sur la photo) a une bonne notoriété, car  les habits pagnes wax  très prises par les femmes à Lafiabougou. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 35 pièces de pagnes wax. Elles s’approvisionnent à Bamako.  Elle mène ses activités au comptant  à Lafiabougou à une clientèle de femmes. Madame Téneguè  compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen de 45 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour satisfaire son besoin et investir le reste dans son activité. Madame a pour objectif de fidéliser  ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’en profiter beaucoup de prêt.
texts.en:
The Djiguiya group is made up of 4 women, most of whom are married and live in monogamous households. They have an average age of 45 and, on average, 4 children. They all live in Lafiabougou, one of the districts of Bamako. They got to know each other via mutual funds groups in the district as well as their revenue-generating activities. The members of the group have different businesses; they sell clothing, milk, incense and maize grains. They decided to turn to Soro Yiriwaso in order to expand their activities, and are on their second group loan.

Téneguè (second from the right in the picture), is well know because the wax pagnes (highly decorative and colourful West African clothing) she sells are very popular with the women in Lafiabougou. She plans to use her loan to buy 35 pieces of wax pagnes. She gets her supplies in Bamako. She makes her sales in Lafiabougou for cash to a clientèle made up of women. Téneguè expects, thanks to this loan, to make an average monthly profit of 45 000 francs, which she will use to take care of her needs and reinvest in her business. She aims to preserve this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so that she can benefit from a lot of loans.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy agricultural inputs for market gardening

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 9 membres du groupe  Benkadi  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Tandio, un des villages de Yorosso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités de maraîchage pour la première fois. 
La spéculation cultivée est  l’échalote et banane avec Bintou, assise 2ème de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des Semences, intrants et matériels en vu d’exploiter  sa partielle de 0,25 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koury, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95 000FCFA en fin de période.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et faire face à ses dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The nine members of the Benkadi group are married women with average age of 40 and, on average, 5 children. They all live in traditional families in Tandio, one of the villages in Yorosso, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to be able to carry out their market gardening activities for the first time.

Bintou, sitting second from the right in the picture, grows shallots and bananas. She plans to use her loan to buy the seeds, agricultural inputs and materials she needs to cultivate a quarter of a hectare of land. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and in Koury to a mixed clientèle. She expects to make an profit of 95 000 francs by the end of the season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, agricultural inputs and materials.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Benkadi 2  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Tandio, un des villages de Yorosso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités de maraîchage pour la première fois. 
La spéculation cultivée est  l’échalote et banane avec Minata, assise 2ème de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des Semences, intrants et matériels en vu d’exploiter sa partielle de 0,25 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koury, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100 000FCFA en fin de période.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et faire face à ses dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 2 group are married women with average age of 35 and, on average, 5 children. They all live in traditional families in Tandio, one of the villages in Yorosso, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to be able to carry out their market gardening activities for the first time.

Minata, sitting second from the right in the picture, grows shallots and bananas. She plans to use her loan to buy the seeds, agricultural inputs and materials she needs to cultivate her plot of land, which is a quarter of a hectare. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and in Koury to a mixed clientèle. She expects to make an profit of 100 000 francs by the end of the season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, agricultural inputs and materials.

loans.name: Inmaculada Concepcion De Pacca Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “INMACULADA CONCEPCION DE PACCA”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Cleofe  ella es soltera y tiene 25 años; La socia se dedica al negocio de venta de comida,la socia tiene un restaurant, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the communal bank “Inmaculada Concepción de Pacca,” located in the Anta district, which belongs to the Anta province in the Cusco Department.

One of the members, Maria Cleofe, is 25 years old and single. She sells food. She owns a restaurant where she prepares different dishes, such as roasted chicken, soups and meat stews. She works from 8 am until 6 pm. Maria Cleofe has been in this business for eight years and is doing very well. Her dream is to have a bigger restaurant.

Maria Cleofe is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as rice, vegetables and chicken.

The remaining members sell food, work in agriculture, have grocery stores or sell animals. Maria Cleofe wants to thank all of those who share her dream through this means and promises to pay the installments according to plan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, vegetables and chicken.

loans.name: Yusleydy Isabel

texts.es: Yusleydy desea superarse económicamente, estudia un curso de belleza el cual espera terminarla y poder ejercerla, mientras tanto continua vendiendo sus productos varios como ropa chinelas perfumes, desde su casa en la comarca donde habita, Yusleydy con el crédito anterior invirtió en su negocio y gracias a las ganancias logro comprar cerámicas para instalar en su vivienda. Ahora solicita nuevamente crédito para comprar productos para ofrecer más variedades a sus clientes y seguir adelante junto a su pequeña familia que la conforman su hijita y esposo.
texts.en: Yusleydy wants to get ahead financially. She is taking a cosmetology course and hopes to finish and be able to practice it. Meanwhile she continues to sell her different products, such as clothing, flip-flops, and perfumes from her home in the district where she lives. With the previous loan, Yusleydy invested in her business and thanks to the profits was able to buy tiles to install in her home. Now she is asking for a loan again to buy products to offer more variety to her customers and continue ahead with her small family, made up of her young daughter and her husband.

loans.use: to invest in the business of selling products from her home and continue forward, guaranteeing the family finances.

loans.name: Saul Ernesto

texts.es: Saúl es un hombre de 36 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia desde hace 3 años junto a su madre y su hermano de 29 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida con su trabajo como albañil, pero en épocas de escases de este trabajo, trabaja en una finca cercana como jornalero manteniendo la estabilidad económica de su hogar. Saúl desea mejorar la cocina de  su vivienda, en la cual pueda preparar sus alimentos de una forma higiénica, además desea construir un corredor y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, lámina, madera y clavos para reparar la cocina y construir un corredor en su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en: Saúl is a 36 year old man. He has lived in his own home for 3 years with his mother and his 29 year old brother. He is a hardworking man who earns his living working as a bricklayer, but when there isn't much work, he works at a nearby farm as a laborer to maintain the financial stability in his home. Saúl wants to improve the kitchen in his home so that he can prepare their meals in a sanitary way. He also wants to build a corridor. That is why he is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, sheeting, wood and nails to repair the kitchen and build a corridor in his home as soon as possible.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, sheeting, wood and nails to repair the kitchen and build a corridor in his house.

loans.name: Juan Nelson

texts.es: Juan es un hombre trabajador que tiene 42 años de edad y habita en vivienda propia junto a su madre, su hermana y sus 2 sobrinos de 6 y 2 años de edad. Él es un hombre emprendedor que se gana la vida como albañil independiente desde hace 12 años, con lo que apoya a su madre con los gastos de su hogar. Juan siempre busca la manera de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, es por ello que ha decidido construir una galera en su vivienda, pero además desea reparar el techo de su vivienda, para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, clavos, madera y alambre para construir una galera y mejorar una parte del techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Juan is a hardworking man. He is 42 years old and lives in a house that belongs to the family, together with his mother, his sister and two nephews who are 6 and 2. Juan is an enterprising man, who has been working as an independent mason for twelve years. With this job, he can help his mother with the home expenses.

Juan is always trying to improve his family’s living conditions, which is why he decided to build a veranda at home, and repair the roof. He is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized metal sheets, nails, wood and wire to build a veranda and repair the roof.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, nails, wood and wire to build a veranda and repair the roof.

loans.name: Maria Olivia

texts.es: María es una mujer de 51 años de edad que habita junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 7 y 8 años de edad en vivienda propia. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida en una playa cercana vendiendo carnada para pesca actividad que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace muchos años. María desea reparar la cocina de su vivienda, que como se observa en la fotografía se encuentra deteriorada, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, alambre y clavos para reparar la cocina de su vivienda lo antes posible y así poder evitar que el agua se filtre en época de lluvia.
texts.en: María is a 51 year old woman who lives with her husband and their two children, aged 7 and 8, in their own home. She is a hardworking woman who earns a living at a nearby beach selling bait for fishing, an activity that has allowed her to get her family ahead. She has done this activity for many years. María wants to repair the kitchen in her house. As can be seen in the photograph, it is deteriorated. That is why she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized sheeting, wood, wire and nails to repair the kitchen in her house as soon as possible and thus avoid water leaking in during the rainy season.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheeting, wood, wire and nails to repair the kitchen in her house.

loans.name: Carlos Jacob

texts.es: Carlos es un hombre de 21 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y su grupo familiar. Él es un joven trabajador que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios de seguridad y ordenanza en un rancho cercano, lo que ha permitido sostener a su familia desde hace 5 años. Carlos desea construir una galera en la entrada de su vivienda, para tener un lugar amplio y fresco para descansar después de sus largos días de trabajo, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para construir una galera en la entrada de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 21-year-old man who lives with his life partner and some relatives in a house of their own. He is a young worker, who has been working as a security guard for a nearby farm for five years, which has helped him to sustain his family.

Carlos wants to build a porch at home, in order to have a comfortable and fresh place where to rest after his long work days. He is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood and nails to build a porch.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood and nails to build a porch.

loans.name: Maria Elena Moyano Group
