texts.es: 6 mujeres  responsables a distintas actividades comerciales  todos ellos residen en el distrito del  Agustino. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “María Elena Moyano” una de ellas es la Sra. Carmina    de 58 años de edad viuda  y con 2 hijos mayores de edad, la Sra. Carmina se dedica ya hace 4  años al negocio de costura(remalle) , en un pequeño puesto todos los días,  la Sra. Carmina  nos cuenta que a llegado a fidelizar a sus clientes lo cual a generando ingresos  para cubrir los gastos de su casa,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus productos de fabricación de  ropa  para damas y caballeros   y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar una maquina de costura y poder tener más ingresos, a la Sra. Carmina es la primera de la mano derecha se le distingue por su chompa de manga corta de color rosado claro. A la vez se despide con un abraso a Kiva y   diciéndoles que cumplirá todas su metas propuestas.
texts.en: These are 6 responsible women with different commercial activities. All of them live in the district of Agustino. They are the members of the communal group, “María Elena Moyano”. One of them is Carmina. She is 58 years old and a widow with 2 grown children. Carmina has worked for 4 years in the sewing business (overlock), at a small place every morning. Carmina tells us that she has gained her customers' loyalty, which has generated income to cover the household income. In the future, she would like to have her own locale where she can sell the clothing products she makes for women and men, and earn more profits. With the loan, she will invest in buying a sewing machine to have more income. Carmina in the first on on the right, distinguished buy her light pink, short sleeved sweater. She takes her leave with a hug for Kiva and telling you that she will attain all of the goals she has set.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Julita is 47 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Julita has a bakery business in the Philippines. Julita requested a 15,000 Philippines peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Julita has been in this business for five years. Julita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles used the previous loan to buy firewood for baking bricks. He has continued with the same business of making bricks, alongside running a saloon, in order to boost his income. He is facing challenges of weather changes and the new rules concerning deforestation which makes it hard for him to get firewood. In spite of these, he has a vision of beginning a hardware business. Charles has asked for a loan to buy saloon equipment and firewood for baking bricks.

loans.use: to buy saloon equipment and firewood for baking bricks.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena works hard to support her family. Nena is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

She requested a 15,000 Philippines peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Nena has been in this business for three years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Los Grogresistas De Cupiche Group

texts.es: El grupo “LOS PROGRESISTAS DE CUPICHE” está conformada por socios dedicados a prestar servicios y al comercio minoristas. Julia tiene 45 años de edad es casada con 04 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la repostería elabora tortas bocaditos queques budines para todos tipo de eventos y a la vez ofrece productos de belleza. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación de tortas y compra de productos de belleza que estén en oferta para poderlos a expender a un precio que le genere ganancias. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. . Julia es la segunda persona sentada del lado derecho viste polo celeste.
texts.en: The “LOS PROGRESISTAS DE CUPICHE” group is made up of members who work providing services and as retailers. Julia is 45 years old and married, with 4 dependent children. She works with pastries, making cakes, snacks, cakes, and puddings for all types of events. She also sells beauty products. She will invest in buying materials to prepare cakes and to buy beauty products that are on sale to be able to get them at a price that will be profitable. The group is thankful to the Kiva investors for the loan they have given. Julia is the second person seated from the right, wearing a light blue t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy more materials and beauty products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Ruben es un hombre de 30 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo pequeño de 5 meses, y su negocio es el comercio de estuco.
Él es buen padre, generoso, comprensivo, paciente, buen oyente, solidario, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Alto San Pedro’ que se caracteriza por tener comedores de beneficencia para personas en extrema pobreza. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 4-14 grados centígrados.
Ruben es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, baja estatura su lengua es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. su vida la realiza con su pareja que le ayuda en el comercio y su pequeño bebe que duerme casi todo el día. Viven en una casa propia que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de estuco; que es una pasta de grano fino compuesta de cal apagada (normalmente, cales aéreas grasas), mármol pulverizado, yeso, pigmentos naturales, etc. que se endurece por reacción química al entrar en contacto el hidróxido de calcio de la cal con el dióxido de carbono y se utiliza sobre todo para enlucir paredes y techos. Recientemente realizó la compra de un camión con el que transporta su producto por las diferentes calles hasta llegar a sus clientes. “Gracias al trabajo duro con mi pareja logramos tener mucho clientes a los cuales realizamos la entrega de estuco para todo tipo de construcciones…” comenta. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y llegar a mayor cantidad de clientes. Él desea realizar la compra de estuco por mayor para satisfacer la demanda de temporada y realizar viajes a otras localidades para comercializar el producto. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Ruben solicita un préstamo para la compra de estuco por mayor para viajar a localidades alejadas y comercializar su producto.
texts.en:
Ruben, 30, lives with his spouse and has a small son only five months old. He makes a living selling stucco.
He is a good father and a great listener, and also generous, compassionate, supportive, patient, responsible, and hard-working. He works in the area of Alto San Pedro, known for its soup kitchens for the very poor. The weather is cold and dry, with temperatures of between 4 and 14 degrees Celsius during the day.
Ruben is dark-skinned, not very tall, and has short black hair. His mother tongue is Aymará; he learned Spanish by hearing people speak it around him and by speaking with his customers. He lives happily with his spouse, who helps with his business, and with his baby boy, who does not help as much: he sleeps almost all day long! The family lives in a house of their own that has drinking water and electricity and is connected to the sewer system. He makes a living selling stucco, a fine-grained paste made of slaked lime (usually derived from fatty quicklime), ground marble, plaster, natural pigments and other ingredients. When the calcium hydroxide contained therein comes in contact with carbon dioxide, the material hardens. Stucco is mostly used to decorate walls and roofs. Ruben recently purchased a lorry to deliver the product to his customers. He tells us that thanks to his and his spouse's hard work, he has many customers, to whom he delivers stucco for all kinds of construction uses. His dream is to have a bigger business and more customers. He wants to buy stucco wholesale in order to meet increasing seasonal demand. He aims to sell to other villages as well. Ruben has been in business for two years, but this is his first loan with the field partner.
He asks for a loan to buy stucco wholesale and sell his products in villages far away.

loans.use: to buy stucco wholesale to deliver and sell.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly continúa con su actividad de producción y venta de queso, en su localidad ubicada en cercanías al lago Titicaca. Su negocio es próspero y con el préstamo anterior logró cumplir sus metas en cuanto a la producción lechera y quesera deseada. En esta oportunidad su meta es ampliar su establo para que su ganado este más cómodo y beneficie su producción. Esta es la 4 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que viene realizando esta actividad. Su sueño es cumplir sus metas en su negocio y repartir queso a mercados de la ciudad. Ella desea realizar la compra de material de construcción para ampliar el establo donde vive su ganado para continuar mejorando la producción de leche y de queso, esto beneficiará a su familia que está compuesta por sus padres que ya son de avanzada edad y se encuentran al cuidado de Nelly.
Es por esos motivos que Nelly solicita un préstamo para la ampliación de su establo para continuar mejorando su producción quesera y lechera.
texts.en:
Nelly still makes a living producing and selling cheese at her village near Lake Titicaca. Her business is going well, and she managed, thanks to the previous loan, to reach her milk and cheese production targets. Her new goal is to build a bigger stable to make her cattle more comfortable in order to increase production. Nelly has been in business for four years and this is her fourth loan with the field partner. She dreams of reaching her business targets and selling cheese to markets in the city. She wants to buy construction supplies to build a bigger stable, so as to make her cattle more comfortable in order to increase milk and cheese production. This will benefit her family, comprised of her parents, who are well advanced in years and whom she must care for.
As a result, Nelly is applying for a loan in order to build a bigger stable so as to increase milk and cheese production.

loans.use: to build a bigger stable so as to increase milk and cheese production.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora es una mujer de 58 años de edad, casada, tiene una hija de 17 años de edad,  y su negocio es la venta de tomates.
Ella es emprendedora, luchadora, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona central; un área caracterizada por el comercio en todas las áreas, y que alberga a universidades, oficinas públicas y empresas privadas que conviven lado a lado, de clima semitropical durante todo el año, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 14-24 grados centígrados
Flora es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo amarrado, ojos obscuros, su lengua materna es el Quechua y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica a la construcción y con su hija que estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de tomates, de toda variedad, por mayor y menor, en un puesto de venta fijo en la calle.  “los tomates son un acompañamiento casi para todas las comidas, existen variedades para la ensalada, para sopas…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un camión para transportar tomate en mayores cantidades. Ella desea realizar la compra de variedades de tomates por mayor para satisfacer la demanda de temporada. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos en 30 años que viene realizando esta actividad de manera independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Flora solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedades de tomate por mayor para satisfacer la demanda de temporada.
texts.en:
Flora is a 58 year old woman, married with a 17 year old daughter. Her business is the sale of tomatoes. Flora is enterprising, a fighter, persistent, responsible and hard-working. 

Flora has developed her business in the central zone, an area characterized by all types of commercial activity, and which hosts universities, public offices and private businesses, co-existing side by side. The weather is semi-tropical throughout the whole year, with a temperature between 14 - 24 degrees centigrade. 

Flora is brown-skinned, of short stature, and has long dark hair worn tied back and dark eyes. Her mother tongue is Quechua and she speaks Spanish in general culture and in her business. Flora shares her life with her husband who makes a living from construction and her daughter who studies at school. They live in a brick rented house with a corrugated roof. The house has running water, electricity and sewerage. 

Flora's business is the sale of different varieties of tomatoes, in wholesale and retail, from a permanent stall on the street. Flora comments: "The tomatoes are an accompaniment for nearly every dish, there are varieties for salads, for soups..". Her dream is to have a truck to transport the tomatoes in greater quantities to buy wholesale tomato varieties in order to satisfy seasonal demands. This is the second loan in 30 years that has been obtained in an independent way. It is for these reasons that Flora seeks a loan.

loans.use: to buy wholesale tomato varieties in order to satisfy seasonal demands

loans.name: Sr De Coyllority Cachimayo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SR DE COYLLORITY CACHIMAYO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cachimayo, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Carmen ella es casada, la socia continua dedicándose a la  crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, la socia continua criando a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solictan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes.
La foto fue tomada en dos grupos ya que el grupo de 5 socias estaba cocinando para el resto del grupo.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de chompas, negocio de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, crianza de animales menores, ganadería y venta de comida.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
El socio que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The partners belong to communal bank 'Sr de Coyllority Cachimayo'. This bank is situated in the Cachimayo district. It belongs to the Anta province and the department of Cusco.
Carmen is married and continues to raise small animals, such as guinea pigs and hens. She sells them later to her customers who ask for them, supporting her family in this way. She is a very responsible and hard-working person.
The borrower is applying for the loan to buy guinea pigs.
The photo was taken in two groups, since the group of five members was cooking for the rest of the group.
The other members make their living in the sweater-selling business, the clothing business, the grocery store business, raising small animals, livestock, and food sales.
Carmen is grateful to all who form part of this dream through these means, and is committed to making her payments on time.
One member of the group is alone in a photograph; this is because he was late for work-related reasons.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour for bread-making.

loans.name: Idelfonzo

texts.es:
Ildefonso es un productor de la zona norte centro del país. A sus 52 años, junto a su esposa y 8 hijos; 5 de estos actualmente estudiantes, se dedica a la comercialización de café y a la producción de cacao orgánico. Además de dedicarse a estas actividades, la familia tiene una pequeña tienda de artículos varios lo cual les permite tener un pequeño ingreso durante todo el año. 

Ildefonso es un hombre con mucha experiencia en el área agropecuaria, a lo largo de su vida se ha dedicado a la producción de granos básicos, comercialización de cerdos y semovientes,  pero su pasión es el acopio y comercialización de café y cacao.

Su mayor deseo es transmitir su experiencia a sus hijos; ya que está seguro que todo su conocimiento sumado al aprendizaje de ellos en el colegio, les ayudará a ser mejores. La mayoría de sus hijos estudian por la mañana y en las tardes ayudan a sus padres en las tareas que pueden para  conseguir el pan de cada día.

La meta de este pequeño emprendedor es diversificar su negocio, aumentando el portafolio de granos que acopia, y para ello solicita el apoyo para la ampliación de la bodega que utiliza para garantizar el manejo adecuado, y seguro de los granos que almacena para luego vender.
texts.en:
Idelfonso is a producer who lives in the central northern part of the country. He is 52 and lives with his wife and their eight children, five of whom are students. He trades in coffee and grows organic cocoa. The family also has a little shop where they sell various items, a useful supplement to their income throughout the year. 
Idelfonso is a very experienced farmer and has worked in agriculture all his life: by turns, he grew corn, sold pigs and other livestock, but his true passion lies with the stockpiling and commerce of coffee and cocoa.
His greatest wish is to pass on his experience to his children, since he is convinced that all his knowledge, together with what they learn at school, will help them become better. Most of his sons go to school in the morning and help their parents in the afternoon. They help with what they can so that the whole family can have bread on the table.
This small entrepreneur's goal is to have a more diverse business by increasing the number of different types of beans he stockpiles. With this in mind, he asks for a loan in order to increase the size of his granary, so that the beans he stores stay in good condition for sale.

loans.use: to increase the size of his granary.

loans.name: Esperanza Y Progreso Group

texts.es: Esta es la Alcancía “Esperanza Y Progreso” constituida por 08 socias proactiva y emprendedoras. Katia de 20 años de edad es soltera. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y cosméticos. Hace más de 02 años que viene desempeñándose en dicho negocio ofreciendo a sus clientes por catalogo. Gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar su negocio y le va bien. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para la compra de colonias, cremas, perfumes y desodorantes.  Su mayor visión es contar con su propio local para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. La Alcancía “Esperanza Y Progreso” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva que hicieron posible éste crédito. Katia se encuentra de pie en la parte posterior es la segunda del lado derecho viste polo con rayas rosado y blanco.
texts.en: This is the Esperanza y Progreso bank, made up of 8 proactive and enterprising members. Katia, 20 years old, is single. She works selling beauty products and cosmetics. Two years ago, she began to undertake this business offering her customers items from a catalog. Thanks to her efforts, she has managed to improve her business and it is going well. For this reason, she asked for a loan to purchase colognes, creams, perfumes, and deodorants. Her biggest vision is to have her own retail space to provide better customer service. The Esperanza y Progreso bank thanks the Kiva investors who made this loan possible. Katia is standing in the back, she is the second from the right, wearing a pink and white striped shirt.

loans.use: to purchase colognes, creams, perfumes, and deodorants.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe Danaya  est constitué de sept (7) femmes  tous mariées et vie dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 32 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kalaban-coro l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font du commerce,  tel que la vente, d’habits, du jus, et des céréales.  Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de rejoindre  Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 1ier   prêt en prêt solidaire.
Madame Mariam (femme assise en 2ème position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits (pagnes wax) de meilleures. Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 15 pièces de pagnes wax. Elles s’approvisionnent  à Bamako. La revente s’effectue à Kalaban-coro au comptant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Mariam compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour satisfaire les petits besoins de ses enfants et investir le reste dans ses activités. Madame compte beaucoup sur le partenariat  de Soro Yiriwaso pour l’atteinte de ses objectifs qui est l’élargissement de son activité.
texts.en:
The Danaya is made up of 7 women who are all married and live in monogamous households. They have an average age of 32 and, on average, 2 children. They all live in Kalaban-coro, one of the districts of Bamako. They got to know each other via mutual funds groups in the area and their revenue-generating activities. They group members sell things like clothing, juice and cereals. The group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their capital and are on their first group loan.

Mariam (sitting second from the left in the picture) has a great reputation as a seller of quality clothing (wax pagnes, highly colourful and decorative West African clothing). She plans to use her loan to buy 15 pieces of wax pagnes. She gets her supplies in Bamako. She makes her sales in Kalaban-coro for cash to a clientele mostly made up of women. Thanks to this loan, Mariam expects to make an average monthly profit of 30 000 francs, which will be used to cover her children's small expenses and to reinvest in her business. She relies on her partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to reach her goal, which is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino es un hombre de 49 años de edad, casado, sin hijos, y su negocio es la elaboración y venta de queso artesanal.
El es una persona trabajadora, sencilla, humilde, honesta, perseverante, madrugadora, puntual, emprendedora y muy luchadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de ‘Batallas’ a una altura de 3735 metros sobre el nivel del mar, distante a 65 kilómetros de la ciudad. De clima frio y seco, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 2-12 grados centígrados.
Marcelino es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, ojos obscuros, su lengua natal es el Aymará y utiliza el español para el comercio. Su rutina comienza desde muy tempranas horas de la madrugada, incluso antes de que los gallos anuncien la alborada, trabajar el insumo lácteo hasta darle esa consistencia característica, es una tradición que es compartida por gran parte de los habitantes. Con pocas ganancias y bastante esfuerzo, diariamente lucha para sacar sus productos frescos a la calle, son muchos los gastos que tiene que hacer para llegar al producto final. El proceso comienza con la leche recién ordeñada, los envases para almacenar el queso se elaboran con materiales de Totora, propia del lugar. “Este trabajo nos da para vivir honradamente y sin lujos. Con lo que ganamos pagamos las cuentas, compramos comida y seguimos trabajando con el queso para comercializarlo, ahora ya tengo 25 años trabajando de manera intermitente…” comenta. El principal problema de Marcelino es la poca producción de leche, la época lluviosa fue muy corta y no ayudó a que aumentara el pasto para alimentar a las vacas. Esto repercutió de manera directa en la obtención de la leche, la provisión diaria es insuficiente para aumentar la producción de queso, dependiendo de la época del año, el pasto desmejora y esto merma la producción de leche. Su sueño es mejorar su producción y llegar a otros mercados. Él desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de ganado lechero para aumentar su producción de leche y con eso la de Queso. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 25 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Marcelino solicita un préstamo para la compra de vacas lecheras, aumentar la producción de queso y llegar a nuevos mercados.
texts.en:
Marcelino is a 49-year-old man, married, without children, and his business is making and selling artisan cheese.

He is a hardworking, simple, humble, honest, persevering, early-rising, punctual, enterprising, and very determined person.  His business is located in the Batallas locality at an altitude of 3735 meters above sea level, 65 kilometers away from the city. It has a cold and dry climate, with a temperature that varies from 2-12 degrees centigrade during the day.

Marcelino is olive skinned, has short black hair, is of short stature, has dark eyes, his native language is Aymará, and he uses Spanish for business.  His routine begins in the very early hours of the morning, even before the roosters announce the dawn. To work with dairy products until they give their characteristic consistency is a tradition that is shared by many of the inhabitants.

With little earnings and significant efforts, he fights daily to get his fresh products to the street. He has many expenses that he has to pay to get the final product. The process begins with recently milked milk, the containers to store the cheese are made from totora [a large reed], from that region. "This work permits us to live honorably and without luxuries. With what we earn, we pay the bills, purchase food, and continue working with dairy production. The rainy season was very short and didn't help to grow the grass to feed the cows. This directly affected the milk production, the daily provision isn't enough to increase cheese production, depending on the season, the grass spoils and this reduces the milk production and, in turn, the cheese."  This is his first loan cycle in the 25 years he has been doing this work.

For these reasons, Marcelino asks for a loan to purchase dairy cows, increase his cheese production and reach new markets.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows, to increase his cheese production and reach new markets.

loans.name: Bamwenda

texts.en:
Bamwenda is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in farming alongside selling produce to earn him extra income. He started this business so as to educate his children. He hopes to be a prominent farmer; however, his main challenge is inadequate capital and the prolonged dry spell affecting his crops.

He is requesting a loan to buy more mulch and fertilizers to improve on his farm.

loans.use: to buy more mulch and fertilizers to improve  his farm.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 36 years old and has two children. Analyn is married, and one child is in school.

Analyn is in the agricultural business of farming rice in the Philippines. Analyn requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Analyn has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Analyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lelanie

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Lelanie works hard to support her family.

She has a personal products retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tailoring. Lelanie is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more stock of personal products to sell to customers.

Lelanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of personal products to sell.

loans.name: Jorge Edmundo

texts.es: Jorge tiene 32 años, el trabaja en la elaboración de ladrillo, este negocio es familiar ya que su madre es su socia, Jorge   se crio sin su padre pero su madre le enseño a ser un hombre responsable, Jorge  trabaja en la ganadería y el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de terneros, lo que Jorge aspira de este negocio es mejorar sus ingresos y apoyar a su madre y hermanos.
texts.en:
Jorge is 32 years old. He manufactures bricks, which is a family business since his mother is his business partner. Jorge grew up without a father, but his mother taught him to be a responsible man. 

Jorge also raises livestock and he is going to use the loan to purchase calves. Jorge hopes that this business will improve his income and help him to support his mother and siblings.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.en:
Leoncia is 57 years old and married with four children. 

Leoncia is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Leoncia requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Leoncia has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Leoncia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gloria Del Socorro

texts.es: Gloria tiene 57 años de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración de ladrillo y también se dedica a la crianza de chanchos desde que era muy joven, lo que Gloria va a compra con el dinero del crédito   son chanchos, Gloria espera mejorar su negocio y seguir trabajando para el bienestar suyo y de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gloria is 57 years old. She works making bricks, although she has also been raising pigs since she was very young.

Gloria will use the loan to buy pigs. She hopes to improve her business and be able to continue working for her and her children’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.es:
Tatiana tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su mamá que es una adulta mayor la cual padece de una enfermedad crónica y requiere de mucho cuidado, por tal motivo ella decide iniciar con su actividad de manualidades en las técnicas de foam y fofuchas, desde su casa para poder estar atendiendo a su mamá.Ella inicio su actividad hace 10 años, se nota su gran habilidad y creatividad con las manualidades. Actualmente tiene como clientela 4 escuelas privadas, 3 públicas y las sodas del I.C.E, quienes le encargan todo tipo de decoración en foam y fofuchas. Estos meses son época alta ya que las educadoras solicitan todas las efemérides del próximo año, recuerdos de graduación y cajas navideñas para la fiesta de los estudiantes, por tal motivo necesita mayor materia prima para poder cumplir con los pedidos, por tal motivo solicita esta financiamiento. 
Doña Tatiana cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de su instructora en manualidades, en la visita realizada se verifica su gran creatividad y perfecto acabado en los trabajos realizados. Cuando Tatiana estaba en el colegio repitiendo por segunda vez el octavo nivel, una educadora le recomendó a su mamá que la sacara del colegio porque no le era posible aprender como los demás y que tenía otro don, fue ahí donde su mamá la matriculo en el I.P.E.C, paso por diferentes cursos, pero cuando empezó a trabajar el foam le encanto y desde ese momento lo utiliza para sus diferentes trabajos.
Es importante recalcar que Tatiana solo va a utilizar una parte del préstamo para esta temporada, ya que al inicio de clases necesita invertir en otro tipo de materiales que las educadoras le solicitan.
texts.en:
Tatiana is 36 years old and lives with her mother who is an older adult who suffers from a chronic illness and requires a lot of care, for which she decided to start her own business making crafts using foam and Fofucha dolls, from her house to be able to care for her mother. She began this work 10 years ago, and her great skill and creativity are evident in her crafts. Currently she has 4 private schools, 3 public schools and the snack bars in the I.C.E. (Costa Rican Electrical Institute) which order all sorts of foam and Fofucha decorations. These months are the high season since the teachers order for all the next year's events, graduation mementos and Christmas boxes for the students' party. For this reason she needs more raw material to be able to fill all the orders, so she asks for this loan. 

Tatiana has very good references from her craft teacher; in the visit that was made, her great creativity and perfect finishing of the work she has done was verified.  When Tatiana was in school, repeating the 8th grade for the second time, a teacher recommended that her mother take her out of school because it wasn't possible for her to learn like the others and that she had another gift. It was from there that her mother enrolled her in the IPEC [Community Professional Education Institute]. She took various classes, but when she began to work with the foam, she loved it and from this moment, she used it for her different tasks.

It is important to stress that Tatiana will only use a part of this loan for this season, since at the beginning of the year she needs to invest in other sorts of materials that the teachers ask for.

loans.use: to purchase raw material.

loans.name: Victor Marcos

texts.es:
Victor es un hombre de 22 años. Soltero, sin hijos, y su negocio es la tapicería tradicional.
Él es independiente, emprendedor, activo, constante, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de ‘el Tejar’ un área caracterizada por el comercio informal en todas las áreas; cientos de comerciante se acomodan lado a lado para ofertar ropa, comida, carnes, frutas, etc., de clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 5-15 grados centígrados y durante todo el año. Victor es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, ojos obscuros, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. su vida la comparte junto a su mamá que vive con él en una casa perteneciente a la familia, construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la tapicería, actividad que aprendió de su familia; él ejerce el oficio de cubrir con tela, tapiz o cuero asientos domésticos, de automóviles o motocicletas, fijando el material con tachuelas, grapas o cosido. También se dedica mejorar la comodidad de los mismos instalando muelles, espumas o fibras vegetales en su interior. El objetivo principal de sus trabajos es lograr la comodidad y belleza de los asientos que tapiza. Los materiales que mayormente utiliza son; Tijeras, Martillo de tapicero, Grapadora manual o neumática, Compresor, Tiza para marcar telas, Máquina de coser, Pata de cabra pequeña para sacar, grapas y tachuelas, Mazo de goma, Agujas curvas para coser a mano, Aguja larga para poner, botones, Punzón, Alicates, Cinta métrica, Escuadra y otros. “el equipo del tapicero está compuesto por unas cuantas herramientas comunes a otros oficios, muy pocas herramientas específicas y algunos materiales que sirven para casi hacer de todo…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un negocio más grande para atender a mayor cantidad de clientes. Él desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de telas, tapices y herramientas por mayor, debido a que las telas y tapices se agotan rápido y las herramientas se encuentran en mal estado por el continuo uso. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Victor solicita un préstamo para la compra de telas, tapices y herramientas para renovar su negocio de tapicería tradicional.
texts.en:
Victor is 22, single, without children, and his business is traditional upholstery.

He is independent, enterprising, active, tenacious, and hard-working. His business is located in the "El Tejar" zone, an area characterized by informal businesses in all areas -- hundreds of businesspeople work side by side to offer clothing, food, meat, fruit, etc., in the cold and dry climate where the temperature varies between 5-15 degrees centigrade during the day and throughout the whole year. 

Victor is olive skinned, has short black hair, is of short stature, has dark eyes, his native language is Aymará, and he speaks Spanish from school and for his business. He shares his life with his mother who lives with him in a brick house that belongs to the family, and has drinking water, electricity, and sewer services. His business is upholstery, work that he learned from his family. He works covering household, car, or motorcycle seats with fabric, tapestry or leather, attaching the material with tacks, staples or by sewing. 

He also works improving the comfort of these items, installing springs, foam, or plant fibers in them. His primary objective in his work is to achieve comfort and beauty in the seats that he upholsters. The materials that he uses most are scissors, upholstery hammer, hand or pneumatic stapler, compressor, fabric chalk, sewing machine, small cat's claw to remove staples and tacks, rubber mallet, curved needles to sew by hand, large needle to attach buttons, punch, pliers, metric tape measure, square, and others. "The upholsterer's tools are made up of a number of common tools and from other trades, very few specific tools, and some materials that serve to make almost anything possible..." he says. 

His dream is to have a larger business to serve a larger number of customers. He wants to invest in his business through the purchase of fabric, tapestry and tools in bulk, since he runs out of the fabric and tapestry quickly and the tools are in bad condition due to their constant use. This is his first loan cycle with the institution in the 10 years that he has been doing this work. 

For these reasons, Victor asks for a loan to purchase fabric, tapestry and tools to update his traditional upholstery shop.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, tapestry, and tools to update his traditional upholstery shop.

loans.name: Narciza Ines

texts.es: Ines tiene 49 años de edad, ella está casada y tiene 4 hijos, mismos de los cuales  2 aun se encuentran estudiando, se dedica a la crianza de pollos para ayudarle a su esposo que es chofer, en los gastos de educación de sus hijos, Ines va a invertir el crédito en la compra de pollos para tenerlos en un pequeño espacio que tiene  para criar sus animales, ella es una madre amorosa que tiene la aspiración de mejorar su negocio y salir adelante junto a su esposo e hijos.
texts.en:
Ines is 49 years old. She is married and has four children, two of them of school age. She raises chickens in order to help her husband, who is a driver, to pay for their children’s studies.

Ines will use the loan to buy chickens and raise them in a piece of land she has. She is a loving mother who wants to improve her business and get ahead together with her husband and children.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Clara Emilia

texts.es: Clara creció en el campo  junto a sus padres que se dedican a la agricultura, al jornal, a la crianza de animales  y a la ganadería,  y de ahí es que Clara aprendió a apoyarse en los gastos de su casa con este negocio, su  esposo se dedica a trabajar al jornal, con el dinero del crédito va a comprar chanchos para tenerlos en chancheras, Clara tiene un hijo de 6 meses de edad al que le quiere mucho y por quien trabaja duro para darle bienestar apoyándose con su negocio.
texts.en:
Clara grew up in the country with her parents, who work in farming, as day laborers, and in raising cattle and other animals. That is how Clara learned to support herself through these same types of work. Her husband works as a day laborer.

Clara will use the money from this loan to buy pigs that she will keep in pigpens. She has a 6-month-old son whom she loves very much, and it is for his well-being that she works hard in her business.

loans.use: buy pigs.

loans.name: Mujeres Forjadoras Group

texts.es: El grupo “Mujeres Forjadoras” está conformada por 06 socias responsables y positivas en desarrollarse en sus negocios. Gelida de 34 años de edad es separada con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de calzados. Gracias a su esfuerzo puede darles una mejor educación a sus hijos. Solicito el crédito para la compra de  sandalias, zapatillas y botines. El deseo de Gelida es tener su tienda de calzados en su propio local. El grupo “Mujeres Forjadoras” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por hacer posible este crédito. Gelida es la  primera del lado izquierdo y viste polo plomo con rayas blanco.
texts.en: The Mujeres Forjadoras group is made up of 6 responsible and positive members who have their own businesses. Gelida is 34 years old and separated, with 2 dependent children. She works selling shoes. Thanks to her efforts she can give her children a better education. She asked for the loan to purchase sandals, heels, and ankle books. Gelida's wish is to have a shoe store in her own retail location. The Mujeres Forjadoras is thankful to the Kiva investors for making this loan possible. Gelida is the first on the left side and is wearing a gray shirt with white stripes.

loans.use: to purchase sandals, heels and ankle boots.

loans.name: Danne Lea

texts.en:
Danne Lea is a 19-year-old woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She makes a living through her sari-sari or general store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her area. Danne Lea has been in the business for more than a year now.

Danne Lea is asking for a loan to buy more inventory to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, rice, bread and biscuits, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, soft drinks, coffee, eggs, and sugar. With a loan, she will be able to improve her inventory, allowing her to sell more to her customers.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned goods, noodles, rice, bread and biscuits, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, soft drinks, coffee, eggs, and sugar

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 53 years old and has four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, coffee, etc.

Nida has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Nida aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, coffee, etc

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Residing in Kandal province, Chantha is 41 years old and a mother of two children. Nowadays, she can earn income to support her family's living conditions via selling snacks. For Chantha, this is her second loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loan completely. 

She will spend her entire loan portion to pay the tuition fee for her son who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree at the university. She hopes that her son can get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for her son who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree at the university.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
As a parent of three children, Cheryl works hard to support her family.

She has a seaweed business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Cheryl is borrowing 5,500 PHP through NWTF to buy other farm supplies for her seaweed production business.

Cheryl has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy other farm supplies for her seaweed production

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es: Mariana  es una señora muy activa en sus actividades diarias, ella esta casada con su esposo que es chofer con el que tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 17 años de edad, Mariana comenta que se dedica a ser comerciante de productos alimenticios y también a la crianza de animales menores, en esta ocasión va  a invertir el crédito en la compra de chanchos para tenerlos en una chanchera que le presta su suegra, Mariana espera que su negocio sea un apoyo económico para que sus hijos sigan adelante en sus estudios.
texts.en: Mariana is a woman who is very diligent in her daily work.  She is married, her husband is a driver, and together they have two children who are 14 and 17 years old.  Mariana says that she makes a living by selling food items and also by raising small animals.  At this time she is going to use the loan to buy pigs so that she has them for the pigsty that her mother-in-law lent her.  Mariana hopes that her business will be enough financial support so that her children can continue their education.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efrain es un hombre de 36 años de edad, casado, tiene dos hijos varones de 6 y 9, y una hija de 15 años, y su negocio es la confección de ternos y trajes formales.
Él es emprendedor, responsable, buen padre, comunicativo, perfeccionista, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘villa Fátima’ un lugar caracterizado por el comercio informal de verduras y frutas provenientes del norte de la ciudad y por las paradas de transporte público con salidas a poblaciones del mismo lugar, de clima frio y ventoso, vientos que llegan de la cordillera a una altura de 3600 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Efrain es de tez morena, cabello corto negro, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que trabaja como empleada pública y con sus hijos que asisten a la escuela, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección de ternos y ropa formal, oficio que aprendió en la ciudad de buenos aires cuando fue a buscar trabajo y lo logró; trabajando 11 años, 12 horas diarias en talleres de costura, manejando máquinas rectas y overlock para realizar todo tipo de prendas. “al comienzo fue difícil, no sabía manejar ninguna máquina ni coser, aprendí todo y retorne a mi tierra…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un taller de costura grande con ayudantes y personal de atención al público. El desea ampliar su negocio para la realización de diferentes prendas de vestir mediante la compra de una máquina overlock. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 11 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Efrain solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina overlock para confeccionar diferentes tipos de prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Efrain is a 36 year old married man. He has two sons, who are 6 and 9 years old, and a 15 year old daughter. He has a business which manufactures three-piece and formal suits. He is enterprising, responsible, communicative, hardworking and a perfectionist - as well as being a good father. 

His business is in Villa Fátima, a place characterised for its fruit and vegetable markets, selling produce from the north of the city. It is also known for its wealth of public transport, allowing people to travel to various destinations. It has a cold and windy climate. The winds arrive from the Andes, which are 3600 metres above sea level. 

Efrain is short and dark-skinned, with short black hair and dark eyes. His mother tongue is Aymará, and he speaks Spanish for general knowledge and for his business. He shares his life with his wife, who works as a civil servant, and with his children, who attend school. They live in a rented house built of bricks that has running water, electricity and a sewage system. He learned his trade in the city of Buenos Aires when he went there to look for work, which he found. He worked 12 hours a day for 11 years in sewing workshops, working with sewing and overlock machines to make all types of clothes. "In the beginning it was difficult, I didn't know how to work any of the machines or how to sew. I learned it all and then returned to my country," he says. 

His dream is to have a large sewing workshop with helpers and sales assistants. He wants to expand his business in order to make different types of clothing by purchasing an overlock machine. This is the second loan cycle with Emprender in the 11 years that he has doing this activity.

loans.use: to buy an overlock machine in order to manufacture different types of clothes.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is a 29-year-old single lady with one child living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a retailer, and at the same time owns a bar and a hotel, which all boost her income. She hopes of expanding her business to new areas in order to yield more income, despite the challenge of experiencing price fluctuations like other retailers. 

Justine needs a loan to buy beer, sugar and soap for selling.

loans.use: to buy beer, sugar and soap for selling.

loans.name: Aquiles

texts.es:
Aquiles es un hombre de 34 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y trabaja como taxi.
Él es emprendedor, independiente, generoso, amable, responsable y trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en la localidad de Sacaba, un área rural caracterizada por el comercio agrícola por mayor, cientos de productores de fruta, verdura y carne, transportan sus productos hasta el lugar para que sean adquiridos por comerciantes mayoristas para distribuirlos en ferias, mercados y supermercados. De clima templado durante todo el año. 
Aquiles es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, estatura mediana, ojos obscuros, su lengua materna es Quechua que se habla en el lugar, y habla español por cultura general y por el trabajo que realiza. Vive con su sobrino que estudia en la escuela; en una casa en construcción, hecha de ladrillo, que cuenta con electricidad. Una vez a la semana pasa por el lugar el camión cisterna que vende agua por litros, los pobladores del lugar la compran algunos en sus tanques de agua otros en bidones y botellas, el problema frecuente es perder al camión cisterna y quedarse sin agua por 1 semana hasta que retorne la siguiente semana. Su sueño es ver terminada la construcción de su casa. Él desea realizar la instalación de agua potable en la cocina, el baño y la lavandería para dejar de comprar agua en bidón al camión cisterna. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 14 años que trabaja como taxi independientemente.
Es por esos motivos que Aquiles solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua en su cocina, baño y lavandería para dejar de comprar agua en bidón al camión cisterna.
texts.en:
Aquiles is 34 years old and is single with no children. He works as a taxi driver and is enterprising, independent, generous, friendly, responsible and hard-working. He works in the town of Sacaba, Bolivia, which has a year-round temperate climate and is located in a rural area in which most people work in agriculture. Hundreds of fruit, vegetable and meat producers take their products to the town in order to sell them to wholesalers who then distribute them to markets, fairs and grocery stores.  

Aquiles is of medium height, with short black hair, dark eyes and tan skin. His native language is Quechua, which is widely spoken in this area, and he also speaks Spanish because of his level of education and his profession. He lives with a nephew who is in school and their house is currently under construction. It is made of brick and has electricity. Once a week a water truck passes by selling water by the liter, and residents buy this water for their personal water tanks or in large drums and bottles. A common problem is to miss the water truck and be left with no water for a whole week until it passes by again.

Aquiles' greatest dream is to see his house finished. He would like to install a system providing clean water for his kitchen, bathroom and washroom so that he does not have to buy water from the water truck. This is the first loan that Aquiles has taken out with Emprender [Kiva Field Partner] in the 14 years that he has worked as an independent taxi driver, and he will use the money to fulfill the goal stated above: providing clean water for his kitchen, bathroom and washroom so that he does not have to buy water from the truck.

loans.use: install a system providing clean water for his kitchen, bathroom and washroom so that he does not have to buy drums of water from a water truck.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya est composé de quatre femmes mariées équitablement dans des ménages polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Daoudabougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont  connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce,  du bois de chauffe, charbon du bois et poissons fumes. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1èr cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Sèba  (en 2ème position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente du bois de chauffe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  1 chargement de camionnette en bois de chauffe dans les villages environnants de Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Daoudabougou à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Madame Sèba  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Danaya is made up of four women who are all equitably married and live in polygamous households. They have an average age of 44 and, on average, 5 children. They all live in Daoudabougou, one of the districts of Bamako, and got to know each other via neighbourly relationships. They group members sell things like firewood, charcoal and smoked fish. The group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their working capital and are on their first group loan.

Sèba (second from the left in the picture) has a great reputation as a seller of firewood. She plans to use her loan to buy a lorry-load of firewood in the villages surrounding Bamako. She makes her sales in Daoudabougou to a retail clientele mostly made up of women. Thanks to this loan, Sèba expects to make an average monthly profit of 45 000 francs, which will be reinvested in her business. Her aim, with the support of Soro Yiriwaso, is to buy a plot of land on which to build a house.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Renante

texts.en:
Renante is a 39-year-old fisherman from the town of Carles, Iloilo. He is married with two young daughters, age 2 and 3. 

Fishing has been his livelihood for many years now, but when Typhoon Haiyan hit his place, his fishing boat was damaged. He is still in the process of repairing his boat. He is asking for a loan to buy plywood, nails and adhesive. Renante hopes that with the loan, his business will thrive once again and he can better support his family's needs. His wife can then help him in selling his catch.

Any income generated will be used for food for his family, savings and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy plywood, nails and adhesive

loans.name: Siguidia Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les cinq membres du groupe Siguidia ont en moyenne 50 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Daoudabougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à Daoudabougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, friperies de toutes sortes et de condiments. Dans l’intention d’accroitre leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1èr cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Oumou  (femme assise en 3ème position de la  gauche vers la droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de, friperies de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 balles de friperies  en gros à Médine. La revente se fait en détails à Daoudabougou en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Oumou  compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married and, for the most part, living in monogamous households, the 5 members of the Siguida group have an average age of 50 and, on average, 3 children. They all live in Daoudabougou, one of the districts of Bamako, and got to know each other via neighbourly relationships and their revenue-generating activities in Daoudabougou. The group members are retailers who sell things like clothing and all sorts of condiments. The group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their working capital and are on their first group loan.

Oumou (sitting third from the left in the picture) has a great reputation as a seller of all sorts of second-hand clothing. She plans to use her loan to buy 2 bales of second-hand clothing wholesale in Médine. She makes her sales on the streets of Daoudabougou to a retail clientele mostly made up of women. Thanks to this loan, Oumou expects to make an average monthly profit of 40 000 francs, which will be reinvested in her business and used to take care of the small needs of the household.

loans.use: to buy all sorts of second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Marelo

texts.en:
Marelo is 39 years old and has four children. Marelo is married, and two children are currently in school.

Marelo is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Marelo requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Marelo has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marelo would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina used her previous loan to buy more second-hand clothes to sell during Easter season. She still owns a boutique of second-hand clothes to earn a living. She earns additional income from rentals. She started her business to improve her standard of living. She faces challenges of price fluctuations and high license fees but has hopes that she will become a very rich woman.

Regina is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more second-hand clothes to sell during this Christmas season.

loans.use: to purchase more second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan is managing his eatery business in Oroquieta. It has been doing well supporting his needs, and he is able to sustain the needs of his family as well. He has local customers and he also accepts orders for added income. 

Allan requested a loan, which he will use to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for his eatery business. He wants to expand his business and would be very happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for his eatery business

loans.name: Tiessiriton Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Tièssiriton sont mariées uniquement dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 28 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Daoudabougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako; Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à Daoudabougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (tomates), poissons fumés, oignons, bazins et friperies. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1èr cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Awa  (femme  assise en 2ème position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente de condiments (tomates.) Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  4 corbeilles  de tomates en gros à Médine. La revente se fait à Daoudabougou à  une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Awa  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The 5 members of the Tièssiriton group are married and all live in polygamous households. They have an average age of 28 and, on average, 5 children. They all live in Daoudabougou, one of the districts of Bamako. They got to know each other via neighbourly relationships and their revenue-generating activities in Daoudabougou. The group members are retailers who sell things like condiments (tomatoes), smoked fish, onions, damask fabric and second-hand clothing. The group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their working capital and are on their first group loan.

Awa (sitting second from the left in the picture) has a great reputation as a seller of condiments (tomatoes). She plans to use her loan to buy 4 baskets of tomatoes wholesale in Médine. She makes her sales in Daoudabougou to a retail clientèle essentially made up of women. Thanks to this loan, Awa expects to make an average monthly profit of 45 000 francs, which will be reinvested in her business and used to cover the children's health care expenses.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Mariée uniquement dans des ménages monogamiques, les quatre membres du groupe Danaya ont en moyenne 43 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Lafiabougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à Lafiabougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, restauration, charbon du bois et  couches d’enfants. Dans le  dessein  d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Bintou (femme arrêtée à l’extrême gauche  sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de restauration. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs  de grains de riz, 3 sacs mil et 2 sacs de fonio en gros à Médine. La revente se fait en détails à Lafiabougou à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Bintou compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married and all living in monogamous households, the 4 members of the Danaya group have an average age of 43 and, on average, 4 children. They all live in Lafiabougou, one of the districts of Bamako, and got to know each other via neighbourly relationships and their revenue-generating activities in Lafiabougou. The group members are retailers who sell things like prepared food, charcoal and diapers. The group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their working capital and are on their second group loan.

Bintou (standing second on the left in the picture) has a great reputation as a seller of prepared food. She plans to use her loan to buy 2 bags of rice, 3 bags of millet and 2 bags of fonio wholesale in Médine. She makes her sales in Lafiabougou to a retail clientèle essentially made up of women. Thanks to this loan, Bintou expects to make an average monthly profit of 60 000 francs, which will be reinvested in her business and used to cover the small needs of the household.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Koulya 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Koulya 1  sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, 3 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Tandio, un des villages de Yorosso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Ils collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités de maraîchage pour la première fois. 
La spéculation cultivée est  l’échalote avec Ladji, assis au milieu sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter des Semences, intrants et matériels en vu d’exploiter  sa partielle de 0,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koury, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Ils compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95 000FCFA en fin de période.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et faire face à ses dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Kouluya 1 group are married men with an average age of 34 and, on average, 3 children. They all live in traditional families in Tandio, one of the villages in Yorosso, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to be able to carry out their market gardening activities for the first time.

Ladji, sitting in the middle in the photo, grows shallots. He plans to use his loan to buy the seeds, agricultural inputs and materials he needs to cultivate his half-hectare of land. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and in Koury to a mixed clientèle. He expects to make a profit of 95 000 francs by the end of the season. This profit will enable him to repay his loan and cover his daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, agricultural inputs and materials.

loans.name: Concipcion

texts.en:
Concipcion is 54 years old, married, and has seven children, two of whom attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Concipcion has a food vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for four years. 

Concipcion requested a loan from NWTF for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy ingredients for her food production business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Suhrab

texts.ru: Сухраб, 29 лет, женат, отец 2 детей. У Сухраба- высшее образование, уже 3 года он занимается торговлей женской и мужской одеждой. Благодаря упорному труду, на сегодняшний день  ежемесячный доход Сухраба составляет в среднем 30,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, он обратился в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) для покупки одежды для перепродажи, увеличив ассортимент он сможет привлечь больше клиентов в свой магазин. Доходы от кредита Сухраб хочет вложить в дальнейшее расширение его бизнеса.
texts.en: Suhrab is 29 years old, married, and a father to 2 children. Suhrab has a higher education. For the past three years, he has been selling women's and men's clothing. Thanks to his Suhrob's hard work, his average monthly income is 30,000 som (KGS). For the further development of his business, he turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." He is requesting a loan for 150,000 som (KGS) to buy clothes for retail sale. By increase his assortment of merchandise, he will be able to attract more customers to his store. Suhrab plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further expansion of his business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for retail sale.

loans.name: Koulya 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Koulya 2  sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Tandio, un des villages de Yorosso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Ils collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités de maraîchage pour la première fois. 
La spéculation cultivée est  l’échalote et banane avec Yaya, assis au milieu sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter des Semences, intrants et matériels en vu d’exploiter sa partielle de 0,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koury, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Ils compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100 000FCFA en fin de période.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et faire face à ses dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Koulya 2 group are married men with an average age of 33 and, on average, 5 children. They all live in traditional families in Tandio, one of the villages in Yorosso, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to be able to carry out their market gardening activities for the first time.

Yaya, sitting in the middle in the photo, grows shallots and bananas. He plans to use his loan to buy the seeds, agricultural inputs and materials he needs to cultivate his half-hectare of land. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and in Koury to a mixed clientèle. He expects to make a profit of 100 000 francs by the end of the season. This profit will enable him to repay his loan and cover his daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, agricultural inputs and materials.

loans.name: Koulya 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Koulya 3  sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, 4 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Tandio, un des villages de Yorosso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Ils collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités de maraîchage pour la première fois. 
La spéculation cultivée est  l’échalote et banane avec Daouda, assis 2ème de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter des Semences, intrants et matériels en vu d’exploiter sa partielle de 0,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koury, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Ils compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105 000FCFA en fin de période.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et faire face à ses dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Koulya 3 group are married men with an average age of 30 and, on average, 4 children. They all live in traditional families in Tandio, one of the villages in Yorosso, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to be able to carry out their market gardening activities for the first time.

Daouda, sitting second from the right in the photo, grows shallots and bananas. He plans to use his loan to buy the seeds, agricultural inputs and materials he needs to cultivate his half-hectare of land. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and in Koury to a mixed clientèle. He expects to make a profit of 105 000 francs by the end of the season. This profit will enable him to repay his loan and cover his daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, agricultural inputs and materials.

loans.name: Paz Y Bien Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Paz  y Bien” conformada por 07 socios dinámicos y emprendedores. Patricia es separada y tiene 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida como el cebiche. Hace más de 10 años que viene desempeñándose en dicho negocio lo cual le permitido tener una mejor calidad de vida. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de arroz, cebolla, pescado y limones. Gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado ambientar su local para así dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. El grupo “Paz y Bien”  está agradecido con los inversionistas Kiva y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Patricia se encuentra sentada es la primera del lado derecho y viste chompa morado.
texts.en: This is the "Paz y Bien" group, made up of 7 dynamic and enterprising members. Patricia is separated and has 2 dependent children. She works selling food such as cebiche [a typical seafood dish]. For over 10 years, she has worked in this business, which allows her to have a better quality of life. She asked for the loan to purchase rice, onions, fish and lemons. Thanks to her efforts, she has managed to decorate her retail space to be able to provide better customer service. The "Paz y Bien" group is grateful to the Kiva investors and promise to continue working well. Patricia is seated and is the first on the right, wearing a purple jacket.

loans.use: to purchase rice, onion, fish and lemons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: maintain stocks of merchandise at her store in order to keep generating income for her family.

loans.name: Azimkan

texts.ru: Азимкан 63 года, вдова, у нее среднее образование, мать 5 детей, младший живет с Азимкан. Она известна как принципиальный, честный и добросердечный человек. Азимкан с 1971 года в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, начала свой бизнес в увеличении поголовья скота в своем хозяйстве, а также в полеводстве. В хозяйстве у Азимкан имеется: 2 лошади, 15 овец, 0,38 ГА собственной и 2,0 Га арендованной земельной доли для полеводства. Ее ежемесячный доход составляет около 25,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь Азимкан и ее детей, поэтому для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Азимкан обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошади для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Азимкан планирует использовать для дальнейшего развития ее бизнеса и она очень хочет помогать своим детям с воспитанием внуков.
texts.en: Azimkan is 63 years old and a widow. She has a secondary education. She is a mother to 5 children, the youngest of whom lives with her. She is known as a principled, honest and kind-hearted person. In search of a source of income for her family, Azimkan started a livestock breeding and crop farming business on her farm in 1971. Azimkan has 2 horses and 15 sheep on her farm. She also owns a 0.38 hectare plot of land and rents a 2.0 hectare plot of land on which she does crop farming. Her average monthly income is 25,000 som (KGS). This amount is not enough for a decent life for Azimkan and her family, which is why she turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum" for the further development of her farm. She is requesting a loan for 70,000 som (KGS) to buy a horse to increase the size of her herd. Azimkan plans to use the income from the loan for the further development of her business. She also really wants to help her children with the raising of her grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase one horse.

loans.name: Manne Du Ciel Group

texts.fr: Wamunzila est commerçante depuis 6 ans, âgée de 53 ans, mariée à un chauffeur et mère de 14 enfants dont 4 étudient et 10 mariés. Elle est membre d’un groupe d’Affaires «Manne du Ciel» et vendeuse des produits pharmaceutiques. Elle installe sa marchandise dans une pharmacie sur la route principale de la ville. Elle va acheter des boites de médicaments modernes (Antibiotiques, anti-inflammatoires et anti malaria). Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle compte renforcer son capital, réfectionner sa maison, scolariser ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneuses non bancables en leur accordant de microcrédit sans garantie matérielle.
texts.en: Wamunzila has been a retailer for 6 years. She is 53 years old, married to a driver and the mother of 14 children, 4 of whom go to school and 10 of whom are married. She is a member of the "Manne du Ciel" business group and sells pharmaceutical products. She displays her merchandise in a pharmacy located on the town's main street. She is going to buy boxes of modern medicines (antibiotics, anti-inflammatories and anti-malarial drugs). She started her business with funds she received from her husband. In the future, she plans to strengthen her capital, to renovate her house and to ensure her children get an education. She thanks Hekima for its support of non-bankable female entrepreneurs, by giving them microloans without requiring tangible security.

loans.use: to buy boxes of modern medicines (antibiotics, anti-inflammatories and anti-malarial drugs).

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 64 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has one adult child.
 
Teresita earns a living from her little sari-sari store business (general store). She’s been engaged in this business for six years already. She earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month at her business, which is helpful to support her family's needs. She has requested a loan to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products to sell in her store.
 
Teresita has been a member of PMPC for almost four years. In the future, Teresita hopes to expand her sari-sari store by displaying additional lines of products.

loans.use: To purchase groceries and other consumable products

loans.name: Shohidahon

texts.ru: Шохидахон 28 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. У Шохидахон среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она уже много лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Шохидахон, на сегодняшний день у нее есть земельный надел мерою 0,50 ГА, где она выращивает экологически чистый картофель. Ежемесячный доход Шохидахон составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). Шохидахон обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) для закупки минеральных удобрений и семян картофеля. Шохидахон намерена накопить средства на покупку автомобиля для ее семьи.
texts.en: Shohidahon is 28 years old, married, and is a mother to two children. Shohidahon has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, she has been practicing crop farming and livestock breeding for many years. Thanks Shohidahon's perseverance, determination and hard work, she currently has a 0.50 hectare plot of land on which she grows organic potatoes. Shohidahon's average monthly income is 12,000 som (KGS). Shohidahon turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum" to request a 30,000 som (KGS) loan to buy mineral fertilizers and potato seeds. Shohidahon is determined to save money to buy a car for her family.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and potato seeds to grow organic crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy supplies for his fast food business, like bread, sausage, meat, vegetables, sauces and seasonings.

loans.name: La Différence Group

texts.fr: Zigabe est Couturière et vendeuse des habits prêt à porter depuis 8 ans et trésorière d’un groupe d’Affaires « La Différence» âgée de 34 ans, mariée à un agent de l’Etat et mère de 5 enfants dont 4 étudient 1 est gosse. Elle est propriétaire d’un atelier, chez elle, à son domicile. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise.
