Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter des matériels: Tissus, fil, pagnes, aiguilles, sison etc. Elle démarra avec de  fonds  reçu de la tontine. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite agrandir son atelier, scolariser et  nourrir  ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneuses en leur accordant de crédit sans garantie matérielle.
texts.en: Zigabe is a seamstress and has been selling ready-to-wear clothing for 8 years. She is also the treasurer of the "La Différence" business group. She is 34 years old, married to a public official and the mother of 5 children, 4 of whom go to school and one of whom is still too young. She owns a workshop in her home. She is requesting a loan from Hekima to help her increase her business. This new loan will be use to buy materials like fabric, thread, pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African material), needles and scissors. She started her business with funds she got from a mutual funds group. In the future, she would like to expand her workshop and make sure her children are fed and educated. She thanks Hekima for its support of female entrepreneurs, by giving them microloans without requiring tangible security.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, pagnes, needles and scissors etc.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is from Zaporozhye. She is married with a daughter. Natalya sells sportswear such as jackets, sweatshirts, t-shirts, as well as sport footwear such as boots, sneakers and running shoes. Recently Natalya also added slippers to her variety of goods for sale and Christmas decorations as well to diversify her range of merchandise for sale this holiday season. 

Natalya needs additional 20,000 UAH to stock her new vending facility with quality merchandise for the winter season. Her daughter will work as a salesperson at the new vending location. Another new addition to the variety of featured merchandise at the recently opened vending facility will be sauna caps that sell well during the long cold winter days in Ukraine. Natalya constantly seeks to introduce brand new types of merchandise at her vending locations to help her attract customers and draw their attention to what she has to offer.

loans.use: to stock her new vending facility with quality merchandise for the winter season

loans.name: Ass. Amani Group

texts.fr: Josline est commerçante dynamique de la banque villageoise Ass. Amani, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un commerçant, âgée de 30 ans, mère de 4 enfants  scolarisés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle est propriétaire d’une alimentation dans le centre ville depuis 6 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 3 sacs de farine de format, le lait en poudre, sucre, vin, de jus, d’eau vive, d’huile, biscuits, riz etc. Elle souhaite accroitre son crédit et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Josline is a dynamic retailer and a member of the Ass. Amani "banque villageois." She is a customer of the MFI Hekima, married to a retailer, 30 years old and the mother of 4 children who all attend school. She started her business with funds she received from her husband. She has owned a small food stall in the centre of town for 6 years. This new loan will enable her to buy items like 3 bags of flour, powdered milk, sugar, wine, juice, sparkling water, oil, biscuits, and rice. She would like to increase her credit and feed her children. Finally, she thanks Hekima for the support it gives to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy flour, powdered milk, sugar, wine, juice, sparkling water, oil, biscuits, rice, etc.

loans.name: Bertin Group

texts.fr: Barasima est une commerçante, trésorière d’un collectif d’affaires «Bertin», âgée de 42 ans, mariée à un homme d’affaires et mère de 7 enfants tous scolarisés. La cliente est une vendeuse des divers matériels d’ustensile de cuisine. Elle étale sa marchandise dans le centre ville. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu son grand frère depuis son jeune âge. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 30 casseroles, verres, assiettes, tasses. Ainsi, elle compte acheter une parcelle, scolariser, vêtir, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneuses non bancables.
texts.en: Barasima is a retailer and the treasurer of the "Bertin" business group. She is 42 years old, married to a businessman and the mother of 7 children who all attend school. She sells various kitchen products. She displays her merchandise in the centre of town. She started her business with funds she had received from her older brother from a young age. This new loan will be used to buy 30 casserole dishes, glasses, plates and cups. She aims to buy a plot of land and to ensure that her children are clothed, fed and educated. Finally, she would like to strongly thank Hekima for enabling non-bankable female entrepreneurs to become self-sufficient.

loans.use: to buy 30 casserole dishes, glasses, plates and cups.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma has a collection of ornamental garden plants. She finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities and earn as well for her family. 

Alma requested a loan from, which she will use to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell. In the future, she wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ornamental plants

loans.name: Mukhabat

texts.ru: Мухабат успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Мухабат сейчас есть 4 коровы, 6 овец. На участке мерою 0,35 Га собственной и 0,50 Га арендованной земли она выращивает хлопчатник и кукурузу для реализации. Благодаря упорному труду Мухабат, ее деятельность приносит до 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита позволят Мухабат развить ее бизнес и накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Mukhabat successfully paid off her last loan, using it for its designated purpose. She is grateful to Kiva and to all those who helped her finance her previous loan. Mukhabat currently has 4 cows and 6 sheep on her farm. She also owns a .36 hectare plot of land and rents a 0.50 hectare plot of land on which she grows cotton and corn for sale. Thanks to Mukhabat's hard work, her business brings in 20,000 som (KGS) per month. For the further development of her business, she turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 70,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep to fatten up and resell. The income from the loan will allow Mukhabat to develop her business and save money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase sheep for fattening up and reselling.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: Josefa es una mujer de 36 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos de 14 y 11 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se desempeña como vendedora de productos de belleza por catálogo, además presta sus servicios domésticos para tener mejores ingresos ya que sabe que luego de la pérdida de su esposo ha tenido que ser todo para sus hijos. Josefa desea comprar 2 puertas de hierro en su vivienda, ya que sabe que los tiempos en su comunidad están difíciles y siente que las que tiene actualmente no le brindan mayor seguridad, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en dos puertas de hierro para instalar en su vivienda, esperando brindar mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en: Josefa is a 36 year old woman who lives in her own house with her two children aged 14 and 11 years old. She is a hard-working woman who works as a vendor of beauty products by catalog. She also provides domestic services to have more income. She knows that since she lost her husband she has had to be everything for her children. Josefa wants to buy two metal doors for her house as she knows that times in her community are difficult and she feels that the doors that she has offer little security. So she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in two metal doors to install in her house, hoping to provide more security for her family.

loans.use: to invest in two metal doors for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in bricks, cement, sand, gravel and re-bar to construct a water basin at her house.

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg is from Stebnik. He is 30 and married with 2 children. Oleg runs a wholesale warehouse store for grocery items. At the moment, he rents the facility he uses for business purposes. He has been in this business for 3 years. 

Oleg is seeking 40 000 UAH to purchase vegetables, fruit, sugar, flour, butter, sausage, dairy products, pastries and sweets wholesale for further sale to smaller retailers. One of Oleg's long-term plans is to open another warehouse and expand his business as a result.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, fruit, sugar, flour, butter, sausage, dairy products, pastries and sweets wholesale for further sale to smaller retailers

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is from Drogobych in western Ukraine. He owns a store selling men's sportswear. Ivan's merchandise is very high quality. He imports it from Turkey.
Ivan needs 40 000 UAH for personal purposes. He lives in a private apartment on the first floor. After getting legal permission from local authorities, Ivan remodeled the basement and turned it into another small room with an entrance right from the street. Now he is considering constructing walls at the entrance to turn it into a small porch. Concrete walls will protect Ivan's apartment from wind, snow and cold this winter season, helping him save on the heating bills and keeping his two kids warm throughout the rest of the cold season in Ukraine.

loans.use: to construct walls at his house's entrance turning it into a small porch

loans.name: Koulya 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Koulya 4  sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Tandio, un des villages de Yorosso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Ils collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités de maraîchage pour la première fois. 
La spéculation cultivée est  l’échalote et banane avec Abou, arrêté au milieu sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter des Semences, intrants et matériels en vu d’exploiter  sa partielle de 0,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koury, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Ils compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100 000FCFA en fin de période.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et faire face à ses dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Koulya 4 group are married men with an average age of 40 and, on average, 5 children. They all live in traditional families in Tandio, one of the villages in Yorosso, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to be able to carry out their market gardening activities for the first time.

Abou, standing in the middle of the back row in the photo, grows shallots and bananas. He plans to use his loan to buy the seeds, agricultural inputs and materials he needs to cultivate his half-hectare of land. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and in Koury to a mixed clientèle. He expects to make a profit of 100 000 francs by the end of the season. This profit will enable him to repay his loan and cover his daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, agricultural inputs and materials.

loans.name: Holidahon

texts.ru: Холидахон, 50 лет, замужем, есть 3 детей. У Холидахон средне-специальное образование, работает в больнице заведующей. Также с 1995 года в качестве дополнительного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У Холидахон в хозяйстве есть 1 корова, 1 бычок и земельный надел мерою 0,66 Га, где она выращивает картофель, морковь и кукурузу для реализации. Холидахон известна, как принципиальный, честный, порядочный и надежный человек. На сегодняшний день ее деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одной дойной коровы и 2 бычков. Доходы от кредита Холидахон планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства и хочет накопить средства на свадьбу ее дочери.
texts.en: Holidahon is 50 years old, married, and has three children. Holidahon has a secondary-specialized education. She works in a hospital as manager. As an additional source of income for her family, she has been farming since 1995. Holidahon currently has 1 cow and 1 bull-calf on her farm, as well as a 0.66 hectare plot of land on which she grows potatoes, carrots, and corn for sale. Holidahon is known as a principled, honest, decent and trustworthy person. Her average monthly income from her business is 15,000 som (KGS). For the further development of her business, she turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 100,000 som (KGS) to buy one dairy cow and two bull-calves. Holidahon plants to use the earnings from the loan to develop her farm. She also wants to save money for her daughter's wedding.

loans.use: to buy one dairy cow and two bull-calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood, nails, cement, sand and gravel to build a bathroom and fix the floor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, galvanized sheet metal, wood and nails to replace her roof and cement the hallway floor in her home.

loans.name: Maybelline Lizbeth

texts.es: Maybelline es una mujer de 19 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 9 meses de edad. Ella es una joven emprendedora que se gana la vida con su negocio de elaboración y venta de pan dulce y francés en el cual también su compañero de vida apoya en la elaboración de los productos, además cría y vende pollos, por lo que para esta temporada espera incrementar sus ventas. Maybelline desea construir un muro de ladrillo en su vivienda ya que como se observa en la fotografía actualmente es de láminas viejas lo que causa inseguridad para su familia, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir una pared de ladrillo en su vivienda.
texts.en: Maybelline is a 19 year old woman who lives in her own house with her life companion and her 9 month old son. She is a young entrepreneur who makes her living making and selling pastries and French bread. Her life companion helps her in the preparation of the products. She also raises and sells chickens and in this season she hopes to increase her sales. Maybelline wants to construct a brick wall in her house as you can see in the photo the old laminate that causes insecurity for her family. So she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks and re-bar to build a brick wall in her house.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks and re-bar to construct a brick wall in her house.

loans.name: Ganna

texts.en:
Ganna is from Vinogradovo. She sells office supplies from her own vending facility. Ganna has been an entrepreneur for 20 years. She loves running her business and does everything to keep it sustainable and stable. She works on her own and doesn't have any hired employees.

Ganna usually makes her wholesale merchandise purchases in Western Europe because her home town is pretty close to the border with Hungary. This time Ganna has a good offer to buy new merchandise at a reasonable price in Hungary for further retail sale in her home town.  She needs an additional 31,000 Grivnyas to buy this batch of goods.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise at a reasonable price in Hungary for further retail sale in her home town

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is an entrepreneur from Melitopol. She is 43 and married with a grown son.

Svetlana owns a small cafe in her hometown and also works at the seaside seasonally in summer when there are many tourists there. Svetlana's cafe offers nutritious meals, desserts, drinks, etc., as well as catering services of all sorts.
 
Svetlana needs an additional 40,000 Grivnyas to open a new cafe in Melitopol. There's a lot needed to get a new cafe started and running, however Svetlana is willing to take risks and work hard to expand her business and see it flourish and succeed. Growing her business alongside investing in the  comfort of her family are two main goals of Svetlana's life as an entrepreneur, wife and mother.

loans.use: to open a new cafe in Melitopol

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is from Khoost. She is married with two grown-up kids.

Nataliya has been working in the sphere of household chemicals sales for the last two years. At this point she is slowly growing her trade and has to rent a vending facility for business purposes. Nataliya owns a vehicle that she uses for transportation of merchandise, which is a very helpful tool when she travels from town to town offering her goods to smaller retailers. Nataliya's son helps her with sales. 

Nataliya is planning to use the 31,000 Grivnyas to purchase cosmetics, hair dyes and lotions to restock her merchandise and diversify it for customers during this winter season. The money generated from increased sales will be reinvested in the further development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, hair dyes and lotions to restock her merchandise and diversify it for customers during this winter season

loans.name: Rocio Elizabeth

texts.es: Rocío tiene 29 años de edad y habita en vivienda propia junto a su hijo de 4 años de edad y su grupo familiar. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida como cosmetóloga, actividad que realiza en su vivienda y a domicilio cuando se lo solicitan, actividad que realiza desde hace 7 años, por lo que gracias a su experiencia cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que solicitan sus servicios. Rocío desea reparar las paredes de su vivienda, ya que los simientes de la misma se deterioraron con un fuerte temblor que se registró en su departamento, por lo que ella teme que si se vuelve a dar otro las paredes sedan causando un accidente por lo que desea repararlas lo antes posible y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava y hierro para reparar las paredes de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rocío is 29 years old and lives in her own house with her 4 year old son and her family. She is an enterprising woman who makes her living as a cosmetologist. She does her business at her house and other people's homes when requested. She has been doing this for 7 years and thanks to her experience has a lot of clients who request her services.

Rocío wants to repair the walls of her house as the foundation of them were damaged by a strong quake that occurred in her department. She is afraid that if another one occurs the walls might give way causing an accident, so she wants to repair them as soon as possible. Therefore she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel and re-bar to repair the walls of her house.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel and re-bar to repair the walls of her house.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is married and she works hard to support her family. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Teresita is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina, 49 years old, is married and has three children. She has been farming coconut in the Philippines for 2 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling cashew nuts. Gina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers for her farm. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Ely

texts.en:
Ely is 40 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. She lives in Sumasap, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. Ely is engaged in rice palay (unhusked rice) trading, which she has been doing for two years. Her husband is a motorcycle operator and driver. She earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month.  

Ely requested a loan from PMPC, which she will use to purchase five sacks of rice palay for milling and retailing. In the future, she hopes to acquire her own cargo vehicle for fast buying and transporting of rice palay for drying and milling.

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of rice palay for milling and retailing

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina, 67 years old, is a widow with six children, one still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Marina has had a candle making business in the Philippines for 9 years. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials such as wax, cord, etc. for her business. Marina would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials such as wax, cord, etc. for her business

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a retail shop and also rears livestock to earn extra income. Joseph's main business challenge is price fluctuation. He hopes to be a prominent businessman. Joseph is requesting a loan to buy items such as soap, salt and general merchandise to boost his business.

loans.use: to buy items such as soap, salt and general merchandise to boost his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies like soles, leather, eyelets, laces, glue and dye to fill orders from her distributors.

loans.name: Jonas Alexander

texts.es: Jonas de 40 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su hijo de 14 años de edad y su grupo familiar. Él es un hombre trabajador que desde muy temprano inicia sus labores en su vivienda, ya que cuenta con un molino de nixtamal y una tienda de artículos básicos en su vivienda, lo que le ha permitido mantener la estabilidad económica de su familia. Jonas desea reparar el techo de su vivienda que actualmente se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, polines y pines para reparar el techo de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Forty-year-old Jonas lives in his own home together with his 14-year-old son and family group. He is a hard-working man who starts work very early, since he operates a corn mill and basic goods store out of his home, both of which have enabled him to maintain the economic stability of his family.

Jonas would like to repair the roof of his home that is currently dilapidated. For this reason, he is requesting a loan with FUSAI to invest in galvanized steel sheets, roofing supports/poles, and fasteners to repair the roof of his home as soon as possible.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized steel sheets, roofing supports/poles, and fasteners to repair the roof of his home.

loans.name: Cresensia

texts.en: Cresensia, 37 years old, is a hardworking mother from Oroquieta. She is a businesswoman who makes copra. She buys whole coconuts from her neighbors and neighboring barangays (districts). Cresensia has joined the cooperative to gain access to insurance and credit. She has applied for a loan to buy whole coconuts to make copra. Cresensia hopes to succeed in this business to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts to make copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production)

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline has a collection of ornamental garden plants. She finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities while earning an income for her family. As a microfinance member of PMPC, Evangeline has sought financial help to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell. In the future, Evangeline wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is a businesswoman who earns by retailing various items. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks for house renovation. She is on her way to renovating her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks for house renovation

loans.name: Delmy Dalila

texts.es: Delmy de 53 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que cuenta con un pequeño huerto del que extrae fruta de temporada que vende en su vivienda y de forma ambulante en su cantón, con lo que logra sostener la economía de su hogar. Delmy desea colocar techo al corredor de su vivienda, ya que actualmente no cuenta con uno, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, clavos y madera para colocar techo en el corredor de su vivienda, por lo que espera contar con el apoyo de este crédito para lograrlo.
texts.en:
Delmy, age 53, lives in her own house with her family.  She is an enterprising woman who has an orchard from which she gets seasonal fruit.  She sells the fruit at her house and in an itinerant manner in her rural community.  With this she manages to support her household.

Delmy wishes to place a roof over the hall of her house because there is not one there now.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized metal sheeting, nails, and wood to place a roof over the hall of her house.  She hopes to have the support of this loan in order to do so.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheeting, nails, and wood to place a roof over the hall of her house.

loans.name: Damiana

texts.en:
Damiana, 45 years old, is married and has eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 13 years, she has run a general store in the Philippines. Damiana has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as beverages, canned good, groceries, etc. to sell.

Damiana has previously borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF. She aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items such as beverages, canned good, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elvira is 48 years old and has three children who are in school.

Elvira has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish netting and other fishing materials.

Elvira has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish netting and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 40 years old and has seven children who are currently in school.

Mercidita has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Mercidita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 29 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell.

Judith has borrowed and paid back two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from fishing.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch, 49, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kandal province. He is the father of three children, one of whom is in school and other two who are in university. To improve his family's conditions, he grows rice as the main source of income. Moreover, he can earn extra income via mango planting. This is his second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and he has fully repaid his past loan completely. He will spend his entire loan portion to pay the tuition fee for his daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor degree majoring in Public Administration. He hopes that his daughter can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for his daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor degree majoring in Public Administration.

loans.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.es: La sra. Blanca siempre vende productos variados como ropa, perfumes, zapatos de manera ambulante, de esta actividad le ha dado los estudios a sus hijos los cuales ahora son independientes y trabajan por su propia cuenta, Blanca requiere el préstamo para invertir en variedades para su negocio que le permitan continuar avanzando en sus planes futuros que consisten en poder llegar a poner una tienda en uno de los mercados de Managua, de esta manera ir creciendo poco a poco.
texts.en:
Blanca always sells various products like clothes, perfume, and shoes in an itinerant manner.  With this business activity she has given her children, who are now independent and work on their own, an education.

Blanca needs the loan to buy various items for her business.  This will allow her to continue advancing with her future plans.  These consist of being able to set up a store at one of the Managua markets.  This way she will be growing little by little.

loans.use: to buy stock for her business.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en: Rufina is a businesswoman who lives in the town of Tudela. She is 40 years old, married and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari (or variety) store where earns a meager income that supports her family. Rufina is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken out and repaid several prior loans, so she is a member in good standing with no record of default. Now she is requesting a new loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. She continues to look for better business opportunities, which is proof that she has the passion and the energy to provide for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and consumable items.

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en: Inocencia has considerably prepared for the post harvest operations of her palay in Tudela. She wants to ensure that she will have ample time for the threshing, drying, storage and processing of her harvest to make way for another cropping season. She presented her proposal to Paglaum MPC and got a loan. Inocencia hopes to see all her children finish their degrees and have stable careers.

loans.use: To pay for post harvest operations

loans.name: Nanie

texts.en:
Nanie is 35 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Nanie is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nanie has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nanie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 47 years old and has four children who are in school.

Esperanza has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish to sell.

Esperanza has been in this business for 27 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Higia

texts.en: Higia is married and has 6 children. She has a very high interest in doing business. Higia has been involved in business activities since 2011, making the best of her own working capital of $400. She is requesting a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve and expand her business. Higia wants to use this loan to buy additional items to keep in her store including water, candies, soft drinks and other items to sell.  She is happy with the loan offered by Tuba Rai Metin because she will have more working capital to buy more goods. Higia also raises animals such as pigs, chickens and dogs.

loans.use: To buy water, candies, soft drinks and other items to sell

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is 33, married and the mother of four children. She is a caring and dedicated housewife. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He provides transportation services within Lahore. He used to drive a rented rickshaw, but as most of the income was consumed paying out the rent of the rickshaw, he decided to buy his own rickshaw. However, as they are financially not well off, they are short of money. Yasmeen, in order to help her husband, has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan. Her husband will pay the loan from the income generated by his new rickshaw.

They are thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: To help her husband buy a new rickshaw

loans.name: Ergie

texts.en:
Ergie is 27 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ergie has been raising pigs for seven years and also earns additional income from businesses of food vending and raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Kazypa

texts.ru: Казыпа 48 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. У Казыпы - среднее образование, на протяжении 10 лет, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается сельским хозяйством. Благодаря упорному труду Казыпы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется скот - 2 коровы, 7 овец. Также есть 0,45 ГА собственной и 1,00 ГА арендованной земли, где Казыпа выращивает пшеницу и кукурузу. Всю закупленную, экологически чистую продукцию Казыпа реализует. Ежемесячный доход составляет в среднем 12,000 сом (KGS). Казыпа обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений для выращивания озимой пшеницы. Доходы от кредита она планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Kazypa is 48 years old, married and a mother to two children. Kazypa has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Kazypa has been practicing farming for the past 10 years. Thanks to Kazypa's hard work, she currently has 2 cows and 7 sheep on her farm. She also owns a 0.45 plot of land and rents a 1.0 hectare plot of land on which she grows wheat and corn. Kazypa sells all of her eco-friendly produce. Her average monthly income is 12,000 som (KGS). Kazypa turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum" for a 100,000 som (KGS) to buy fertilizers for growing winter wheat. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to grow organic winter wheat.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en: Juan is the manager of a radio taxi company. He lives at his parents' house. Juan has two sons that are adults already. Juan has been divorced for 10 years. He needs a loan to buy a radio frequency extensor because his current equipment is old. He needs to renew his equipment to give a better and more competitive service. Juan loves his parents a lot, so he is helping in the house with money issues. He hopes you can help him.

loans.use: to buy a radio frequency extensor

loans.name: El Paraiso Group

texts.es: Esta es la Alcancía “El Paraíso” La cual  está constituida por 06 socias emprendedoras y responsables. Ananí de 56 años de edad es soltera. Ella se dedica  a la venta de abarrotes. Hace 11  meses que comenzó en su negocio lo cual le va bien. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para la compra de azúcar, harina, arroz y aceite. Su mayor deseo es continuar implementando su negocio con mayores productos. La Alcancía “El Paraíso” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por facilitarles este crédito. Ananí es la primera del lado  izquierdo y viste blusa morado.
texts.en:
This is the El Paraíso communal bank.  It is comprised of six enterprising and responsible members.  Ananí, age 56, is single.  She sells groceries.  She started her business 11 months ago, and it is going well for her.

That is why she requested a loan to buy sugar, flour, rice, and cooking oil.  Her biggest desire is to continue stocking her business with more products.

The El Paraíso communal bank is grateful to the Kiva lenders for providing this loan.

Ananí is the first one on the left, and she is wearing a purple blouse.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, rice, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Kalima

texts.ru: Калима, 45 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Калимы среднее образование, в качестве основного источника дохода для семьи, она занимается животноводством, начав бизнес 27 лет назад. На данный момент в хозяйстве Калимы имеется 4 коровы, 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход Калимы составляет около 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Калима обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Калима планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Kalima is 45 years old, married, and a mother to three children. Kalima has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, she practices livestock breeding. She started this business 27 years ago. Kalima currently has 4 cows and 20 sheep on her farm. Kalim's average monthly income is 12,000 som (KGS). For the further development of her business, Kalima turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 100,000 som (KGS) to buy cattle to increase the size of her herd. Kalima plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase additional cattle to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Дилафруз 28 лет, замужем, есть 2 детей дошкольного возраста. У Дилафруз среднее образование, уже 4 года она занимается земледелием, в качестве стартового капитала у нее было всего 15,000 сомов (KGS). Сегодня в хозяйстве Дилафруз есть земельный участок мерою 0,20 Га, также есть 0,06 Га огорода с теплицами, где она выращивает картофель, петрушку и чеснок, которые реализует на местном рынке. Экологически чистые и вкусные продукты пользуются большим спросом. Ее ежемесячный доход составляет в среднем 15,000 сомов (KGS). Дилафруз обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS), на который она купит удобрения и семена картофеля. Доходы от кредита позволят Дилафруз построить еще одну теплицу и отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Dilafruz is 28 years old, married and has two toddlers. Dilafruz has a secondary education. For the past four years, she has been practicing crop farming. She used 15,000 som (KGS) as start-up capital. Today, Dilafruz has a 0.20 hectare plot of land as well as a 0.06 hectare garden with greenhouses where she grows potatoes, parsley and garlic, which she sells at the local market. Eco-friendly and delicious groceries are in high demand. Her average monthly income is 50,000 som (KGS). Dilafruz turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum" for a 50,000 som (KGS) loan to buy fertilizers and potato seeds. The earnings from the loan will allow Dilafruz to build yet another greenhouse and renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and potato seeds to grow organic vegetables.

loans.name: Rahatai

texts.ru: Рахатай 53 года, вдова, мать 5 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 14 лет назад с покупки скота на сумму 7,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Рахатай в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 3 коровы и 5 овец. Также есть 0,91 ГА земельной доли, где она выращивает перец и люцерну. Совокупный ежемесячный доход составляет в среднем 15,000 сом (KGS), этих средств катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рахатай обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки 4 бычков. Доходы от кредита Рахатай планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, в будущем планирует накопить на свадьбу старшего сына.
texts.en: Rahatai is 53 years old, a widow and a mother to 5 children. She has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, she practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business 14 years ago with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 7,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Rahatai's hard work, she currently has 3 cows and 5 sheep on her farm. She also has a 0.91 hectare plot of land on which she grows peppers and alfalfa. Her average cumulative monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). This amount, however, is catastrophically not enough for a decent life. For the further development of her business, Rahatai turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 100,000 som (KGS) to increase the size of her herd by buying 4 bull-calves. Rahatai plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also plants to save money for her eldest son's future wedding.

loans.use: to purchase four bull-calves for fattening up and reselling.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a hardworking entrepreneur who runs a seaweed plantation in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 from NWTF to buy seaweed seedlings, plastic rope, and other items for her business. Maria has been in her current line of work for five years, and earns additional income from fishing. She has sustained her business activities through her own hard work with help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings, plastic rope, and other items

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 48 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emelita operates a jewelry business in the Philippines, which she has doing for four years. 

Emelita requested a loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more stocks of jewelry to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more jewelry to sell

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita is a married woman with seven children who is also a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 49 years old and has one child in school. Esterlita supports her family by buying and selling seafood in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 5,500 loan from NWTF to buy more items to sell. She has been in her current line of work for two years and her goal for the future is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more shrimps and clams to sell.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo works hard to support his family. He is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Reynaldo requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for his food production business. He has been in this business for three years now. In the future, Reynaldo would like to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for his food production business.

loans.name: Koulya 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Koulya 6  sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 6 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Tandio, un des villages de Yorosso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Ils collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités de maraîchage pour la première fois. 
La spéculation cultivée est  l’échalote et banane avec Moussa, assis 2ème de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter des Semences, intrants et matériels en vu d’exploiter sa partielle de 0,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koury, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Ils compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 115 000FCFA en fin de période.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et faire face à ses dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group Koulya 6 are married men, who average 38 years of age and six children each. All of them live in traditional families in Tandio, a village in Yorosso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The men are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso for the first time to carry out their market gardening work.

The crops grown are shallots and bananas, as is the case with Moussa, who is sitting second from the left in the photo. With his loan, he intends to purchase seeds, inputs, supplies, and equipment with the aim of making use of his 0.5 hectare plot. After the harvest, the produce is sold to a mixed customer base in the village and in Koury.

He plans on making an average profit of 115,000 francs CFA at the end of the period. This profit will enable him to pay back his loan and to cope with his day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, inputs, supplies, and equipment

loans.name: Koulya 7 Group

texts.fr:
Les 7 membres du groupe  Koulya 7  sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 6 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Tandio, un des villages de Yorosso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Ils compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 115 000FCFA en fin de période.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et faire face à ses dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group Koulya 5 are married men, who average 35 years of age and four children each. All of them live in traditional families in Tandio, a village in Yorosso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The men are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso for the first time to carry out their market gardening work.

The crops grown are shallots and bananas, as is the case with Bakary, who is sitting second from the left in the photo. With his loan, he intends to purchase seeds, inputs, supplies, and equipment with the aim of making use of his 0.5 hectare plot. After the harvest, the produce is sold to a mixed customer base in the village and in Koury.

He plans on making an average profit of 115,000 francs CFA at the end of the period. This profit will enable him to pay back his loan and to cope with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, inputs, supplies, and equipment

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  She is 49 years old and has three children who are in school.

Evangeline has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
As a married mother of nine children, Margarita works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Margarita is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Shehnaz's Group

texts.en: Shehnaz is married and a mother of five children. She and her family live in a small house in Lahore, and her husband earns a living by selling cooking oil. He stocks different varieties of oils such as almond, sunflower, coconut, apricot, and olive. They are used in cooking, massages and for hair. His small business doesn't allow him to save money, which is why he is often left with tight budget. In the hope of increasing sales, he wants to enhance his business by buying a larger variety of quality oils, because this will make his shop a more attractive place to shop. Shehnaz has therefore requested a loan to help her husband secure the money he needs to do this. They hope that the business will flourish and their standard of living will improve.

loans.use: to help her husband improve his oil sales business

loans.name: Simproko 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10  membres du groupe  Simproko 1  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Tandio, un des villages de Yorosso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités de maraîchage pour la première fois. 
La spéculation cultivée est  laitues et banane avec Fanta, assise 2ème de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des Semences, intrants et matériels en vu d’exploiter  sa partielle de 0,25 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koury, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105 000FCFA en fin de période.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et faire face à ses dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group “Simproko 1” are married women, who average 40 years of age and four children each. All of the women live in traditional families in Tandio, a village in Yorosso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso for the first time to carry out their market gardening work.

The crops grown are lettuce and bananas, as is the case with Fanta, who is sitting second from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase seeds, inputs, supplies, and equipment with the aim of making use of her 0.25 hectare plot. After the harvest, the produce is sold to a mixed customer base in the village and in Koury.

She plans on making an average profit of 105,000 francs CFA at the end of the period. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and to cope with her day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, inputs, supplies, and equipment

loans.name: Simproko 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10  membres du groupe  Simproko 2  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Tandio, un des villages de Yorosso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités de maraîchage pour la première fois. 
La spéculation cultivée est  laitues et banane avec Socho, assise 2ème de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des Semences, intrants et matériels en vu d’exploiter  sa partielle de 0,25 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koury, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100 000FCFA en fin de période.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et faire face à ses dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group “Simproko 2” are married women, who average 35 years of age and three children each. All of the women live in traditional families in Tandio, a village in Yorosso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso for the first time to carry out their market gardening work.

The crops grown are lettuce and bananas, as is the case with Socho, who is sitting second from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase seeds, inputs, supplies, and equipment with the aim of making use of her 0.25 hectare plot. After the harvest, the produce is sold to a mixed customer base in the village and in Koury.

She plans on making an average profit of 100,000 francs CFA at the end of the period. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and to cope with her day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, inputs, supplies, and equipment

loans.name: Las Mariposas Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario las mariposas lo integran cuatro microempresarias trabajadoras que luchan día a día por el bienestar de sus familias. Quien lo coordina es la señora Margarita una mujer de 64 años de edad, casada, ella comercializa frutas y verduras en el mercado más populoso de la capital, desde pequeña le inculcaron lo que era ganarse el pan de cada día de manera que ayudaba a vender, pero después decidió impulsar su propio negocio y con  ayuda financiera de su esposo lo logró, este negocio lo impulsó hace treinta años,  gracias a los créditos obtenidos ha logrado aumentar y diversificar los productos ofrecidos, este último crédito lo solicita para la compra de productos como es zanahoria, papas, cebollas, repollo, banano, papaya, tomate, etc., ya que estos son los productos que más demandas tienen en esta temporada. El resto de los integrantes son las señoras Jamileth de 39 años de edad propietaria de una mueblería desde hace cinco años en su domicilio, Desire quien tiene la edad de 43 años dedicada a la comercialización de frutas en el mercado más populoso de la capital desde hace cuatro años, y Maritza de 33 años de edad comerciante de frutas y verduras en uno de los mercados de la capital desde hace seis años.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Mariposas" (the butterflies) has four members who work hard every day for the well-being of their families. Margarita is the coordinator of the group. She is 64 years old, married, and she sells fruits and vegetables in the most popular market of the capital. Ever since she was young, she was responsible for helping her family earn enough money for day-to-day living, but later she decided to start her own business and with some financial help from her husband, she was able to open her own store 30 years ago. Thanks to loans she has received she has been able to increase and diversify her products and with the latest loan she plans on purchasing more fruits and vegetables like carrots, potatoes, onions, cabbage. banana, papaya, tomatoes etc. These are the produce items currently in season and in demand.

The rest of the members of the group are Jamileth who is 39 years old and has run a furniture store for the past 5 years, Desire who is 43 years old and sells fruits in the same market as Margarita and martiza who is 33 years old and has also sold fruits and vegetables in the market for the past 6 years.

loans.use: purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Mario Isrrael,

texts.es: Mario de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica al cultivo de loroco, maíz, maicillo y frijol, cuando ya está su cosecha la comercializa en los pueblos aledaños, ya tiene muchos clientes fijos, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Mario is 53 years old and he lives in his own home with his wife. He makes a living growing loroco (a flowering fruit), corn, wheat grain and beans. When the crops are ready for harvest, he sells them in nearby towns. He has many loyal customers and he is asking for a new loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, herbicides, plague control etc. in order to improve his fields. You can see him with his crops in the photo. The supplies purchased with the loan are needed in order to continue growing his crops because this is his only source of income and the improvements will help him to earn more money.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizers, herbicide and plague control.

loans.name: Fanery

texts.es:
Fanery una trabajadora confeccionista de 32 años, entre sus valores predominan la humildad, y el carisma pues esta mujer sabe disfrutar de la vida.
Fanery es madre de dos hijos de 16y 7 años de edad, la pequeña la podemos ver en la foto al lado de su desbordante sonrisa, Fanery inicio su negocio en su hogar y desde allí trabaja 10 horas por día buscando ganar los recursos para servir un plato de comida digna en su mesa.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos de la confección como lo son telas, botones, resortes, hilos. Ya que su falta de capital no le permiten comprar estos insumos tan trascendentales para su día a día laboral.
texts.en:
Fanery is a hard-working seamstress, 32 years old and, among her values, humility and charisma predominate since she is a woman who knows how to enjoy life.

Fanery is a mother of two children, ages 16 and 7.  The little one can be seen in the photo at the side of her beaming smile. Fanery began her business in her home, and from there has worked 10 hours every day looking to earn some resources to provide a dignified meal at her table.

She asks for a loan to purchase sewing supplies such as fabric, buttons, elastic, and thread. Her lack of capital doesn't allow her to purchase these essential items for her day-to-day work.

loans.use: to purchase buttons, elastic, and thread.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is a hardworking entrepreneur who earns a living by making food in the Philippines. She has requested a loan for PHP 14,000 from NWTF to buy more of the ingredients she needs to make items to sell. Rosalina has been in this business for 16 years, and earns additional income from pig fattening. She has sustained her business through her own hard work with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-making business.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa lives in Ermera and her business is a restaurant. She lives near the market, so she had an idea to open a restaurant for everybody to come to eat. She opened the restaurant in 2013 with her own working capital of USD 1,000.  She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more materials such as fish, chicken, beef, pork, tofu, tempeh, vegetables, rice, herbs and other things that she uses for the restaurant. 

She is very happy with her business. And now she is applying for a loan of USD 800 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business because she wants to open a bigger restaurant in the future.  She hopes with this loan, her business will improve.

loans.use: to buy fish, chicken, beef, pork, tofu, tempeh, vegetables, rice, herbs and other things to use for her restaurant.

loans.name: Pinky

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Pinky works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice. Pinky is borrowing PHP 8,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell through her buy-and-sell rice grains business.

Pinky has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is 49 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, she works very hard to provide for them. Felipa runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, soft drinks, canned goods, etc.

Felipa has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, canned goods and other groceries.  In the future, Felipa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, soft drinks, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Adelfa works hard to support her family. She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling charcoal and raising livestock businesses. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Adelfa has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Perina

texts.en:
This is Perina. She sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has entrenched her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for the educational expenses of her children and pay for their daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will lend her an amount of 19,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional stock of groceries, toiletries and beverages. Her customers will be likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from her variety store, Perina also operates their farm and house rental business. She wants to grow her business and she desires of becoming a successful entrepreneur. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 54 years old and married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

Conchita has requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell. She has been in this business for five years. In the future, Conchita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Erlin

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Erlin works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Erlin is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Erlin has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Norlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Norlinda works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income as a rice mill operator.  She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her business.

Norlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Gina successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is re-listing Gina's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Ruth Samaria

texts.es:
Ruth es una orgullosa madre de 2 hijos, casada y gracias a su negocio de salón de belleza ha logrado generar los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia.
Hablando un poco de su establecimiento podemos decir que es un poco rustico al estar en su vivienda, no posee muebles ni instalaciones de peluquería, solo algunas herramientas y una mano prodigiosa para peinar y realizar cortes.
Ruth en vista de la necesidad que tiene para amoblar su “local” solicita un crédito que invertirá en la compra de silletería, muebles, lavado de cabezas, vitrinas y surtido gracias a este crédito podrá ver materializado su anhelado salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Ruth is the proud mother of two children, married, and thanks to her beauty salon business has managed to generate the income necessary to support her family. 

Speaking of her little establishment, one can see that it is a bit basic since it is in her house, it doesn't have any furniture or beauty salon equipment, only a few tools and a prodigious hand to do hairstyles and cuts. 

Ruth, in light of her need to furnish her "salon," asks for a loan that she will invest in purchasing seating, furniture, a shampoo station, display cases, and supplies. Thanks to this loan she will be able to see her dreamed-of beauty salon materialize.

loans.use: to purchase seating, furniture, a shampoo station, a display case, and supplies since she doesn't have any of these things.

loans.name: Gresilda

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Gresilda works hard to support her family.

She has a personal product retail business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising livestock. Gresilda is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more footwear, clothing and other ready-to-wear items.

Gresilda has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more footwear, clothing and other ready-to-wear items.

loans.name: Escalando Peldaños Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Escalando Peldaños está integrado por tres socios con espíritu de superación, quien lo coordina es el señor Osman de 37 años de edad, acompañado y padre de cinco hijo que dependen económicamente de él y quienes son su mayor fuerza de motivación se dedica a la comercialización de muebles en Estelí, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de dos comedores con cuatro sillas y un juego de sillas mecedoras, pues son los que mayor demanda tienen en esta temporada. Su equipo de trabajo lo integra la señora María Estebana dedicada a la comercialización de sandalias en uno de los mercados de la capital desde hace dos años, y Maryury una joven de 24 años de edad quien comercializa calzado en el mercado más populoso de la capital desde hace cuatro años.
texts.en: The Escalando Peldaños group is made up of three members with the spirit to improve themselves, who are organized by Osman, 37 years old, partnered and the father of five children who depend economically on him, and who are his major motivation. He works selling furniture in Estelí. The loan that he requests is to purchase two dining room tables with four chairs and a set of rocking chairs, since they are of the greatest demand that he has this season. His work team is made up of María Estebana who has sold sandals in one of the markets in the capital for the past two years and Maryury, a young woman, age 24, who has sold shoes in the busiest market in the city for the past four years.

loans.use: to purchase furniture which will allow hm to meet the demand that he has for these products.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: Pacita, aged 50, is married to a welder and blessed with three children. She and her husband have managed and owned an auto repair shop in their village for almost one year and earn a net income of PHP 1,000 a day. Due to insufficient capital for her business, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase transformers for cars and motorcycles, to use in her repair shop. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase transformers for cars and motorcycles to use in her repair shop.

loans.name: Unidas Venceremos  (Jipijapa) Group

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Unidas Venceremos se reúne cada quince días en la en el  Cantón Jipijapa, esta parte de este cantón se lo conoce por su vasta vegetación y por estar muy cercana a las playas de Puerto Callo.
Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les ha servido de mucho en todo este tiempo que han estado en el grupo. La mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y al comercio en general.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Mercy, tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos mayores de edad,  uno de ellos aun vive en su casa. Su esposo no trabaja por la edad. Ella aprendió corte y confección hace años atrás.
Doña Mercy es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma para sacar adelante a su familia, ella hace varios años atrás como pudo instalo un pequeño taller de costura en  su casa donde se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa, ella  elabora la ropa para personas particulares y también hace vestidos de niñas que luego vende en su local, ella también vende productos por catálogos de Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), vende estos productos en su local y también en ciertos días sale a recorrer la localidad, lleva más de 15 años dedicada a esta profesión con la cual se gana algo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar hilos, telas, cierres y productos Avon. Lleva 4 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le están ayudando mucho. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
La foto pequeña es de dos socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The loan group Unidas Venceremos meets every two weeks in the Jipijapa canton, an area known for its abundant vegetation and proximity to the beaches of Puerto Callo. This is a group of people who decided to band together and create a loan group, which has been a great help to them throughout their involvement in the group. The majority of the area's inhabitants work in agriculture and business in general. One of the group members is Marcy, who's 58 years old, married and has five adult children from this relationship, one of whom still lives in her home. Her husband doesn't work because of his age. She learned tailoring and garment-making years ago.

Marcy is a very hard-working woman who likes to make her own way to push her family forward and several years ago she managed to set up a small tailoring workshop in her home where she makes all types of clothes. She makes the clothes for individual customer orders and also makes dresses for young girls that she sells in her shop. Also, she sells Avon products by catalogue (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women) She sells these products from her shop and additionally on certain days she travels around the area to sell. For over 15 years she has worked in this profession, and through it she has earned some income for the benefit of her family.

This loan is to purchase threads, fabrics, zippers, and Avon products. For 4 years she has been a member of the loan group and she likes it because the loans are really helping her. Her dream is to keep moving forward. The small photograph is of two group members that were unable to be present for the group photo.

loans.use: To purchase thread, fabric, zippers, and Avon products.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 54 years old and married with 12 children. With four children in school, Elena works very hard to provide for them.

Elena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Elena has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Elena would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Shaheen's Group

texts.en: Shaheen is 49 years old and a mother of five. She is in the picture wearing a black shawl. Her husband is a tailor by profession and has a tailoring shop in the nearby community. He has many years of experience and has made many clients over time. His customers are satisfied with his stitching. His sewing machine is worn out due to constant usage; therefore he wants to buy a new one. Shaheen has requested a loan to help her husband buy a sewing machine and continue sewing clothes like before. They are pleased and hopeful for the success of the business.

loans.use: To help her husband buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda works hard to support her family. Melinda is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, and soap.

Melinda has been in this business for four years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, and soap.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 38 years old and married with four children, three in school.

Melanie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Melanie has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Melanie aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like animal feed and supplements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, condiments and others

loans.name: Unidas Por El Progreso  (Jipijapa) Group

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Unidas Por El Progreso se reúne cada quince días en la en el  Cantón Jipijapa, esta parte de este cantón se lo conoce por su vasta vegetación y por estar muy cercana a las playas de Puerto Callo.
Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les ha servido de mucho en todo este tiempo que han estado en el grupo. La mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y al comercio en general.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Sixta, tiene 60 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esta relación tuvo 5 hijos mayores de  edad, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa junto a su familia.
Doña Sixta es una gran madre y ama de casa de casa que realiza el crédito para invertirlo en un negocio de venta de frutas y legumbres que tienen en sociedad con su hijo, el muy de madrugada los fines de semana se va al mercado de mayoristas lugar en el cual se surte de productos que luego él se encarga de vender en el mercado de la localidad. Llevan más de 10 años con este negocio con el cual se ganan el sustento de su familia, ella también en ocasiones prepara y vende empanadas y corviches con lo cual se gana algo extra que le sirven para salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar frutas, legumbres y víveres para preparar los alimentos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda el Banco. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y gozar de buena salud.
La foto pequeña es de un socio y una socia que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Unidas Por El Progreso community bank meets twice a month in the canton of Jipijapa.  The canton is known for its vast forests and the beaches at Puerto Callo.  
The members of the group started the community bank to support their businesses and say that it has served them well for some time.  The majority of local people make their livings farming and operating small businesses.
Sra. Sixta, 60, is a member of the group.  Her husband died several years ago and she has 5 grown children, one of whom still lives with her.  
Doña Sixta has always taken good care of her family, but she is a businesswoman too.  She and her son have a fruits and vegetables business.  On weekends, she gets up very early and goes to the local wholesale market where she buys the produce that her son then goes on to resell.  The business has provided the family with a steady income for 10 years.  Doña Sixta also makes and sells empanadas and corviches from time to time, another business that provides her with an extra income.
Doña Sixta will use this loan to buy fruits, vegetables and supplies for making prepared foods.  She has been a member of the community bank from the beginning and says that it is very important to her.  For the future, she hopes for good health and an ever-increasing standard of living.
The two small photos in the upper left corner of the larger photo are two members who couldn't make the group picture.

loans.use: stock her fruits & vegetables sales business.

loans.name: Agneta

texts.en:
For the last three years, Agneta has been buying and selling firewood as a source of income. She earns a monthly income of KES 6,000 which she uses to support her family. She is married to Jackson and together they are blessed with four school-going children.

Agneta has applied for her first loan from VisionFund Kenya and will use the entire loan to purchase more firewood for sale.She will use the anticipated profit to provide for her family's basic needs.

In the future, she desires to grow her business and be financially stable.
