loans.use: to buy more firewood for sale.

loans.name: Heidi

texts.en:
Heidi is 46 years old, married, and has three children. She is from Concepcion, Iloilo. She operates a retail store, which she has been doing for 20 years, selling goods such as  fruits and vegetables. 

Heidi requested a loan, which she will use to buy more canned goods, soap, toiletries, fruits, and vegetables to sell. This loan will help her to sell more to her customers. In the future, Heidi hopes to make her business a success and to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, soap, toiletries, fruits, and vegetables

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Florida works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. She is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing materials for her business.

Florida has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Lilimy

texts.en:
Lilimy is 44 years old and married with three children, one in school. Lilimy works very hard to provide for her family.

Lilimy runs a fruit and vegetable business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fruit to sell like bananas, pineapples, apples, and oranges.

Lilimy has been in this business for two years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits and vegetable to sell like bananas, pineapples, apples, and oranges

loans.name: Ma. Jinky

texts.en:
Ma. Jinky is 24 years old and married with two children, both in school.

Ma. Jinky works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ma. Jinky has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from videoke rentals.

Ma. Jinky aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
This is Amelia. She sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had enriched her business. She was able to buy spare parts and accessories for herr vehicle. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and meet expenses.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more with another loan 30,000 PHP. This new loan would buy additional supplies of accessories and spare parts for her jeepney. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family if the unit is regularly maintained and in good condition.

Amelia aims to buy another jeepney unit. She desires to improve her family's financial status and provide her children with a better future. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her jeepney vehicle.

loans.name: Sabyr

texts.ru: Сабыр, 54 года, женат, отец двоих детей. Образование среднее, на протяжении многих лет он занимается сельским хозяйством. Благодаря упорному труду Сабыра, на сегодняшний день в его хозяйстве имеется 5 коров. На участке мерою 0,29 Га он выращивает кукурузу. Прибыль от ведения бизнеса составляет до 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, он обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров для откорма и реализации. Сабыр планирует вкладывать доходы от бизнеса в дальнейшее его развитие.
texts.en: Sabyr is 54 years old, married and a father to two children. He has a secondary education. For the past several years, he has been practicing agriculture. Thanks to Sabyr's hard work, he currently has 5 cows on his farm. He also has a 0.29 hectare plot of land on which he grows corn. The average monthly profit for this business is 15,000 som (KGS). For the further development of his business, he turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." He is requesting a loan for 50,000 som (KGS) to buy two cows to fatten up and resell. Sabyr plans to invest the earnings from his business in its further development.

loans.use: to purchase two cows for fattening up and reselling.

loans.name: Cresenciana

texts.en:
Cresenciana is 59 years old, and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, noodles, sugar, etc.

Cresenciana has been in this business for two years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, noodles, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 48 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, and noodles.

Tita has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Tita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, and noodles.

loans.name: Mary Chris

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Mary Chris works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from charcoal retailing.  Mary Chris is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Mary Chris has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabric and supplies to start his own clothing line.

loans.name: Karem Vanesa

texts.es:
Karem una mujer de 28 años de edad, felizmente casada y con una hija de 7 años, curiosa, emprendedora y trabajadora esta mujer logro iniciar un negocio de papelería actividad que nació pro gusto y vocación al trabajo independiente.
Su mayor dificultad es que no cuenta con un local comercial, su negocio esta adecuado en la sala de su casa, pues son tiene el capital para pagar uno.
Karem quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de surtido de papelería para atender la temporada escolar, comprar una vitrina e iniciar a vender calcetines.
Su sueño es poder pagar la educación de sus hijos y tener un local propio donde exhibir su mercancía, por ello apoya a esta joven que con trabajo y tu apoyo lograra cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Karem, 28, is happily married and the mother of a 7-year old daughter.  She is a hard-working, enterprising woman and started her paper and school supplies business for two reasons: to have an income of her own and to meet the challenge of building something.
Karem says that the biggest problem she faces is having to operate her business from the living room of her house because she doesn't have the capital to move the business to another place.  
Karem is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her business with products for the coming school year.  She will also buy a display case and start selling socks.
For the future, Karem wants to pay for her children's education and open a store where she can move her business.  Please help this young woman carry on her business and fulfill her goals.

loans.use: to stock her paper and school supplies business.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a repeat client in Ugafode Microfinance Ltd (MDI, and a permanent resident of Jinja-Kawempe along Bombo road just 10 kilometers from the city center of Kampala. He is married to Christine and they have six children, and all of them finished school and are working. However, he stays with his three grandchildren, and he pays for their school fees.

He has so far taken 10 loans that have enabled him to construct the rental units that currently generate income for him. However, he faces a challenge of some of the tenants who do not pay rent fees on time.

He applied for a fresh loan of UGX 3,000,000 to construct a new pit latrine and empty the old one. This is for the purpose of creating a very conducive environment for his tenants in this Christmas festive season in the year 2014.   He is very grateful for the financial support from Kiva lenders through Ugafode Microfinance Ltd (MDI).

loans.use: to construct a pit latrine and empty the septic tank.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear

loans.name: Gulkair

texts.ru: Гулькаир 28 лет, замужем, 2 детей дошкольного возраста. Образование у Гулькаир средне-специальное. С 2004 года она занимается сельским хозяйством - животноводством и полеводством, благодаря ее большому опыту и неустанному труду, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Гулькаир есть 4 коровы, 3 лошади. Гулькаир выращивает на 0,50 ГА собственной и 4,50 ГА арендованной поливной земли картофель, ячмень, пшеницу и эспарцет для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Дополнительно она реализует молоко местным жителям. Ежемесячный доход Гулькаир составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Гулькаир планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение ее бизнеса и сделать ремонт дома.
texts.en: Gulkair is 28 years old, married and has two toddlers. Gulkair has a secondary-specialized education. Since 2004, she has been practicing agriculture, namely livestock breeding and crop farming. Thanks to her in-depth work experience and tireless hard work, Gulkair currently has 4 cows and 3 horses on her farm. Gulkair also owns a 0.50 hectare plot of land and rents a 4.50 hectare plot of land on which she grows potatoes, barley, wheat and sainfoin for personal consumption and sale. Additionally, she sells milk to local residents. Gulkair's average monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). For the further development of her business, she turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 50,000 som (KGS) to buy cattle to increase the size of her herd. Gulkair plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further expansion of her business and to make home repairs.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Chimedregzen

texts.en: Chimedregzen is 23 years old and lives with her parents and brother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  She began working as a physician at a hospital five months ago just after her graduation from university. Her father works as an accountant at a private company. Her mother has retired from work and her brother currently studies at university. She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam in order to repair her house. As a result, her family will live in comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and fewer pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to repair her house in order to burn less coal for heating

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 43 years old and married with four children, three in school. Alma works very hard to provide for her family

Alma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional household goods to sell.

In the future, Alma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional household goods to sell

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Nelly works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising livestock. Nelly is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more charcoal to sell to customers.

Nelly has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Arsena

texts.en:
Arsena is 50 years old, married, with three children, two in school.

Arsena is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Arsena requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Arsena has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Percy

texts.en:
Percy is 59 years old and married with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Percy has a fishing business in the Philippines. Percy requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Percy has been in this business for five years. In the future, Percy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 38 years old and married with one child.

Rosemarie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rosemarie has been in this business for five years and has previously received loans through Kiva.

Rosemarie aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 23 years old and has two children. She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer and new seeds.

Michelle has been in business for five years now, and has borrowed in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer and new seeds.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more ingredients for her food business.

Veronica has been in this business for eleven years now, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. In the future, Veronica would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Hermosilia

texts.en:
Hermosilia is 43 years old, married, and has two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years. She earns additional income from farming rice.

Hermosilia requested a loan from NWTF for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She hopes to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana una atractiva mujer de 24 años de edad, casada con una persona de similar edad, por lo que es un matrimonio joven donde ambos trabajar para levantar un hogar.
Viviana se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas, actividad que aprendió sola y ejerce pro necesidad económica, aunque aspira a tener un restaurante más adelante.
Viviana solicita de manera cordial una ayuda para comprar insumos, pues su negocio empieza y sabe que en la época de vacaciones tendrá mejores ventas pero no tiene suficiente surtido, su mayor necesidad pasa por su matrimonio no quiere fracasar en su trabajo y tener que ir donde sus padres que le dijeron que el matrimonio tan joven era un error, quiere luchar y progresar junto con su pareja.
texts.en:
Viviana is an attractive 24 year old woman.  She is married to a person of a similar age.  Since they married young, they both work to establish their household.

Viviana works selling fast food.  She learned this work alone and does it out of financial necessity.  She hopes to have a restaurant in the future.  

Viviana cordially requests help to purchase ingredients, since her business is new and she knows that during vacation time she will have more sales, but she does not have enough stock.  She does not want her business to fail and have to return to her parents, since they said her young marriage was a mistake and she wants to struggle and succeed together with her partner.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make fast food.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es: Esta es la Nueva Alcancía “Mujeres Luchadoras” La cual  está constituida por 07 socias con muchas ganas de comenzar a desarrollarse en sus negocios. Medalith de 19 años de edad es separada. Ella se dedica  a la venta de productos de belleza y cosméticos. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sobresalir adelante en su negocio lo cual ofrece por catalogo a sus clientes.  Su mayor deseo es poner su tienda de cosméticos. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de perfume, colonia, desodorante y talco. La Nueva Alcancía “Mujeres Luchadoras” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por facilitarles este crédito. Medalith se encuentra en la parte posterior es la cuarta del lado  izquierdo y viste polo marrón.
texts.en: This is the new borrowing group "Mujeres Luchadoras", which consists of 7 group members who are hungry to start developing their businesses. Meredith is 19 years old and separated.  She works in the sale of beauty products and cosmetics. With lots of hard work she has managed to excel in her business, which functions through selling catalogue items to her customers. Her biggest wish is to set up a cosmetics store. She requested a loan to purchase perfume, Cologne, deodorant, and talcum powder. The new borrowing group "Mujeres Luchadoras" thanks the Kiva lenders for facilitating this loan. Meredith can be seen in the back, fourth from the left and wearing a brown polo shirt.

loans.use: To purchase perfume, Cologne, deodorant, and talcum powder.

loans.name: Bazarhon

texts.ru: Базархон 46 лет, не замужем, есть 2 дочерей, старшей 11 лет, младшей - 1 годик. Она работает в пожарной части и на стройке поваром, также на протяжении многих лет занимается животноводством, стартовав в далеком 2005 году. В хозяйстве есть 4 коров, 2 нетели, 10 овец. Благодаря упорному труду, Базархон на сегодняшний день имеет прибыль 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь Базархон и ее дочерей. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Базархон планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, чтобы улучшить благосотояние ее семьи.
texts.en: Bazarhon is 46 years old and unmarried. She has two daughters - the eldest is 11 year old, the youngest is 1 year old. She works in a fire station and a building site as a cook. For many years, she has also practiced livestock breeding. She started this business way back in 2005. She currently has 4 cows, 2 heifers and 10 sheep on her farm. Thanks to Bazarhon's hard work, she makes 15,000 som (KGS) profit per month. This amount is not enough for a decent life for Bazarhon and her daughters. For the further development of her business, she turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 100,000 som (KGS) to buy cattle. Bazarhon plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further development of her business so that she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 54-year-old, married woman with five children, residing in the town of Dulag, Leyte. Two of her children are still attending school. She has been raising hogs for almost 20 years now. Aside from hog raising, she also makes and sells tuba (coconut) wine.

Teresita is asking for a loan to buy pig feed and tungog- a maroon color that gives a bitter taste and natural fermentation for the coconut wine. This will help Teresita grow and sell more hogs. She can also now produce and sell more tuba. In this way, she can earn higher income and continue to send her children to school.

Teresita hopes that she can manage her current businesses very well in order to be successful in life. This can be the start of the recovery of her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and tungog- a maroon color that gives a bitter taste and natural fermentation for the coconut wine.

loans.name: Deiby

texts.es:
Deiby un hombre de 27 años de edad, padre de 4 hijos todos ellos menores de edad y orgullosamente casado.
Para Deiby su familia significa todo, por circunstancias de la vida tuvo un accidente dejándolo imposibilitado para ejercer muchos trabajos, pero sin embargo este admirable hombre, sale todos los días a vender sus frutas.
Su mayor dificultad es desplazar su negocio debido a la incapacidad que le genero el accidente es por ello que quiere pedir una ayuda para la compra de un tráiler con lo que podrá movilizarse con mayor facilidad y sin masificar mucho su dolor, la otra parte del préstamo lo invertirá en surtido de fruta.
Apoya este hombre que de verdad tiene una necesidad, tu apoyo puede dar un cambio radical en la forma de trabajar de Deiby
texts.en:
Deiby, 27, is proudly married and the father of 4 young children.  His family, he says, means everything to him.
Deiby suffered an accident that left him unable to do every job but this proud man didn't let his injury stop him from working.  He started a fruits sales business and goes out every day now to make a living.
Deiby's problem is that he can't easily get around because of his injury and he is applying for a loan, part of which he will use to buy a trailer for moving his kiosk.  The investment will allow him to move the kiosk more easily and avoid aggravating his injury.  He will use the rest of the loan to stock his fruits business.
Please support this important investment.  Your loans will make a radical change to how Deiby carries on his business.

loans.use: to buy a trailer for moving his kiosk from place to place.

loans.name: Soriano

texts.es:
Soriano tiene 38 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge y su hija en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La población de este distrito se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercio de ganado vacuno (vacas), cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Adicionalmente el cliente se desempeña como peón agrícola realizando labores de cultivo de arroz. El destino del crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de ganado vacuno para su negocio. Con esto Soriano espera mejorar la productividad de su negocio lo que se verá reflejado en sus ingresos, permitiéndole aumentar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Soriano, 38, is in a common-law relationship and lives with his spouse and his daughter in the district of Pucará in the province of Jaén in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.  The community in that district works in agriculture, ranching, and commerce.

He works raising and selling cattle.  He has more than 10 years of experience in the business and has very good personal and work references in the region.  He also works as an agricultural day laborer with rice crops.

The loan is to buy a large quantity of cattle for his business.

Soriano hopes to improve his business productivity with the loan.  This will be reflected in his income and, in turn, improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a large number of cattle for his business

loans.name: Myriam Stella

texts.es:
Myriam una madre cabeza de familia, tiene una bebe de tan solo 2 años de edad muy hermosa y se desempeña como comerciante en una papelería que ubico en un espacio de su casa e inicio por iniciativa propia con la necesidad de generar ingreso para el sostenimiento de su hogar.
Gracias a este negocio puede cuidar a su hija y puede ganar el sustento para bebe y ahora piensa en grande, quiere ser más ambiciosa y dejar el miedo a la inversión pues confía en tener éxito y generar mayores ingresos para montar un local.
Solicita un apoyo para la compra de dos vitrinas, en una pondrán surtido de útiles escolares y en la otra, con lo que le quede del préstamo la llenara de pijamas para tener nueva línea de servicios.
texts.en:
Myriam is a female head of household.  She has a beautiful two year old daughter and works as a merchant at a stationery store located in her home.  She started this business on her own since she needed to earn income to support her household.

Thanks to this business, she can care for her daughter and support her.  She is now thinking bigger and wants to be more ambitious and stop worrying about the investment since she is confident she will be successful and generate more income by opening a store.

She is requesting this loan to purchase two display cases, one for her stock of school supplies, and the other will be filled with pajamas she buys with the remainder of the loan so that she can offer a new line of products.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies and pajamas.

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru: Айгул 46 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей, самому младшему - 14 лет. У Айгул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Айгул на сегодняшний день имеется 5 коров, 11 лошадей и 10 овец. Также она арендует 2,50 ГА земли, где  выращивают ячмень, кукурузу и арбузы для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет до 25,000 сом (KGS). В целях увеличения своего бизнеса Айгул обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Айгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Aigul is 46 years old, married and, together with her husband, is raising 3 children - the youngest of whom is 14 years old.  Aigul has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, she practices livestock breeding and crop farming. Thanks to Aigul's hard work, she currently has 5 cows, 11 horses and 10 sheep on her farm. She also rents a 2.50 hectare plot of land on which she grows barley, corn and watermelons for sale. Her average monthly in come is 25,000 som (KGS). For the further development of her business, Aigul turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 50,000 som (KGS) to buy cattle to fatten up and resell. Aigul plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for fattening up and reselling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her carrot crop.

loans.name: Reyhan

texts.en:
Reyhan  is a 49-year-old married woman with two children. She lives in the Agsu region with her family. She has no formal education but created a little business for herself at her home.
 
She has sold clothing for 29 years and earns income is 150 AZN/month.   Every weekend she goes to the city to buy new  fashionable clothes for her shop. This income is not enough for her to provide for the family. For this reason she wants a loan to buy new clothes for her shop.

She believes that If she sells different types of clothing many clients will buy.  She hopes  lenders help her to increase her business .
This is her first  loan. Please help her.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her shop.

loans.name: Cruzita  Zoraida

texts.es:
Cruzita es una señora casada con un hijo, al que le proporcona su apòyo para su formaciòn , de profesion maestra, y se desmpeña como como directora de un centro  escolar del municipio donde vive desde hace 23 años de ejercer dicha labor. y tiene como otra alternativa econòmica una pulperia en su casa de habitaciòn para de esa manera ayudarse a mantener los estudios de su hijo y poder seguir  adelante.
Actualmente esta señora se acerco a la oficina de Ceprodel para solicitar su cuarto financiamiento el que lo utilizaria en la compra de un refrigerardor y una licuadora. los cuales le servirian para vender refrescos en su pulperia y para el uso de su hogar tambien.
Esta señora se encuentra buen agradecida con Ceprodel y con las demas organizaciones que por medio  de ceprodel le han ayudado a sober vivir y a tener mejores condiciones de vida  en su familia.
texts.en: Cruzita is a married lady with a son, to whom she gives her support for his education to become a teacher. She is the director of an educational centre of the municipality where she has been living for 23 years now to perform said job. As an alternative source of income, she has a small grocery store in her house in order to help herself maintain her son's education and to get ahead. Currently, this lady has approached the Ceprodel office to request her fourth loan, which she will use to buy a refrigerator and a blender, which will serve the purpose of selling drinks in her grocery store and to use for her home as well. This lady is very grateful to Ceprodel and the other organisations as through Ceprodel they have helped her to survive and have better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and a blender

loans.name: Dinara

texts.ru: Динара, 47 лет, вдова, 3 детей, младшему сыну - 9 лет. В 1992 году она начала заниматься сельским хозяйством. У Динары в хозяйстве есть 1 корова, 27 овец и 1 лошадь. Также на участке мерою 1,60 Га она выращивает фасоль для реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет примерно 15,000 сом (KGS). Однако этих средств порою катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь ее семьи. Поэтому в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса Динара обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров. Доходы от кредита Динара планирует направить на покупку земельного участка, чтобы иметь возможность улучшить благосостояние ее семьи.
texts.en: Dinara is 47 years old and a widow. She is a mother of 3 children. Her youngest son is 9 years old. In 1992, she started her agricultural business. Dinara currently has 1 cow, 27 sheep and 1 horse on her farm. She also has a 1.60 hectare plot of land on which she grows beans for sale. Her average monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). However, this amount is catastrophically not enough for her family to have a decent life. This is why she turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum" for the further development of her business. She is requesting a loan for 100,000 som (KGS) to buy 2 cows. Dinara plans to use the earnings from the loan  to buy a plot of land, so that she will have the opportunity to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase two cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to assist her carrot crops.

loans.name: Ainura

texts.ru: Айнура, 36 лет, замужем, есть 4 детей. У Айнуры высшее образование, 8 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду и целеустремленности Айнуры, на сегодняшний день у нее имеется 1,20 ГА собственного земельного надела, где Айнура ежегодно выращивает ячмень для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Также в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 1 лошадь. Ежемесячный доход от сельскохозяйственной деятельности составляет 6,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айнура обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 45,000 сом (KGS) для покупки скота с целью дальнейшего разведения и реализации. Айнура намерена развить свой бизнес, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита она хочет вложить в постройку сараев для скота.
texts.en: Ainura is 36 years old, married, and has 4 children. Ainura has a higher education. For the past 8 years, she has been practicing crop farming and livestock breeding. Thanks to Ainura's hard work and determination, she currently has a 1.20 hectare plot of land on which she annually grows wheat for personal consumption and sale. She also has 2 cows and 1 horse on her farm. Her average monthly income from her farming business is 6,000 som (KGS). For the further development of her business, Ainura turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 45,000 som (KGS) to buy cattle to fatten up and resell. Ainura is determined to develop her business which will fundamentally increase her family's financial resources. She wants to invest the earnings from the loan in building a barns for her cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening up and reselling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to attend to her carrot crops.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is a married woman with ten children who works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retail business  and earns additional income raising livestock.  Visitacion requests 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy rice to sell to customers.

Visitacion has sustained her business  through  five prevous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy rice to sell.

loans.name: Amanda De Jesus

texts.es:
Luego de la separación con su esposo, con el cual logro tener 3 hijos, Amanda se encontró en un situación muy adversa al no tener un trabajo para generar los ingresos para llevar si quiera un bocado de comida a su hogar, pero desde el año 1983 se dedicó al comercio vendiendo tenis en un local que con esfuerzo, prestamos constituyo.
Ahora se siente feliz, pues la época de diciembre trae excelentes energías, unión y prosperidad y para los comerciantes representa el mes de mayor ventas en el año, por ello quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de calzado para hombre y dama, apoya tu préstamo seguirá motivando a trabajar a esta mujer que antes las adversidades supo levantarse
texts.en:
After separating from her husband, with whom she has 3 children, Amanda found herself in dire straits.  She had no income and no means of putting food on the table, so she started her own business.  She opened her business--a sports shoe store--in 1983 with loans and nothing more than her own grit.  
Amanda is pleased with the strides she's made since and looks forward to a successful December, always the best sales month of the year.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her store with footwear for men and women.  Please support Amanda's efforts to carry on her business.  She has faced many obstacles and learned how to overcome them again and again.

loans.use: to stock her footwear sales business and ensure her family a happy Christmas.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena is a 62-year-old widow with 11 children. 

She has grown rice for 12 years and requests 4,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She has previously borrowed from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Yhors Anderson

texts.es:
Yhors es un joven de 22 años de edad, que ante su falta de recursos y necesidades económicas en su casa, acudió a la corporación interactuar que sabe que es la que apoya a los emprendedores que buscan salir adelante.
Su idea es iniciar un negocio de venta de comidas rápidas por lo que solicita un crédito para la compra de un carrito de comidas de segunda mano que se lo están dando a un buen precio, y comprar surtido entre cubiertos y losa desechable, ensaladas, carne, panes etc.
Las necesidades económicas tan marcadas en el entorno de Yhors lo han llevado a tomar esta decisión, es espera tu apoyo, prefiere ganarse su dinero honestamente y no como sus amigos de infancia que optaron por el camino fácil incluyéndose en bandas delincuenciales.
texts.en:
Yhors is 22 years old.  Facing a lack of resources and the financial needs of his household, he came to Interactuar, since he knows they support entrepreneurs who want to succeed.  

He plans to start a business selling fast food, so he is requesting a loan to purchase a secondhand food cart that he is getting for a good price, and to purchase supplies, including cutlery, disposable dishes, salads, meat, bread, and other items.

The financial needs around him have brought Yhors to this decision and he hopes for your support.  He prefers to earn his money honestly, and not like his childhood friends who opted for the easy path of joining gangs.

loans.use: to start a business selling fast food by purchasing a food cart and supplies.

loans.name: Jose Nelson

texts.es:
José es un hombre solitario de 67 años de edad, que inicio su negocio de tienda general pues no logro emplearse, es un negocio nuevo que apenas lleva un año de operación él vive gracias a las ganancias que tiene pues no tiene un familiar donde apoyarse o alguien con quien viva.
José solo le queda sacar su tienda a flote, pues sin ella seguramente quedaría en la calle, por ello quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de surtido en grano, gaseosas y cervezas.
Este hombre de la tercera edad necesita sentir su apoyo, no dudes en dárselo, te necesita.
texts.en:
Jose is a 67 year old man who's on his own, who started his grocery store business since he wasn't able to find employment. It's a new business that's only been in operation for a year thanks to the profit it makes, since he doesn't have any family that can support him nor does he live with anybody.  All that's left for Jose is to keep his store afloat, since without it he would surely wind up on the street, and that's why he's requesting a loan to purchase an assortment of grain, soft drinks, and beers.
This elderly man needs your support, don't hesitate in providing it for him, he needs you.

loans.use: To purchase an assortment of grains, soft drinks, and beers to stock his business.

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
EL Grupo De  Crédito La Negrita Nse reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar VIVE la señora María, tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 13, 12 y 5 años de edad, los mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. El marido realiza trabajos en automóviles.
Doña María es una gran esposa y madre que realiza el crédito para ayudarle a su esposo  el cual tiene un taller de instalación de equipos musicales en automóviles,  hasta el taller de su marido llegan muchos clientes que saben del buen trabajo que el realiza, allí el arregla equipos de música y también instala parlantes y otros sistemas de sonido en dichos carros a gusto y preferencia de sus clientes, el requiere de los créditos para comprar cables, cajas musicales, parlantes y muchas otras cosas que requiere para su labor,   lleva más  10 años  dedicado a esta actividad con la cual saca adelante a su familia de forma honrada.
Este crédito es para comprar cables, cajas musicales, parlantes y muchas otras cosas que requiere para su labor. Lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo De  Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos le ayudan mucho a su marido. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “La Negrita” meets every 15 days in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts that have been recognized on a national and international level. This place is also famous for its straw hats.

Sra. María lives in this place. She is 31 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children (ages 13, 12, and 5). The older children are in high school and the youngest one attends elementary school. Her husband works on automobiles.

Doña María is a wonderful wife and mother who will use this loan to help her husband, who installs stereo equipment in automobiles. Many customers come to her husband’s workshop because they know he does good work. He repairs stereo equipment and also installs speakers and other sound system components into cars according to the tastes and preferences of his customers. María’s husband will use the loan to buy cables, boom boxes, speakers, and other items that he needs for his work. He has been in business for more than 10 years and it has allowed their family to get ahead honorably.

This loan will be used to buy cables, boom boxes, speakers, and other components that are used for his work. María has participated in three loan cycles with the Communal Bank and she enjoys being a member because the loans have been extremely helpful for her husband. Her dreams include providing the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy cables, boom boxes, speakers, and other components for her husband's business.

loans.name: Paulo Jose

texts.es:
Paulo es un señor que tiene una relacion estable donde han procreado dos pequeños hijos, labora en la alcaldia municipal donde habita desempeñandose como obrero ( recolector de basura) desde hace siete años  de laborar en esta actividad. Paulo junto a su señora tiene una crianza de cerdos como otra forma de obterner otros ingresos y de esa manera tener una actividad su compañera y ademas para ayudarse economicamente para su familia.
actualmente este se señor se acerco a la oficina de ceprodel para solicitar su segundo financiamiento el cual lo utilizaria  para compra de alimentacion para cerdos, vitaminas, concentrado de engorde y concentrado para desarrollo, lops cuales les vendria a mantener la crianza de cerdos.
texts.en:
Paulo is a man who is in a stable relationship and has two small children. He works for the municipal government in the area where he lives and is employed as a garbage collector. Paulo has been in this job for seven years. He and his partner raise pigs as a way of generating extra income, plus it gives her something to do. This business has been a financial help for their family.

Sr. Paulo recently approached the offices of CEPRODEL so that he could request his second loan. He will use the money to buy pig feed, vitamins, formula for fattening, and formula for development. These products will allow him to raise and maintain the pigs so that he can sell them.

loans.use: to buy pig feed, vitamins, formula for fattening, and formula for development.

loans.name: Hằng

texts.en:
Hằng  is a 29-year-old married farmer  with 2 children.  She lives and works in the Dong Son district, a  rural area in the Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Hằng  joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business and has successfully repaid 1 loan.

Hằng  has been involved in this business for 7 years.  The main hardship that Hằng  faces in her life is not having a water tank and water filter. She requests  a loan to buy a water tank and make a well.

With her business profit, Hằng  hopes to build a new house, have a healthy and happy family, and a successful business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and make a well.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia has owned and operated a farm to grow  and harvest pineapples for years. She is able to provide for her family and has successfully repaid her previous loan. She earns well from her investments.

Sofia wants to improve her farm to ensure a better and greener farm. She would like to apply for 15,000 PHP to purchase organic fertilizer to improve the farm.

In the future, Sofia wants to see her farming business thrive for she hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for farming supplies and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Joralyn

texts.en:
Joralyn is a 41-year-old married woman with two children, both attend school.

Joralyn has raised pigs for 4 years and requests 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has previously borrowed 4 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Joralyn would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has had a food vending business for 12 years.    Virginia earns additional income from a transportation business.

She is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF  buy ingredients for her food business.

Virginia has sustained her business through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She wants to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Señor De Los Milagros De La Region Group

texts.es:
La Socia Margarita pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE LA REGION, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
La socia tiene 32 años de edad es soltera y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando para una empresa privada en el área de limpieza, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de vivieres como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros para su hogar.
La foto fue tomada en dos grupos y con socios adicionales por motivos de trabajo y salud, los socios están agradecidos con el crédito otorgado y se comprometen  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The group member Margarita belongs to the community bank Señor De Los Milagros De La Region. The bank is located in the Cusco province. The group member is 32 years old, single and has two children. She alternates her daily activities working for a private company that does cleaning. For quite a while the group member has worked at her job and it has gone well for her thanks to the effort she makes every day. The group member wants to continue working so that she can continue supporting her family.
The group member is requesting a loan to purchase supplies for her home such as rice, sugar, and milk among other things. The photograph was taken in two groups with the additional members due to work-related and health reasons. The group members are grateful for the loan provided and are committed to making the stipulated payments.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her home such as rice, sugar, and milk among other things.

loans.name: Munguntsetseg

texts.en: Munguntsetseg, 31 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as physician at a hospital since 2008. Her husband works at a private company. Their children go to primary school. The house they live in has deteriorated over the years. She requests a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy bricks, cement, fiberglass, and foam for house renovation. After renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and therefore less pollutants are released into air.

loans.use: to renovate her house in order to burn less coal.

loans.name: Marenco Group

texts.es: Marenco está integrado por tres mujeres emprendedora, quien lo coordina es la señora Patricia de 31 años de edad, acompañada y propietaria de un taller de costura desde hace trece años, gracias a un préstamo que le hizo a su hermana, es el décimo quinto ciclo que solicita los financiamientos en ADIM e invertirá en dacron, conos de hilos grandes, entre tela, gruesa de zipper, una de sus metas es la compra de una máquina bordadora, con los créditos anteriores ha logrado aumentar su negocio además ha comprado maquinarias lo que le ha permitido aumentar la productividad en su taller. El resto de los integrantes son, el señor Henry de 29 años de edad propietario de una mini pulpería desde hace dos años, y la señora Josefa de 60 años de edad propietaria de un taller de costura, especializándose en bordados, este taller lo impulsó hace catorce años.
texts.en: The Marenco community bank has three enterprising members.  The group's coordinator, Patricia, 31, is partnered and has her own tailoring business.  She started the business thirteen years ago with money lent to her by her sister.  This loan is her fifteenth ADIM loan and she will use it to buy fabric, thread, zippers and other supplies.  For the future, she hopes to buy a sewing machine with an embroidery feature.  She has used past loans to buy sewing machines for increasing her productivity and growing her business.  The other members of the group are Henry, 29, who has operated a small grocery for two years and Josefa, 60, who has operated a tailoring business, specializing in embroidery, for fourteen years.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of supplies to make metal furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, deodorants, crèmes, and other products in bulk.

loans.name: Marylen

texts.en:
Marylen is a charcoal and banana retailer.  She is 45 years old, married, and has four children. Marylen lives with her family in the town of Concepcion, Iloilo. She has sold charcoal and banana for more than five years as the source of her income.

Marylen asks for a loan to buy more charcoal and bananas to sell. The loan will help her to improve her stock and allow her to sell more to her customers. 

In the future, Marylen hopes to have a successful  business.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal and bananas.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius, 28 years old, is married. He and his spouse have been blessed with two children, 6 and 2 years old. For the past 4 years, Julius has operated a transport business via his motorcycle, earning a monthly income of KES 30,000. He also has a cow which he rears.

For his second loan with VisionFund Kenya, Julius has requested KES 100,000 to service his motorcycle, to purchase spare parts and to set aside some money for fuel to take his clients to all destinations as we near the festive season. Julius successfully repaid his previous loan. His hopes and dreams for the future are to live a good life and to provide for his family's needs.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle and to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a married woman with five children who works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business and requests 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials.

Mary Ann has sustained her business through 1 previous loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials to use in her business.

loans.name: Roquesa

texts.en: Roquesa, 28 years old, is married and has three children, two of them in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 8 years, Roquesa has operated a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies. In the future, Roquesa would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine, 45 years old, is married and has six children, two of them in school. Josephine has been in the agricultural business in the Philippines for 20 years, and has previously borrowed from NWTF to sustain it. She has requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies. In the future, Josephine would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy nylon, fishing weights, rope, fishing nets and floaters

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a 51-year-old married woman with seven children, one attends school.

Patricia has been in the agricultural business for 15 years and requests 6,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She has previously borrowed 3 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Patricia would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is a 35-year-old married woman with two children, one attends school. Belinda works very hard to provide for them.

Belinda has run a general store for 10 years and requests 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy canned goods, detergent, shampoo, candies, soft-drinks, salt, and cereals.

Belinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, detergent, shampoo, candies, soft-drinks, salt, and cereal.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon, 69 years old, is married and has seven children. Corazon works very hard to provide for them. For the past 8 years, Corazon has run a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, sugar, coffee, soft drinks, milk, etc. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more of these items to sell. Corazon would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as canned goods, snack foods, sugar, coffee, soft drinks, milk, etc. to sell

loans.name: Sonia Janeth

texts.es:
Sonia, una trabajadora, honesta y comprometida empresaria, madre de 2 hijos que ama y trata de ser muy productiva para que no les lleguen a pasar ninguna necesidad y puedan estudiar.
Su línea de operación son las confecciones donde tiene una línea de ropa propia, un negocio muy cambiante que se mueve por épocas y dichas épocas marcan la continuidad de las empresas.
Para las confecciones su línea máxima de ventas es el mes de diciembre y de estas ventas es que sobreviven estos negocios por lo que es una gran prioridad aprovecharlas, Sonia quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, resortes, bonotes.
Su mayor deseo en la vida es poder generar empleo.
texts.en:
Sonia is an honest, hardworking, and committed entrepreneur and mother of 2 children whom she loves; she tries to be very productive so that they lack nothing and can go to school.
She is in the clothing business and has her own line of clothes; it is a very volatile industry that changes from season to season, and these seasons can make or break a business.
The biggest season for clothing sales is the month of December, and businesses survive based on their sales during this season, so it is a huge priority for her to take advantage of this time. Sonia wants to apply for a loan to buy fabric, thread, elastic, and buttons.
Her greatest desire in life is to be able to create jobs.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, and buttons to create her own clothing line.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 33-year-old married woman with one child.  She has worked as a teller in a school for four years to help her husband cover the needs and expenses of their family. 

Mariam is an ambitious woman, who sacrifices  to provide her family with a better life. She requests a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a car  to travel to and from  work easily and on time.

Mariam hopes to get a promotion, increase her income, and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a car.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en:
Zamira is a hardworking woman, born in 1974 in the northern part of Tajikistan. She  is married and lives in a rural area with three children. Her husband is a dentist. Zamira graduated from the university in 2010 and  teaches chemistry. 

Zamira wants to educate her son and needs financial support.

loans.use: to pay for her son's education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure and other items to assist her crop of carrots.

loans.name: Sara Evila

texts.es: Sara de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus grupo familiar, ella trabaja como empleada en una empresa privada,quiere mejorar su vivienda colocando piso cerámico en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, pero con lo que gana en su trabajo no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, por eso solicita un crédito para poder comprar piso cerámico, cemento y pago de mano de obra, y asi ella y su familia puedan vivir mas cómodos y en lo limpio.
texts.en:
Sara is 36 years old and lives in her own home along with her family. She works as an employee for a private company.

Sara wants to improve her home by installing ceramic flooring in the area that is shown in the photograph. However, she does not earn enough from her job so that she can proceed with this project. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can buy ceramic flooring, cement, and also pay for labor. As a result, she and her family can live more comfortably and in a clean environment.

loans.use: to buy ceramic flooring, cement, and also pay for labor.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a married mother with two children who works hard to support her family.

She has a general store and  earns additional income from transportation.  Melanie is borrowing 50,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Melanie has sustained  her business  through 9 previous loans from NWTF and Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Rosita works hard to support her family. She has a seaweed business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Rosita is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy farm supplies for her seaweed production business.

Rosita has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies for her seaweed production

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Lucia is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of clothing to sell to customers.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es: Angelina vive en casa prpia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella de dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras dsde hace 19 años, quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo del lugar que muestra la fotografía, pero con las ventas que realiza no es suficiente capital para realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de laminas, polines, y pago de mano de obra  y asi puedan vivir mas comodos y seguros.
texts.en:
Angelina lives in he own home along with her life companion and their two children. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for 19 years.

Angelina wants to improve her home by replacing the roof that is shown in the photograph. However, her sales do not provide enough capital for her to proceed with this project. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to pay for metal sheets, beams, and labor. As a result, she and her family and live more comfortably and securely.

loans.use: to pay for metal sheets, beams, and labor.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en: Nasiba is a strong woman who was born in 1985. She is married, has four children and lives in a village. For the past four years, Nasiba has operated a business feeding and selling cattle. She plants forage for livestock. Nasiba plans to enlarge her business and needs financial support in order to fulfill her working capital.

loans.use: to buy cattle to fulfill her working capital

loans.name: Touchphaya

texts.en:
Touchphaya is a 23-year-old single freshman who is studying biology at the university. He is the son of a farmer from Tbong Khmum province, Cambodia. 

He does not have the finances to pay his tuition fees for four years and would like to request a loan. He will use the loan  to graduate successfully with skills necessary for his future job. Touchphaya wants to be a high school teacher and save money to build a house.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn, 28 years old, is married and has one child in school. She has been farming rice in the Philippines for 18 years, and has previously borrowed from NWTF to sustain it. Jocelyn has requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers for her farm. She would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan is a 58-year-old woman with five children from Kampot province. She grows rice  on four hectares. She raises ducks to earn extra income. She has been involved in  this business for many years and earns 6 USD per day. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will use the loan to pay her son's tuition to pursue a bachelor's degree. She hopes that her son can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay her son's tuition.

loans.name: Sarah Jane

texts.en:
Sarah Jane is 39 years old, married, and has one child who attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Sarah Jane sells clothes in the Philippines, which she has been doing for four years. 

Sarah Jane requested a loan from NWTF for 6,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more clothes to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is a 44-year-old married woman with two children, both attend school. Marife works very hard to provide for her family.

Marife has run a personal products business for 2 years and requests 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy perfume and lotion.

She would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy  perfume and  lotion.

loans.name: Robelyn

texts.en:
Robelyn is a 32-year-old woman with two children in school. Robelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Robelyn has run a general store for 1 year and requests 5,500 PHP through NWTF to buy canned goods, beverages, and groceries.

In the future, Robelyn would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, and groceries.

loans.name: Leodegario

texts.en:
Leodegario is a 43-year-old married man from Concepcion, Iloilo. For more than 6 years, he has run a small eatery, or carenderia, selling home-cooked foods to the people in his place. 

Leodegario is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients such as vegetables, meat, cooking oil, salt, condiments, rice, etc. This loan will enable him to cook and sell more food to his customers. In the future, Leodegario hopes to make his business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients such as vegetables, meat, cooking oil, salt, condiments, rice, etc.

loans.name: Thơm

texts.en:
Thơm is 39 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province and works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle, which he has been doing for more than 10 years.

In 2012, Thơm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve his  business. He requested his second loan, which he will use to purchase equipment to build a biogas system. With his business profit, Thơm hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for his children, and for his business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to build a biogas system

loans.name: Thary

texts.en:
Thary, 40, lives with family members in a rural area of the Kandal province. She has three children and  sells coffee and grows vegetables to earn an income. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend the loan  to pay for her daughter's tuition.  Her daughter wants to pursue a  bachelor's degree in Tourism. She hopes that her daughter will get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's  tuition fee.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is married and two children who attend school. For the past 10 years, he has been selling welding materials and earns a monthly income of 40,000 KES.

Julius requested his first loan from VisionFund Kenya for 100,000 KES, which he will use to buy more welding materials to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to provide for his family's basic needs. He hopes to expand his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase more welding materials to sell

loans.name: Mágicas Princesas Group

texts.es: Mágicas Princesas es un grupo de tres mujeres que se unieron para solicitar por primera vez en ADIM el financiamiento con el objetivo de incrementar su capital de trabajo y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Es coordinado por la señora Samaria quien tiene la edad de 38 años, acompañada y madre de seis hijos dependiendo económicamente cuatro de ella, se dedica a la comercialización de frutas en el mercado de la municipalidad desde hace quince años, este negocio lo impulso con esfuerzo de ella ya que tiene unas manzanas de tierras en donde cultiva limón y tamarindo, una vez que se estableció en el mercado solicitó créditos para diversificar los productos ofrecidos, esta vez solicita el crédito para la compra de limón criollo, limón dulce y naranjas, una de sus metas es seguir diversificando sus productos para obtener mejores ingresos y así no le haga falta el pan de cada día a sus hijos. Esta socia cuenta con un buen grupo de trabajo ellas son, la joven Claudia de 22 años de edad comerciante de ropa nueva hace más de un año en las calles de capital y departamentos cercanos, y la señora Rosa de 33 años de edad comerciante de calzado en el mercado municipal desde hace cinco años.
texts.en: Magicas Princesas is a group of three women who banded together at ADIM to request financing for the first time, with the objective of increasing their working capital and improving the living conditions of their families. It's coordinated by Samaria, who is 38 years old, in a relationship and is a mother of six children, four of whom depend on her financially. She has worked selling fruit at the municipal marketplace for 15 years, and she pushed this business forward with hard work since she has some plots of land where she grows lemons and tamarinds. Once she established herself at the marketplace she requested loans to diversify her inventory. She has applied for a loan to purchase limes, sweet lemons, and oranges. One of her goals is to continue diversifying her products to obtain more income so that her children never lack for food. This group member has a good group of partners, namely 22 year old Claudia, a clothing vendor for over a year in the streets of the capital and neighboring areas, and 33 year old Rosa, a shoe vendor at the municipal marketplace for five years.

loans.use: To purchase limes, sweet lemons, and sweet oranges since these are the most in-demand fruits where she sells her products

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna works hard to support her family. Myrna is married and has a business buying and selling spices and vegetables in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of spices and vegetables to sell.

Myrna has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Myrna would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of spices and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Phillis

texts.en:
Eighty percent of Kenyans are farmers and  80 percent of the food that people eat comes from people who sell in the rural marketplace.  

Phillis is a 51-years-old mixed farmer based in Kutus, a remote village in Kerugoya area of Kenya. Phillis has a husband, and at home they have two children. For the last 20 years, Phillis has been actively engaged in mixed farming. She sells her farm’s produce at a local market near her home. Her main income sources include milk, rice, eggs and vegetables. Her in-depth knowledge of her environment has enabled Phillis to get her hands on numerous small business opportunities. 

Phillis is seeking a loan to purchase more poultry. She is very passionate about poultry farming. The most enjoyable task to her is raising poultry. Ironically, she doesn't enjoy feeding cows. Having additional poultry on her farm will bring her untold joy. The hens will also increase the farm's egg production and thus, increase sales volume. Phillis needs to increase her income to take care of her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru: Ее зовут Шахло. Ей 41 год. Шахло проживает в маленьком городке под названием Турсунзода или иначе Регар. Шахло является матерю четверых детей. Она растет малолетних детей сама. Шахло зарабатывает за жизнь путем предоставления услуги портнихи. В этой сфере работы она уже 20 лет.  Шахло столько лет работала ради детей. Она не жалеет сил и времени, чтобы поставить их на ноги. На данный момент на пути Шахло обернулась большая проблема, которую она не в силах решить в одиночку. Но Вы можете ей. У нее сломалась швейная машинка и не пригодна для дальнейшего использования. Ей надо срочно купить швейную машинку, но она не имеет достаточных денег для покупки. Шахло лишилась источника дохода. У нее вся надежда остается на получения кредита. Шахло надеется на вашу помощь.
texts.en: Her name is Shahlo. She is 41 years old. Shahlo lives in the small town of Tursun-zoda, sometimes known as Regar. Shahlo is a mother to four children. She is raising her young children by herself. Shahlo earns a living by offering seamstress services. She has been working in this sphere for 20 years. For many years, Shahlo has worked for the benefit of her children. She spares no time or effort to get them on their feet. Currently, Shahlo has a huge problem standing in her way which she can not resolve on her own. But you can help her. Her sewing machine broke and it cannot be fixed and used for further work. She needs to urgently buy a new sewing machine, but she does not have enough money for this purchase. Shahlo has had her source of income taken away. All of her hopes rest upon receiving a loan. Shahlo relies on your assistance.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to regain a source of income.

loans.name: Nuevo Crecer Sullcataca Alta Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVO CRECER SULLCATACA ALTA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juliana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de pantalones, venta de tejidos de mantas, venta de queso.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juliana es integrante, ella indica que es el primer año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de mantas de vicuña; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años, iniciando con un pequeño capital, el cual fue incrementando poco a poco.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana de vicuña por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de su comunidad y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en las ferias comunales. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen acompaña al grupo la hija de una de las clientas ella está vestida con una chompa blanca sin sombrero
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Nuevo Crecer Sullcataca Alta” is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Juliana is its president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as selling trousers, selling woven blankets, and selling cheese.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Juliana. She says that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer after receiving an invitation from a promoter from the organization who visited her at her house. Juliana currently has a business of selling blankets made from vicuña wool. She has become knowledgeable about this line of work since she started her business several years ago. Juliana started out with a small amount of capital and it has grown a little bit at a time.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying vicuña wool in bulk. She acquires her supplies from the wholesale vendors in her community and then uses them for making the products that she will sell at the community fairs. Working in this manner enables her to generate income for supporting her family. Juliana is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Juliana said that she enjoys the training seminars offered by the organization.

The daughter of one of the members is also shown in the photograph. She is wearing a white sweater and is without a hat.

loans.use: to buy vicuña wool in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, blocks, iron, purlins, zinc and to pay for the labor.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga works in poultry and cattle farming. Nga has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Nga is 35 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Nga's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having  a hygenic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Nga hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Teofila is 51 years old and has three children who are in school.

Teofila has a fishing business in the Philippines. Teofila requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing materials.

Teofila has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Teofila would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Simeona

texts.en:
Simeona sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had enriched her business. She was able to purchase additional gardening materials and supplies needed in her ornamental business. The loan also helped her provide for her daily needs and expenses.

She is very positive that she could further improve her business if you will lend her an amount of PHP 40,000. This new loan will go to additional stocks of groceries, toiletries, and beverages needed in her variety store. Her customers will likely buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales should also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. She will also use portion of the loan for the maintenance of her tricycle unit and her ornamental farm. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from improving her current financial status, Simeona also desires for her business to grow bigger and bigger. Every week, she meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гулмира, 44 года, замужем, мать 4 детей. Гулмира в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, более 15 лет назад начала заниматься разведением скота и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний день Гулмира имеет в хозяйстве 3 коровы, 6 овец. На земельном участке мерою 0,80 Га собственной и 0,50 Га арендованной земли она выращивает пшеницу и кукурузу, вся деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме около 7,000 сом (KGS). Сделав вывод, что данный бизнес рентабелен, Гулмира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку корма для скота и увеличение поголовья. Доходы от кредита Гулмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее хозяйства.
texts.en: Gulmira is 44 years old, married, and is a mother to four children. As the main source of income for her family, Gulmira has been raising cattle and crop farming for more than 15 years. Thanks to Gulmira's hard work, she currently has 3 cows and 6 sheeop on her farm. On her own 0.80 hectare plot of land and a 0.50 hectare plot of rented land she grows wheat and corn. From these businesses she earns an average monthly income of 7,000 som (KGS). Coming to the conclusion that this business is profitable, Gulmira turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan.
