She is requesting a loan for 30,000 som (KGS) to buy cattle feed and to increase the size of her herd. Gulmira plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further development of her farm.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed and to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
Cleofe is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Leyte, Philippines. Cleofe is engaged in retail sales of snack foods to the people in her place. She has been in the business for more than 7 years now.

Cleofe is asking for a loan to buy more food stocks to sell, like chicharrones (fried pork rinds) and rice wafers. With this, she will be able to improve her stocks, allowing her to sell more to her customers. In the future, Cleofe hopes to make her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more food stocks to sell, like chicharon and rice wafers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his University fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, iron and to pay for workers in order to repair damage to her wall caused by earthquakes in April 2014.

loans.name: Ojay Greene Company

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Yvette (on the Video). Yvette is a charming and enterprising woman who is raising a family and a company called Ojay Greene Ltd, with love and patience.  Yvette left the marketing world to start her own social enterprise, which aims to improve the livelihoods of the smallholder farmers in her community in Central Kenya. 

In Kenya, 80% of produce sold in supermarkets comes from only 5% of the country’s growers. Rural small-scale farmers cannot compete with larger producers because they lack the capital to transport and market their produce to more lucrative urban markets. This limits smallholder farmers to supplying informal markets; they are often forced to sell their produce to local brokers, or in open-air markets and kiosks, where they are typically paid below-market prices.
  
Ojay Greene was formed to tackle this problem by producing and aggregating fresh produce from local farmers to sell directly to urban supermarkets. The company further addresses the huge deficit in basic skills among farmers by teaching them about food production and marketing. Training packages are also provided to help farmers adopt sustainable agricultural techniques that lead to better quality produce fit for urban supermarkets.
Yvette’s business is still at an early stage, and she has many things to focus on, such as how to find money to operate her business and make it grow. She is now seeking a USD $25,000 loan investment from Kiva lenders. Yvette will use the money to pay for labor, technical assistance, supplies and costs to implement a pilot project that will source produce from 20,000 smallholder farmer suppliers within the next three years.

Yvette acknowledges that making Ojay Greene a success will be hard work. The company has recently partnered with Village Capital and Juhudi Kilimo to invest in smallholder supply chains and improve agricultural productivity and farmer livelihoods.  Yvette is excited about the partnership and the possibilities it brings.

Your support for Ojay Greene will help smallholder farmers break the chain of reliance on brokers and informal markets. Through Ojay Greene, they will be able to access urban retail markets that offer much higher prices, giving them the potential to increase their income by as much as 50% and invest in the futures of their families.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Ojay Greene Company  from Kenya

loans.use: to pay for a pilot project that will source produce from 20,000 smallholder farmer suppliers within the next three years.

loans.name: F3 Life Company Limited

texts.en:
F3 Life is a start-up that provides a unique credit solution to smallholder farmers in Kenya. When clients take a loan from F3 Life, the business helps them improve the management of their land  in a way which:
•	builds soil fertility for generations to come
•	protects watersheds, rivers and lakes from pollution by fertilisers and pesticides
•	removes harmful greenhouse gases from the atmosphere 

As farmers improve their land management, F3 Life rewards them with lower interest rates as well as higher credit limits.  Clients also receive farming advice which helps them boost their crop yields and farm incomes.  As we hope you can see, making a loan to this program is an investment in a farmer’s business and an improved environment for people as well as wildlife. 

Worsening soil quality is a major threat to smallholder farmers. During the last 60 years, nearly one third of the world’s arable farm land has been lost due to poor farming methods and continues to be lost at a rate of more than 10 million hectares per year. The United Nations estimates that soil erosion costs Kenyan farmers USD 400 million every year.  In less than 20 years, many Kenyan farmers will find they are cultivating land that cannot even produce sufficient crops to feed their families.  

With the help of F3 Life’s environmental credit system and farming advice, their land will remain productive and profitable for generation after generation to come. F3 Life’s model has been well received in the market. Its success to date has resulted in a strategic partnership with Juhudi Kilimo, a financial institution and Kiva Partner, which manages a loan portfolio of over 25,000 smallholder farmers. Juhudi Kilimo has offered its support to complete the pilot and scaling of F3 Life’s green loan program. The partnership will bring many new growth and learning opportunities to F3 Life, as the company embarks on an exciting new phase of expansion. 

Additionally, F3 Life is the recent winner of a global award for climate change finance innovation by the United Nations and Mitsubishi UFJ Morgan Stanley Securities Co. Ltd for its approach in reducing the effect of climate change. 

F3 Life is now seeking USD $50,000 to fund its growing loan book and further develop its unique farmer management system. We hope that Kiva lenders will not only share our conviction in the importance of environmentally sustainable farming but will also be willing to join hands and walk with us on our journey.  By supporting F3 Life through a loan investment, you will be providing loan capital to address the unmet credit needs of smallholder farmers in Kenya. Additionally, you will support improved environmental management and recovering soil fertility, as well as training to increase farm productivity by an estimated 30% annually. 

F3 Life believes financial inclusion and education are critical for both poverty reduction and environmental conservation. F3 Life invites you to help us make a significant and sustainable difference to the lives of farmers and the quality of their land.

video.title: Kiva Borrower F3 Life Company from Kenya

loans.use: to fund its growing loan book and further develop its unique farmer management system

loans.name: Futurepump Company Limited

texts.en:
Futurepump is a start-up producing solar-powered water pumps for irrigating small farms as an alternative to costly and polluting mechanical pumps. 

Food shortage is a recurrent problem in Kenya, affecting an estimated 10 million Kenyans per year. Food insecurities are largely driven by drought, with three droughts in the last decade and five drought-related national disasters declared in the past 20 years. 

Less than 2% of Kenya’s agriculture is irrigated, making subsistence farmers especially vulnerable to drought. The only existing irrigation solutions made available to smallholder farmers are prohibitively expensive, typically costing farmers USD $2,800. They are also difficult to manage and maintain, and are thus unsuitable to address food security issues in Kenya. 

Futurepump is solving this problem by introducing the Sunflower pump. The Sunflower pump is a low-cost water pump designed to lift 13,000 litres of fresh water per day from underground reservoirs for irrigation purposes. The pump is both robust and portable and offers farmers a cheaper, cleaner and more sustainable alternative to costly and environmentally unfriendly diesel pumps.

Futurepump’s innovation has been very successful to date and has resulted in a strategic partnership with Juhudi Kilimo. Juhudi Kilimo, which manages a loan portfolio of 25,000 smallholder farmers, believes that the Sunflower pump is a high potential product that is ready for the market. This partnership will bring many new growth and learning opportunities to Futurepump, as the company embarks on an exciting new phase of expansion.

Through Juhudi Kilimo, Future Pump is requesting a USD $25,000 investment from Kiva lenders as loan capital to reach new markets and further develop their product. With your support, Futurepump is expected to broaden its distribution network to make the Sunflower pump available to smallholder farmers all over Kenya.

In the next three years, Futurepump expects to sell 47,000 units to rural smallholder farmers based in semi-arid and arid areas. The portable, solar-powered pump will save each farmer USD $117 per year in avoided fuel costs. 

Your support will help Futurepump and Juhudi Kilimo in empowering rural farmers with environmental-friendly solutions that bring immediate benefits, notably a substantial decrease in irrigation costs. Additionally, the Sunflower pump will give farmers the opportunity to grow and sell crops out of season, bringing economic gains to their families and the wider community. Juhudi Kilimo believes that financial inclusion and innovation are critical for poverty alleviation and environmental protection. You can help support Kenyan smallholder farmers and make a difference in their lives by supporting Futurepump in their quest to provide them with affordable modern technology.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Futurepump Company from Kenya

loans.use: to raise loan capital to reach new markets and further develop their product

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna is from Vanadzor town, where she lives with her daughter. To sustain her daughter's living, Ruzanna works very hard. 

She works at a local food cafe as a waiter, and she also organizes clothing sales from her house. She receives her stock of clothing from a neighboring country, where her sister lives.

Ruzanna now wants to request new stock of winter clothing and sell it to her customers. That's the reason of applying for this loan. 

Ruzanna's loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of winter clothing for selling to customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plywood, fishing nets, and a fishing boat

loans.name: Daudi's Group

texts.en:
"Daudi, pictured above, has been a farmer for 20 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 12 farmers in Kakamega South District. He is 68 years old, is married and has 9 children.

Daudi likes to think of himself as a very experienced farmer. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to be more active in his community. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to consistently feed his family. Daudi plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Daudi’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 5.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 4 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Joseph's Group

texts.en:
Joseph is a 57-year-old, proud father of seven children. He is a group leader, who is often described as a very friendly person. Here, he is representing his group of 13 farmers in Teso District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Joseph has noticed that he has had more profits from each harvest.

Joseph says his harvest was very good last year, but he believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to be purchasing a solar light this year, in addition to fertilizer and maize seeds, because now he will have light during dark hours for his children to study by. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Joseph’s Group members will purchase enough inputs to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land, and purchase a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, and cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en: Zahida is a 34-year-old, married woman and mother of five children. Her husband (also shown in the photo) started a van-driving business, some time ago. He owns one van and needs some financial help. Therefore, Zahida has availed herself of a Murabaha of 30,000 PKR, for her husband. He utilized this amount to pay for repair and maintenance costs of the van. Zahida hopes that her husband’s business will prosper in the future.

loans.use: to pay for repair and maintenance costs of the van.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a married man at the age of 32 years. He lives in Ajloun. He finished a diploma degree in accounting, and did not stop at this point, but he decided to continue his study. He wants to get a bachelor degree in political science. Ibrahim has applied for an educational loan, to help cover a semester's fee. His future plan is to get a higher degree and work in his field.

loans.use: to pay his semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for medical expenses, doctor's visit's, different types of exams and medications

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 29-year-old married father of two children. He started working as a butcher six months ago to cover his family's increasing living costs. Mohammad is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase his business merchandise with more meat to satisfy his customers' needs.
This loan is very important to Mohammad since it will help him increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more meat to increase his business merchandise

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru:
Наргиза одна из жительниц населенного пункта под названием Шахритус. Шахритус находиться на юго-западной части Таджикистана и является одной из самых теплых мест Республики. Наргиза является семейным человеком. У нее трое детей. Детям 12, 9 и 7 лет, все они являются учениками средней школы. 
   Наргиза время зря не теряет. Она дома ведет животноводческую деятельность. В данной сфере Наргиза уже 5 лет. За такой период она набралась опыта и хочет расширить свою деятельность. Сейчас у нее имеется одна корова.  Она планирует получить кредит и купить мелко рогатых скотин. Таким образом, она сможет расширить деятельность, увеличить доход и позволить новые экономические возможности.
texts.en:
Nargiza is a resident of the village of Shahrituz, located in southwestern Tajikistan, the hottest region  in the country.  Nargiza has a large family: she is the mother of three children, ages 12, 9 and   , who all attend secondary school.

Nargiza doesn't waste her time.  She is involved in animal husbandry and works from home.  She has been working in this field for the past five years.  She has gained some experience over the years and she now wants to increase her activity.  She currently owns one cow and is planning to take a loan to buy small livestock.  This will allow her to increase her business and income, and will give her access to new economic opportunities.

loans.use: to buy two head of small livestock in order to continue her activity.

loans.name: Yusufjon

texts.ru: Юсуфчону 45 лет. Он является воителем маршрутки. Также он является мужем и отцом двоих детей. У Юсуфчона имеется высшее образование, но к сожалению он не нашел работу по профессии. Юсуфчон в течение 10 лет работает водителем. Он каждое утро рано встает, чтобы во время быть на своей маршрутной линии. Юсуфчону становится тяжело кормить семью, и он старается работать больше. Он решил поменять свою старую маршрутку, на новую марки "Sprinter". Тогда он будет работать больше и доходность увеличиться. Для приобретения новой маршрутки ему не хватает всего $4000. Сейчас Вы можете помочь Юсуфчону, он нуждается в поддержке.
texts.en: Yusufjon is 45 years old. He is a shuttle bus driver. He is also married and a father of two children. Yusufjon has a college education, but, unfortunately, he could not find work in his profession. Yusufjon has been working as a driver for 10 years. He gets up early every morning to be on-time on his shuttle route. It is becoming difficult for Yusufjon to provide for his family and, thus, he tries to work more. He decided to replace his old shuttle bus with a new "Sprinter" one. Then, he will work more and increase his profitability. He is short only $2000 from purchasing a new shuttle bus. Now You can help Yusufjon; he needs support.

loans.use: to buy a new "Sprinter" shuttle bus

loans.name: Karoti Group

texts.en:
ELIEWAJA, who is in her mid 40s, is a widow with three children, two of whom are still in school and one of them is grown-up.  She has been running several projects, a general store and electronic money transfers, for seven years now.  She works from 06am to 10pm daily, and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be ELIEWAJA's 16th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase general store inventory, started selling electronic money transfer, and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She is happy with the loan.  She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses. 

She will use this loan to increase the general store inventory, and to buy more tigo pesa, m-pesa and airtel money.  She dreams of building more rooms on her house, and to start selling her product at wholesale prices.

ELIEWAJA will share this loan with her loan group, "Karoti", which consist of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the general store inventory and to buy more tigo pesam-pesa and airtel money

loans.name: 020404090004 Hải Sơn _ Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hải operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase more tools to catch fish, to sell. She is 34 years old and she is married with three children. She is the leader of an 8-member group, the 020404090004 Hải Sơn _ Hoằng Trường Solidarity Group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2008, Hải joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hải has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. With her business profits, Hải hopes for her children to do well in school, to build a new house, and to maintain a successful business.

The child in the photo is Mrs Ngân's grand-child. His name is Khanh and he is 3 years old. His mother and grand-mother both are FPW's members.

loans.use: to purchase more tools to catch fish, to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 29-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and two kids, a son and a daughter. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income.

Mohammad is also a student in a local university, where he studies social science. He wants to take a BA degree and find a better job in the future.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to do his homework and write reports easily.

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Ana Fe

texts.en:
Ana Fe is 30 years old from the community of Baybay, Leyte. She has two children ages four and five. Four years ago, she started her business making Tabliya (chocolate). Tabliya is a local chocolate in the Philippines. It is made from dried cacao seeds, which are roasted and grounded. Tabliya will be used to make chocolate hot drinks or mixed in porridge called "champorado". Ana Fe is asking for a loan to buy more cacao seeds that she can use to produce more Tabliya to sell.

Her income helps buy food for her family and save for her children's schooling.

In the future, she hope to further expand her business for better profitability.

loans.use: to buy more cacao seeds

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
This is Sabina. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used buy more quantities of raw ingredients and other supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan for her to purchase raw ingredients like soya beans and sugar that she needs to make taho. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Sabina still desires to manage a bigger taho shop. She wants to make life easier for her family in the years to come. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for soya beans for her "taho" vending business.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby earns a living by selling frozen goods like tocino (cured meat) and longganiza (sausage). She is a 43-year-old married woman with four dependents. Her oldest child is 24, and the youngest is 9 years old.  Aside from  that, she also does farming. She toils the land and grows rice.

Ruby is asking a loan in the amount of 25,000 PHP to buy farming supplies like fertilizer, pesticides, and additional capital for rtw (ready-to-wear) start-up. Her farming business will improve, and she had high hopes of a better harvest this season. She could now start operating her rtw (ready-to-wear) business to have supplemental income. She can now continue send her children to school.

Ruby would like to expand her business to be productive, and also to be sustainable in the near future.

loans.use:
to buy farming supplies like fertilizer, pesticides, and additional capital for rtw
 (ready-to-wear) start-up

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 43 years old, and married with two children, one whom is in school.  She works very hard to provide for her family.

Jennifer runs a buy and sell vegetable in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional vegetables and fruit to sell like horseradish, radishes, apples, oranges, etc. 

She has been in this business for two years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables and fruit to sell, like horseradish, radishes, apples, oranges, etc

loans.name: Nanet

texts.en:
Nanet is a 43-year-old single woman with one child, who is in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Nanet has a food vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 2 years.   She has requested a PHP 6500 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

In the future, Nanet  would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 50 years old and married with three children.

Fe works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

Fe has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from direct selling avon products.

Fe aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more items such as Maggi, soft drinks, tomatoes and spaghetti.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en: Armen graduated from Yerevan State University in the faculty of Biology and Chemistry. He is 45 years old, and he lives with his nice family in Vanadzor city of the Lori region. He has two beautiful daughters; the elder is already a student, and the smallest is still school-aged. Armen now works at the school as a teacher of chemistry. He says that this is a subject that needs great attention and concentration from the pupils, and he tries to attract his pupils through his own special methodological tricks such as discussions, laboratory work, quizzes, and mannequins on which he explains the lessons. He also gives paid private courses of subject, preparing the pupils for the entrance examinations. Armen will use this loan amount for the purchase of a computer and professional literature, which now are the most important equipment for any pedagogue.

loans.use: to buy a computer and professional literature.

loans.name: Sahr M.

texts.en:
Sahr  isa 43-year-old married man with 2 children who are 17 and 12, both attend school. 

In 2011, Sahr M. established his tailoring and accessories business and works 7 days a week, 11 hours a day to earn 3,300,000 SLL every month. He would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Sahr M. has previously received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan to buy tailoring materials. His business has grown and can now met his customers' demand.  

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase tailoring material.

loans.name: Elvia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Elvia es una veterana de 50 años de edad, madre de 4 hijos que ha logrado mantener gracias a su venta de bolsos, dicha actividad presenta diariamente una feroz competencia que en muchos casos es desleal solo con conseguir o arrebatar un cliente.
Elvia compite a diario con personas que rebajan sus costos hasta el límite y por ello quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de surtido de bolsos su motivo es que los precios en el mercado están bajos y necesita igualarse para seguir dando la pelea.
Esta mujer solo tiene su negocio que con mucho esfuerzo constituyo apóyala, ayúdala a batallar contra el mercado.
texts.en:
Elvia is a 50-year-old senior and a mother of four children she has been able to support thanks to her bag sales.  This business is ferociously competitive every day and in many cases it is dishonest just for the sake of getting or snagging a customer.  

Elvia competes daily with people who lower their prices to the limit, which is why she needs to request a loan to buy a variety of bags; her reason is that the prices in the market are low and she needs to keep up to stay competitive.  

This woman only has her business, which she built through a great deal of effort; help her fight the market.

loans.use: to buy a selection of bags to bring her designs up to date

loans.name: Kadie

texts.en: This is 44-year-old Kadie. She is married and has one child aged 14 years. In 2006, Kadie established her clothing and textiles business. She began her business to better enhance her profit margin and take care of her family since she has been divorced from her husband. Her business is located at a central business district, and her main customers are both men and women. Working 7 days a week and 9 hours a day, she earns about Le 870,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Kadie requires a loan in order to purchase more stock for resale, such as 20 ladies' bags, 10 Africana dresses, DVD players, 10 sets of pans, etc. She hopes that this loan will better enhance her profit and monthly income, which will enable her to improve her standard of living. In the future, Kadie plans to educate her child up to university level and buy a plot of land to build a dwelling house. She appreciates Kiva lenders for their kind gesture rendered to her and prays that they continue their good effort.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more ladies bags, dress, etc

loans.name: Purity

texts.en: Hello World meet Purity. She is a smallholder farmer. She lives together with her husband in Iriga village, which is located in central Kenya. Their 10-year marriage has been blessed with two children, the youngest being  4 and the oldest 5 years old. They have managed to pay for their children to attend  school, so that they can focus on building a future of their own.Purity became a farmer in 2007, when she started making use of her husband's one-acre piece of land. She has grown the farmstead to a sustainable and profitable state. This unrelenting farmer is seeking a loan to further boost productivity. She is seeking a loan to purchase feed for her animals. The feeds that she plans to acquire have a well-proportioned nutritional content that will help improve animal health and boost milk production. On the farm, she has two dairy cows, eight poultry birds, and one dairy goat, and all of them will benefit directly from this loan.Purity was born second-to-last in a family of four children. She was promising, but her education was cut short in the first year of high school. Her passionate interest for farming took over, and today she makes a decent living by farming, to pay for her children's upkeep and education in boarding schools. She is so committed to the success of her farm that you will witness evidence of progressive techniques, like irrigation, on her farm. What also drives her is her love for animals. She named her cow 'Mwendwa,' which means 'loved one.'

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Hello Lenders! Meet Janet, a modest and hard-working woman who has dedicated a large part of her life to the care of her children and farm. She resides with her handsome husband; together they are blessed with three lovely children. She has been actively involved in farming for the last 10 years and has never regretted or looked back. 

She practices mixed farming and sells milk, eggs and various varieties of food crops at the local market. She passionately loves poultry farming but the biggest challenge she is facing is lack of capital to buy quality breeds of poultry that are resistant to diseases and lay more eggs. She is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase additional poultry. 

The excess maize she has will be used in feeding the poultry; sorghum will be used in giving the poultry energy, and green grams for protein. She believes that through better feeding, the poultry will increase their egg production and will lay more eggs that are of good quality which will translate to more income. Apart from an increase in egg output, she will get more output of poultry meat, and this will increase her income and profit. 

Through increased profits, she is going to turn around her living conditions and live a better life. Other than profits, she is going to benefit from chicken manure which contains the highest amount of nitrogen of any livestock manure and is very valuable as fertilizer. She will save more money that could have been spent in buying fertilizer. Your loan will bring joy to her family because she will be able to support her family and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Odai

texts.en:
Odai is a 21-year-old single man living in Jarash. He is studying to get his bachelor’s degree, and he is now in his fourth year.

His parents work full-time jobs. His family consists of six members. Recently, they have had some financial problems because of the high cost of living.

Odai applied for an educational loan to help him cover his semester fees. His future plan is to find work in the same field.

loans.use: to pay his semester fees.

loans.name: Tahani

texts.en: Tahani is a 36-year-old divorced women living in Southern Ghour. She has a university degree that allows her to work in the Directorate of Education, Tahani has a small project for selling cosmetics, accessories and some snacks for kids. She is applying for the loan to buy more seasonal items like blankets and winter clothes. Tahani's hope is to open her own boutique shop one day.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing and accessories and to add seasonal items to her business.

loans.name: Muhannad

texts.en: Muhannad is a man twenty-one years of age living in Jarash. He is studying for a bachelor's degree in computer science and information technology, and is now in his second year. His father's income is not enough to cover his family expenses and university fees together. So, Muhannad applied for an educational loan to help cover semester fees. Muhannad's plan in the future is to work in the same field.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 19-year-old single lady living in Ajloun. She is studying to get her bachelor's degree in Arabic language, and she is now in her first year. 

The income that comes from her father’s retirement salary is not enough to pay for Amal's school fees. Recently they were facing some problems that lead Amal to apply for an educational loan to help her cover her semester fees. 

Amal’s future plan is to get a job in the same field.

loans.use: to pay for semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Kawther

texts.en:
Kawther is a twenty-year-old married women living in Al Mafraq. She is studying to get her bachelor’s degree, and she is now in her second year. Kawthar’s husband works in a military function of the army.

She is applying for an educational loan to cover her semester fee. Kawther's future plan is to find a job in the same field.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fee.

loans.name: Ansam

texts.en:
Ansam is a twenty-one-year-old single lady living in Jarash. She is studying to get her Bachelor's degree in accounting, and she is now in her fourth year. 

Ansam lives with her six-member family; her father's and brother’s salaries are their only source of income. Rising tuition costs and being in a big family made it harder for her father to afford her university fees. This led Ansam to apply for an educational loan to help her cover her semester fees and the purchase of school supplies.

loans.use: To pay for her semester fees

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: After graduation, Ibrahim refused to look for a job at a company as he always dreamt of having his own business, and believed that postponing his dream could make it fade. So Ibrahim started right after graduation and opened a mini market with the help of his father who is a retired man. During the last five years, he has worked hard every day from 8 am to 11 pm adding more and more products and expanding the shop to increase his income, He moved from a mini market to a small grocery store where he sells most food products and other household products. Ibrahim is requesting a loan to add a new section for selling fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: To add a new section for selling fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en: Abeer is a 21-year-old single lady. She lives with her family in Baqaa, one of the Palestinian refugee camps in Jordan. They are living on her father’s retirement salary, but it was not enough for her to enroll in a university so she chose to go to a small college to get a degree. She chose to major in English language and started to work as a hair stylist in a beauty salon in the area to make some pocket money. Her plan after graduation is to look for a job as a teacher or in a translation office. But now Abeer is applying for an educational loan to help her pay for her next semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for her next semester fees.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a hard-working 20-year-old single man. He has recently graduated and holds a degree from an aviation college. One of his hobbies is fixing electronics, mobile phones, and computers, and he even took training courses to improve his skill doing it. Five months ago he decided to open a small business selling and fixing mobile phones while he was studying. Now that he has graduated, Ahmad is focusing on expanding the business, and is applying for a loan to buy more mobile phones, phone accessories, and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy more mobile phones, phone accessories, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for some maintenance for the electrical circuit and the affected equipment .

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay the rest of his semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Hanadi

texts.en:
Hanadi is a 21-year-old single lady. She lives in Mafraq along with her eight member family. 

Hanadi is a university student majoring in Banking and Finance, hoping that she can find a job in the sector after graduation. She is now in her third year and is applying for an education loan to help her to pay for her next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her next semester  fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Para comprar ganado  o cerdos.

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
Sarah is 26 years old and is often described as a very experienced farmer. She has three children and is married. As a group leader, Sarah is representing her group of eight farmers in Teso District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Sarah's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to buy a goat.

Sarah and her group will receive a total of seven solar lights, as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 2.75 acres.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Meun

texts.en:
Moern is 63 years old and married with five children, one of whom is still dependent on her.   She is a citizen from a rural area of the Phnom Srouch district in Kampong Spuer province.  She has been farming rice for 30 years to support her family. 

This is the first micro loan for Moern with VisionFund.  She is requesting for a loan to pay for her daughter’s tuition fee. She hopes to keep her there until her graduation.

loans.use: pay her daughter's tuition fee

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Nelson's Group

texts.en:
Nelson, pictured above, has 7 children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why he was selected to become the leader of his group. Nelson is representing his group of 15 farmers in Kakamega South District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Nelson has been a farmer for more than 30 years and, in order to earn enough to feed his family, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs but also two solar lights, which he is very happy to be getting as that means he will now have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this coming season, Nelson is planning to save more money for the future.

A total of 6.25 acres will be planted by Nelson's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as two solar lights.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction supplies to renovate the house from the inside

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a fifty-eight year old Komaza tree farmer. She has four children, two of whom are in school. Kadzo is married and her spouse is a farmer, too. 

In addition to growing trees, Kadzo also supports her family with making and selling charcoal. She decided to join Komaza because seeing the other Komaza tree farms growing well makes her happy.  

She plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to buy a plot of land and build rental houses for income. 

Kadzo’s favorite part about working with Komaza is growing cowpeas as part of the short term crops program.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support.

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en:
Abubakar is a maize farmer from the village of Hana Aiki in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, he would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abubakar can now store his maize at harvest-time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Abubakar, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest-time.

loans.name: Rahimqul

texts.ru: Рахимкул житель села Навкент Шахристанского  района. Ему 60 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей. У него есть высшее образование. Рахимкул работает  врачом в местной больнице. Он хороший семьянин. Его сын учится ТГУПБП города  Худжанда.  Рахимкул узнал о кредите с низким процентом для  учёбы  студентов  и обратился в МДО Арванд. Он хочет получить кредит для оплаты договора учебы для сына.  Рахимкул заранее   благодарен   за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Rahimqul is resident of the Navkent village in the Shahriston District. He is 60 years old. He is married and has three children.  He has a higher education. Rahimqul works as a doctor in a local hospital. He is an excellent family man. His son studies at the Tajik State University of Law, Business and Politics in the city of Khujand. Rahimqul learned about the opportunity to get low interest rate loans for education and turned to MDO Arvand. He wants to receive a loan to pay for his son's tuition. Rahimqul thanks you in advance for the financial support.

loans.use: to pay for his son's education.

loans.name: Ayuba Dankaka

texts.en:
Ayuba Dankaka is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Jeneth, Jethro and Silas.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ayuba Dankaka would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. He will use this loan to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ayuba Dankaka can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Ayuba Dankaka spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is an enterprising young woman living in the urban poor settlements of Kawangware in Nairobi. To earn a living, she sells energy saving stoves to her community. As a woman, she has risen above societal stereotypes and has found a way to sustain herself and her family. However, she needs capital to expand her business. This loan will enable Amina purchase more inventory to sell to her community.

loans.use: Purchase of eco-friendly stoves for sale

loans.name: Basuki Mahila Samuha Group

texts.en: Basuki Mahila Samuha was formed with five diligent women: Pramila, Sunita, Keli, Podo and Sanju, who live in Bandih village, Dumka district, Jharkhand. All of them are working very hard to improve their livelihoods. Among them, Pramila is the featured borrower of the group. Pramila lives with her family of five including her husband and three children. They make a living from a grocery store run by Pramila and her husband. She has been running this store for the last 10 years and recently she has also started poultry farming. Their income is stretched very diligently to cover her family's needs and savings. But with growing costs, and her children set to go to high school in the next few years, Pramila wants to start saving more. She would also like to insure her family, safeguarding against losses from illnesses and other emergencies. To garner more business, she plans on adding more items that can bring in good sales and she wants to improve her poultry farming. So she seeks a loan to invest in new purchases. The other members are also seeking loans to improve their livelihoods. Your loan will help them to increase their income.

loans.use: to invest in new purchases for her grocery store

loans.name: Pon's Group

texts.en: Pon ’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia.  Pon makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a construction worker and seller to support her family.In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of her family.  They will save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.en:
Alfonso is 57 years old. He owns a metal shop in his house. He has worked and maintained the business for more than 15 years. He makes metalwork for clients, such as hardware stores, but he also repairs metal molds for small manufacturing plants.

He is asking for a loan, because he needs working capital to fulfill a client's request. His biggest achievement is growing his business and buying some machinery for his metal shop. He has also provided employment to other people. His goal is to keep working and growing his metal shop. He enjoys his work.

loans.use: to fulfill a contract.

loans.name: Elvis

texts.en: Elvis is a bright young man living in the urban poor settlements of Nairobi. To earn a living, he sells energy saving stoves to his community. His business has enabled him become self-reliant and has also resulted in positive externalities for his community. Elvis needs to increase his inventory and this loan will enable him achieve that goal.

loans.use: Purchase of eco-friendly jikos for sale

loans.name: Erick's Group

texts.en: Erick and Regina are a dream team. Together they distribute renewable energy products to their communities and are able to earn a living at the same time. Instead of sitting around the neighborhood engaging in illegal activity, they have decided to lead the youth in their communities by example. Demand for the products is high and they cannot keep up with the inventory they currently have. This loan will enable them increase their inventory and deliver a solution that is direly needed in the poor communities they come from.

loans.use: Purchase of energy-efficient stoves and solar products for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar home system

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build the roof of her sewing workshop where more women could learn how to sew and make clothes to be sold in Leticia´s store

loans.name: Bhagawati Mahila Samuha Group

texts.en: MESP, a non-governmental organization in the Deoghar District of Jharkhand, offers a combination of small loans and participatory education to women who share the common goals of eliminating poverty and empowering themselves. Kavita is one of these women. She is the leader of “Bhagawati Mahila Samuha” Self-Help Group, which includes four other women. Kavita is married and has three children who all are studying in school. Her husband is a carpenter, but his income is not adequate to pay for the family's expenses, so she started her tailoring business 10 years ago. Now there is good demand, so she wants to improve her production. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine. She wants to be certain to please her clients and generate enough income to give a good education to her children, which is her ultimate dream. Along with Kavita, other group members are also requesting loans to improve their livelihoods. They are thankful to the investors for their kindness and generosity in providing capital for the loans.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Carla

texts.en: Carla is a 20-year old college undergraduate and lives in Bago City. She is a single parent of a 1-year old child. Her father works as a jeepney driver in Bacolod City, and her mother is a housewife. Their family is supported by her sister in Germany, and their total monthly income is Php16,000.00 ($364). Carla knows that she has to find means to support herself and her child and also help her parents, but she didn't have the means until she learned about the 2-month training program of Bagosphere that could lead to a call center job. She needs your assistance in paying for her tuition.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for two plows.

loans.name: Elnie

texts.en: Elnie is a 39-year old college graduate and lives in La Carlota City. She is married to Tomas, who works as a tricycle driver. They have 2 daughters, one is 10 y.o. and the other is 2. Their total monthly family income is only Php 5,000.00 ($114). Elnie wants to help her spouse and saw the opportunity when she learned about the 2-month training program of Bagosphere that could lead to a call center job. She has passed Bagosphere's selection process, but has no means to pay for her tuition. Your help in financing this will allow her to soon provide more for her family,

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Marshe

texts.en: Marshe is a 22-year old vocational graduate and lives in Bago City. She belongs to a family of 8. Her father is an electrician in Bacolod City and her mother is a housewife. Marshe has 5 siblings. her eldest sister is in college, her 2nd brother is in high school and her other siblings are still in elementary. Their total monthly family income of Php10,000.00 ($227) is barely enough to provide for their basic needs. This motivates Marshe to find means to help the family have more income that's why she braved the selection process of Bagosphere and successfully passed it to qualify for the 2-month training program that could lead to a call center job. Apart from helping her family, Marshe also dreams to continue her studies and have a stable job. Your generosity in funding her loan will help Marshe have a better income in the coming months.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar home system

loans.name: Nada

texts.en: Nada is 39 years old from Baniswef. She is married with a son and two daughters all in school. Her husband is a mosque crier with a very small salary that could not cover even the family's basic needs. Nada knew that many women in her village have requested loans from TADE, started different projects and have been paying back successfully. So she decided to request a 3000 EPG loan herself to buy clothes to start a women's and children's clothing project in her house.

loans.use: To buy clothes to start a women and children clothing project.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea is from  Banteay Chmar, a village in the North-West of Cambodia.

She is 41 years old and lives in a wooden one floor house with her mother. 

In 2000 she started to work for Soieries du Mékong, a social company which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village.
Sophea makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for the house expenses and help her old mother in her daily life.  

Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the preparation of her loom, that includes the dyeing of the silk threads.

Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 39 years old from Baniswef. He is married with two sons and two daughters and works as a part-time farmer. Four years ago, Mohamad's father passed away and his younger sister and mother moved in to live with him. Ahmad is the only breadwinner of the family. He and his family's living conditions became disappointing and the farming income could not cover the family's expenses or the expenses of his sister's marriage preparation. However, Mohammad has never been a quitter; he decided to start a small fattening project as he has a suitable place in his house for that. He saved some money and purchased a calf but he needs more money to buy an adult head of cattle to feed the calf and to use its milk for sale. Mohammad's wife, mother and sister will use the milk to make dairy products for sale to neighbors and for family use. So he requested a 5000 EPG loan to buy a head of cattle.

loans.use: To buy a head of cattle to feed his calf and use the milk for sale.

loans.name: Goma

texts.en: Goma is 33 years old from Baniswef. He is married with two sons in elementary school. He works at grocery store and makes very low income that can't cover his family's basic needs. He decided to start his own grocery store in a suitable place in his house so he requested a 1000 EPG loan from TADE to buy some vegetables such as tomatoes, lettuce, and potatoes. Goma believes this project will improve his family's living condition and quality of life.

loans.use: To buy some vegetables such as tomatoes, lettuce, and potatoes.

loans.name: Pek

texts.en:
PEK is 29 years old. 
She comes from  Banteay Chmar, a village in the North-West of Cambodia where she lives in a wooden one floor house with her husband and their 2 children. 
Her family owns 3 hectares of rice field where she goes to help her husband when she has time.
In 2002 she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village.
PEK makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for the fertilizer she uses in her fields and family expenses. Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditionnal hand woven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees

loans.name: Mona

texts.en: Mona is 28 years old from Baniswef. She is married with four children; the oldest is in elementary school. Since her husband is a part-time electrician and the money he makes could not cover the family's expenses, Mona decided to start a small beauty salon business. Mona passed a hairdressing training held by TADE, so she requested a 1000 EPG loan to buy a flat iron, hair drier, and some hairdressing tools for her project.

loans.use: To buy a flat iron, hair drier, and some hairdressing tools.

loans.name: Ragab

texts.en: Ragab is 46 years old from Baniswef. He is married with 3 sons in preparatory and secondary schools. He sells fruits and vegetables but his monthly income can't cover his children's education expenses so he decided to expand his business to increase his income. Ragab requested a 3000 EPG loan from TADE to buy new kinds of fruits and vegetables such as oranges, bananas, apples and tangerines. He believes that this loan will increase his sales and help him afford proper education for his children. Since he didn't benefit from any education, Ragab wishes his children have a better life and education than his own.

loans.use: To buy new kinds of fruits and vegetables such as oranges, apples and tangerines to afford education for his children.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana has been growing vegetables for 13 years. She grows tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbage and peppers. 

With a previous loan she built a new greenhouse. It helped her to get a big harvest. This time Svetlana is asking for a loan of 30 000 UAH to buy film, seeds and fertilizers. She also hopes to do some repairs in old greenhouses and modernize the water system.

loans.use: to buy film, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Farangisi

texts.ru: Фарангиси молодая замужняя женщина в возрасте 22 лет. У нее есть двух летний сын. Ее муж работает таксистом. А Фарангиси работает в ателье портнихой. Она наравне с мужем зарабатывает и старается улучшить условия жизни. Сейчас для Фарангиси и ее мужа необходимо закончить ремонт, чтобы сохранить дома тепло и уют. У них маленький ребенок для Фарангиси и ее мужа этот ремонт является необходимостью. Из-за того что у них закончились денежные средства, Фарангиси обратилась за кредитом. Она верит, что ей помогут и заранее благодарит Вас за помощь.
texts.en: Farangisi is a married young woman who is 22 years old. She has a two-year-old son. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Farangisi works in a dressmaker's shop. She earns a living on par with her husband and strives to improve her family's living conditions. Now Farangisi and her husband must finish repairs on their house in order to make it warm and comfortable. Because they have a young child, this repairwork is a necessity for them. Because they used up the last of their funds, Farangisi applied for a loan. She believes that she will be helped and thanks you in advance for the assistance.

loans.use: to finish home repairs.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona, el joven vive en casa propia con su esposo  y esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The young man who has his face pixelated is 23 years old and lives in a high risk area. He has made a living at agriculture for several years and markets his products around the area. He lives in his own house with his spouse.  

He is asking for a loan in order to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pest control, etc. As a result, he will improve the land shown in the picture, continue his work, and earn higher incomes.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pest control, etc and improve the land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy some supplies for her sewing workshop like textile and yarn.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a 54-year-old, divorced mother of one child. For a year, she has worked in a grocery shop to cover the needs and expenses of her family.
Samar is a hard worker and a sacrificing mother who is trying her best to provide her family with better living conditions, and so today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay the wedding costs of her only son.
Samar hopes her son will have a successful future, and she hopes to open her own grocery shop in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay her son's wedding expenses

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María es una mujer que cuenta con 52 años de vida y se gana la vida desde hace 10 años, con la venta de productos de primera necesidad, actividad que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos y su nuera, por lo que aunque su vivienda es humilde se siente feliz de poder ofrecerles un lugar donde vivir. María desea invertir en su negocio y es para ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: leche en polvo, detergente, cereales, champú, jabón, huevos, pan dulce, café, especies, etc. Para que su negocio cuente con más y mejores productos que llamen a mayor cantidad de clientes.
texts.en:
María is a 52-year-old woman who has made a living for 10 years selling daily necessities, a business which has permitted her to move her family ahead in life.  She lives in her own home with her 2 children and her daughter in law, and even though it's a humble home she is happy that she can offer them a place to live.  

María wants to invest in her business and so she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy powdered milk, detergent, cereal, shampoo, soap, eggs, sweet bread, coffee, and spices, among other products.  This way she can stock her business with more products of better quality to bring in more customers.

loans.use: to buy powdered milk, detergent, cereal, shampoo, soap, eggs, sweet bread, coffee, and spices, among other things

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es: María de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella posee desde hace varios años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, María está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María, age 45, lives in her own house with her two children.  She has had a small store at her house for several years.  She has a lot of customers because of the good price and the friendly way that she sells.

María is requesting a loan to be able to buy more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, and sweet bread, etc.  This way she will be able to have better earnings in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, and sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, who is in her mid 30s, is married and has two children who are still in school.  She has had two businesses, tailoring and selling fabrics, for three years now.  She works from 7am to 10pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Elizabeth's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to buy sewing equipment and to buy more materials for making more dresses.  She has paid back her loan successfully.  She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support.  She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses.  

Elizabeth will use this loan to buy up-to-date  materials for making  better dresses and to increase on her fabric stock to resell.  She dreams of having more tailors and open another sewing branch.

Elizabeth will make sure she pays back the loan at the scheduled time.

loans.use: buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Iliana Marisol

texts.es: Iliana es una mujer de 25 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida desde hace 6 años. Ella es una joven trabajadora que se gana la vida con la venta de frutas y verduras, pero además buscado obtener mejores ingresos vende ropa para dama desde hace 2 años. Iliana desea invertir más en su negocio de venta de ropa, verduras y fruta, ya que sabe que si contara con más productos para ofrecer sus ganancias fueran mejores, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ropa para dama, frutas y verduras y así mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Iliana is a 25-year-old woman who has been living in her own house with her partner for 6 years. She is a young hard-working woman who makes a living by selling fruits and vegetables. She has also earned a better income by selling women’s clothing for 2 years, since she knows that if she sells more products, her earnings will be better. 

Because of this, she requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in women’s clothing, fruits, and vegetables to improve her business.

loans.use: to invest in women's clothing, fruits, and vegetables.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es: Doña Rosa vende en el mercado de la ciudad de Granada uno de los departamento del país, en donde comercializa queso, granos básicos, productos enlatados entre otros, esta labor la empezó con pocos productos ahora cuenta con un aumento considerable en su inventario, con mucho trabajo y empeño saco adelante a sus hijos quienes en la actualidad son mayores de edad e independientes. Doña Rosa solicita el crédito para continuar invirtiendo en su negocio, para tener variedad y sobre todo suficientes productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Doña Rosa sells at a market in the city of Granada, which is in one of the departments in Nicaragua. She sells cheese, basic grains, canned goods, and other products. Rosa started her business with a few products and now she has increased her inventory considerably. Through hard work and effort, she has been able to help her children get ahead. They are now grown and independent.

Doña Rosa is requesting a loan so that she can continue investing in her business. As a result, she can have variety and, above all else, a sufficient supply of products that she can offer to her customers.

loans.use: to invest in her business so that she can acquire a variety of products to offer to her customers, thereby maintaining her income and household expenses.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is thankful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan, which she used to pay for fertilizer and farm inputs for her business. Aside from her farm, she is also a jeepney operator. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.  

She would now like to apply for 19,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for a more productive crop. It will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial assistance that will be given to her. She wishes everyone a Blessed Christmas!

Felipa dreams of having a bigger farm in order to uplift their quality of life. She hopes for her children to pursue their studies until College. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nahashon

texts.en:
Nahashon is 30 years old. He is single and has no children; however, he is supporting two sisters. One sister is in high school, and one is in primary school. Nahashon runs a food stall, a business he has done for the last one year, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 40,000.

For his first loan with VisionFund Kenya, he has requested a loan of 50,000 KES, which he will use entire loan  to repair the business premises and purchase food ingredients like cooking oil,wheat flour and sugar.

With the anticipated profits, he wants to open a new food stall in order to increase his income. His hopes and dreams for the future are to be successful in life and to see his siblings educated.

loans.use: to enlarge his food stall and purchase cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Her name is Perla, 39, resident of Silang, Cavite Philippines. She is married to Roger, a mason, and they have one child who is still in the Elementary Level in school. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal, household needs and to send her child to school. 

Perla operates a general store for five years already. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this she also has a vegetable farm. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 1000 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as sacks of rice, charcoal, soda and other grocery stuff. She expects an increased demand of grocery items in preparation of the Christmas Holiday. She will use part of the loan to buy fertilizer for a good harvest on her farm. Her earnings are their source to meet their daily expense and to send her child to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her.  She wishes everyone a Blessed Christmas!

Perla aims to expand her store to improve her income and their standard of living. She would like her child to get a good education until College. She faithfully meets up with co-fellowship* member to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages, and toiletries to sell, and pay for farm fertilizer as well.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is thankful that she was granted a 16,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy a new boat for her fishing business. By God's grace, her family was able to recover from the Haiyan typhoon that hit their area last year. Her earnings from selling sea cucumber help support her family and meet their daily basic needs 

She would like to apply now for a PHP 16,000 loan, which she will use to pay for the repair of her boat. It is important that her fishing boat is safe and in good condition, to ensure good harvest of sea cucumber. Her earnings from selling sea cucumber help cover her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial assistance that will be given to her. She wishes everyone a Blessed Christmas!

Loida dreams of buying another fishing boat to grow her business. She aims to send her children to school for a better future. She prays for guidance and protection from God for her family and her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for repair of her boat used for her fishing.

loans.name: Batma

texts.ru: Батма досрочно погасила свой кредит, она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день, в хозяйстве Батмы есть 2 коровы, 10 овец. Батма  является членом группы "Эки Орук", в которой кроме нее состоят еще два человека.  Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Батма обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 85,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку 14 овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Батма планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Batma repaid her loan early and is grateful to the Kiva Fund and everyone, who had helped her with the financing. Today, Batma's farm contains 2 cows and 10 sheep. Batma is a member of the "Eki Oruk" group that, besides her, consists of two more people. The monthly income amounts to 15,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Batma requested a loan from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank in the amount of 85,000 som (KGS) to buy 14 sheep in order to increase her livestock headcount. Batma plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her livestock quantities.

loans.use: to buy 14 sheep for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Vivilita

texts.en:
Vivilita is 39 years old and married with five children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Vivilita runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, groceries, etc..

Vivilita has been in this business for nine years, and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Vivilita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Luz Miryam

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer de 29 años de edad, madre de un hijo de 4 años y que emplea en su negocio a 4 personas, su actividad como tal se centra en la venta de jugos y ensaladas de frutas y gracias a su hermana puede tener este negocio pues fue ella quien le enseño y la motivo a montar su frutería.
Ahora quiere solicitar un crédito su razón es que quiere hacer de su negocio un espacio para jóvenes y adultos en el cual puedan disfrutar de un sano producto y tratar diferentes temas, por ello invertirá en adecuaciones locativas dándole una perspectiva acogedora y empresarial a su frutería, también quiere invertir en la compra de variedad de frutas impresionando a sus clientes con sabores y combinaciones poco vistas en Antioquia.
texts.en:
Luz is a woman of 29; she is the mother of one four-year-old child and she employs four people at her business, which is selling juices and fruit salads.  It is thanks to her sister that she has this business, as she was the one who showed her how and motivated her to set up her shop.  

She currently wants to request a loan because she wants to make her business a space for young people and adults to enjoy a healthy product and have discussions.  For this reason, she will invest in changes to her space to give a comfortable and professional appearance to her business; she also wants to invest in a variety of fruits to impress her customers with flavors and combinations rarely seen in Antioquia.

loans.use: to make changes to her space, giving a comfortable and different touch to her business.

loans.name: Sara Dolores

texts.es: Solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para su negocio, arroz, verduras, frijoles, maíz, bebidas, vegetales, carnes y demás para mantener bien abastecido el negocio ya que sirve desayunos, almuerzos y cenas. Sara espera sus hijos terminen de estudiar para sentir que cumplió como madre.
texts.en: Sara is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her business such as rice, greens, beans, corn, drinks, vegetables, meat and other items in order to keep her business well supplied as she serves breakfasts, lunches, and dinners. Sara hopes that her children finish school so that she will feel fulfilled as a mother.

loans.use: to buy rice, greens, beans, corn, drinks, vegetables, meat, and other things to keep her store well supplied.

loans.name: Jackleen

texts.en:
Jackleen is a conservative 22 year old lady so she asked her sister Izdihar to appear in the photo instead of her.

Jackleen is the older sister who was raised like her sisters in that they need to support each other all the way. She had her chance to go to university, and now it is Izdihar’s turn.

Izdihar is majoring in Managerial Information Systems and is facing some issues in paying for her university fees, so Jackleen decided to apply for a loan to help her sister pay the fees to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay her sister's fees to continue with her studies.

loans.name: Florentina's Group

texts.en: Florentina, Adela y Marcelo live near to Ometepec- Guerreo in a small indigenous community without electricity. Florentina is an artisan and sews traditional clothing (huipil). She spends USD$3.5 per week in candles to light her house after sunset. She believes that a small solar system will help her being more economically productive because she will be able to work a couple of hours more per day (especially during winter) thanks to reliable light, and her children would come back home earlier to study at nights instead of staying longer hours at school. She will also be able to save the money invested in candles once she pays for the cost of the system.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will substitute the use of expensice candles with clean, durable and reliable energy

loans.name: Yaha

texts.en:
Yaha is a maize farmer from Gwani village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Yaha would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, she can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest.

Yaha, like other members of Babban Gona,is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for her family, and hopes to become one of the most profitable farmers in her community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ricardo´s Group

texts.en: Ricardo and Clementina live in an indigenous community in Puebla. Ricardo is a farmer; he cultivates corn and raises chicken. He used to have a small solar home system  that someone donated him but it was not well maintained so it was not longer working. He currently spends USD$ 5 in candles every week. By fixing the solar system he will be able to replace the use of candles with save and clean light. His wife will cook more comfortably dinner while he threshes corn to sell it in bulk. He is happy to know his eyes will be less tired  when working at nights and he and his family will feel safer at nights.
